finding: The hypertension-associated SNP rs3735533 in the HOTTIP locus had a lower odds ratio of 1.07 in the top quartile of CVD topic weight compared to 1.13 in the bottom quartile, indicating a difference in association.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: The study found that rs4731702 had a maternal-specific association with HDL-C levels, TC/HDL-C ratios, and triglyceride levels. It was located near the maternally expressed KLF14 gene and was in high linkage disequilibrium (r^2=0.97) with the 7:130738173:T:C variant that exhibited similar maternal-specific associations.
title: Genome-wide survey of parent-of-origin specific associations across clinical traits derived from electronic health records

finding: The sentinel variant rs35443123 was indicated as a significant variant for short-term varenicline effectiveness (SVE), underlining its relevance to treatment outcomes.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: The variant rs6943555 in the AUTS2 gene was associated with schizophrenia in a Turkish male population. This indicates a potential role of AUTS2 in the genetic underpinnings of psychiatric disorders, specifically schizophrenia. The study highlighted the impact of this SNP on neurological conditions, aligning with previous findings regarding the functional implications of AUTS2, which include deficits in neurodevelopment.
title: Cerebral Organoids Containing an AUTS2 Missense Variant Model Microcephaly

finding: The variant rs1990621 was associated with an increased neuronal proportion. This finding was significant as it was a protective variant linked to frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTLD), which suggests a notable relationship between this SNP and neurodegenerative processes.
title: New insights on the genetic etiology of Alzheimer’s and related dementia

finding: Linked to a 323 bp Alu deletion in exon 8 of TMEM106B at R2=0.92. This deletion correlated with intronic variants of TMEM106B, which are associated with AD risk and also provide protection against frontotemporal dementia, underlining the importance of structural variation in neurodegenerative disease.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: Similar to SNP rs5011436, this SNP was associated with a 323 bp Alu deletion in TMEM106B, indicating its involvement in Alzheimer's disease through structural variations that affect this gene's functionality.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The rs60871478 variant, located in the intronic region of DNAAF5 (also known as HEATR2), was found to be associated with increased levels of CSF p-tau across all disease states (AD, PD, and controls). This finding was novel and suggested a potential role of DNAAF5 in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: The SNP rs45446698 was found to be female-specific near the CYP3A7 gene, reinforcing its unique role in female BMD characteristics.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs34029083 was linked to the locus around CACNA2D1, showing association with 13 autoencoder-derived features. Despite being previously unassociated at a genome-wide level with any ophthalmic phenotype, this finding highlighted the potential of the gene as a drug target for glaucoma.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides epidemiologically informative biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs1527479 in the CD36 promoter was associated with insulin resistance and type 2 diabetes (T2D) in human studies, indicating a significant role of CD36 variants in glucose metabolism.
title: Microvascular insulin resistance associates with enhanced muscle glucose disposal in CD36 deficiency

finding: A rare nonsense mutation known as rs56381858 was identified in a Caucasian pedigree and linked to autosomal dominant T2D, highlighting a direct genomic influence on diabetes risk.
title: Microvascular insulin resistance associates with enhanced muscle glucose disposal in CD36 deficiency

finding: SNP rs17236824, located within 1 MB of the transcription start site of CD36, showed association with T2D and its renal, ophthalmic, and neurological complications, suggesting its relevance in the broader context of diabetes complications.
title: Microvascular insulin resistance associates with enhanced muscle glucose disposal in CD36 deficiency

finding: The coding SNP rs3211938 (G/T) was associated with CD36 deficiency in African Americans, with carriers showing approximately 50% reduced CD36 levels, which contributed to altered insulin sensitivity and glucose disposal.
title: Microvascular insulin resistance associates with enhanced muscle glucose disposal in CD36 deficiency

finding: The rs60871478 variant at the 7p22 locus, which was identified as a top hit for the intronic variant of DNAAF5 (also known as HEATR2), was associated with increased levels of phosphorylated tau (p-tau) across all studied diseases.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: This SNP mapped to <italic>EIF4HP1</italic> illustrated relevance in determining prostate cancer outcomes.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The candidate causal variant rs45446698 at the 7q22.1 locus was linked to decreased expression of CYP3A7 and was associated with increased total and bioavailable testosterone levels in women and estradiol levels in men. This variant was highlighted as a potentially functional variant that may influence endometrial cancer risk.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study identifies novel endometrial cancer risk loci that are associated with obesity or female testosterone levels

finding: This SNP associated with reduced risk of T2D and favorable lipid profiles (higher HDL and lower TG), indicating a beneficial impact on metabolic traits.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs13245012 variant at the PPIA-H2AZ2-PURB locus conferred an increased risk for ASXL1-associated CH (OR = 1.20 [1.13-1.27], P = 1.60 x 10^-9).
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The minor C-allele at rs4410790 was associated with a lower intake of cereal (beta=-0.038, 95% CIs=[-0.052, -0.024], P=4.40E-08) and a higher intake of coffee (beta=0.120, 95% CIs=[0.110, 0.130], P=4.71E-131). This SNP was linked with increased body mass index (BMI) due to higher coffee intake, indicating that it might influence metabolic health outcomes.
title: Increased brain volume from higher cereal and lower coffee intake: Shared genetic determinants and impacts on cognition and metabolism

finding: The SNP rs12707188 on chromosome 7q33 was associated with both umbilical and diaphragmatic hernia, demonstrating genome-wide significance, with the risk allele for umbilical hernia being protective for diaphragmatic hernia.
title: Comprehensive genome-wide association study of different forms of hernia identifies more than 80 associated loci

finding: The SNP rs10224499 was identified as tagging the ELN gene on 7q11.23, relevant for encoding elastin, which is crucial for the elastic properties of connective tissues and associated with hernia susceptibility.
title: Comprehensive genome-wide association study of different forms of hernia identifies more than 80 associated loci

finding: this SNP related to PDE1C showed significant association with addictive behaviors.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: associated with FOXP2 and highlighted its role in genetic risk factors for addiction.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: Significant effects on SBP were reported for the rs113952142 variant in relation to LTST interaction (P_GxE=1.8×10^-6), associated with SDK1.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The rs221783 variant associated with decreased glucose levels (p = 1.8 × 10^-11, effect = -0.03 SD) and decreased HbA1c levels (p = 3.6 × 10^-7, effect = -0.02 SD). It also linked to increased cholesterol (p = 7.0 × 10^-12, effect = 0.03 SD), decreased risk of Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) diagnosis (p = 0.005, OR = 0.96), and decreased risk of hypothyroidism (p = 6.95 × 10^-7, OR = 0.92). The T allele was found to be the effect allele associated with these traits, and this association replicated in Biobank Japan and FinnGen studies, highlighting the role of GIGYF1 in glucose metabolism and diabetes risk.
title: Gene-level analysis of rare variants in 363,977 whole exome sequences identifies an association of GIGYF1 loss of function with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs199347, associated with GPNMB, was one of the identified SNPs linked to 'moderate' PD progression, suggesting that its allele influenced the progression pattern.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs45446698 was found to be genome-wide significant in both males and females, mapping to the gene CYP3A7. It was the most significant eQTL for CYP3A7 in the adrenal gland and was associated with expression levels of CYP3A7 while inversely related to estradiol levels.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: The SNP rs1064794328 was significantly associated with long telomere length (mTL) in carriers, who were found to have an average mTL that was 422 bp longer than that of the wildtype population, with a 95% confidence interval of 24 bp to 821 bp and a p-value of 0.038. This association supported the hypothesis that variants in POT1 were linked to a predisposition for longer telomeres.
title: Long-telomeropathy is associated with tumor predisposition syndrome

finding: Similar to rs1064794328, the SNP rs947005337 was considered in the context of POT1 variants, which were previously linked to long telomeres. The study confirmed that individuals with these variants displayed longer telomeres, aligning with the findings related to the aforementioned SNPs.
title: Long-telomeropathy is associated with tumor predisposition syndrome

finding: The SNP rs587777476 was also part of the POT1 variant group, where carriers were associated with increased telomere length. This contributed to the overall evidence that POT1 variants, including this SNP, played a role in supporting longer telomeres linked with a cancer-predisposing syndrome.
title: Long-telomeropathy is associated with tumor predisposition syndrome

finding: Identified as a novel locus linked to hypothyroidism, rs13238252 was associated with specific genes relevant to thyroid biology.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Acted as a tag SNP for Kell blood group antigen, demonstrating a positive association with K antigen and blood donorship (noted in the context of larger associations).
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The rs113993960 variant, associated with the CFTR F508del mutation, was identified in a large genetic cohort of 181,776 participants from the All of Us database. PheWAS conducted on this cohort, adjusted for age, sex, and genetic principal components, revealed significant phenotype associations related to cystic fibrosis.
title: PheWAS analysis on large-scale biobank data with PheTK

finding: The rs4731702 SNP, located at the KLF14 locus, was associated with type 2 diabetes as a cis-eQTL for the KLF14 transcription factor. It was linked to the expression of 385 target genes in trans, suggesting a regulatory role in metabolic traits.
title: USP18 modulates lupus risk via negative regulation of interferon response

finding: The minor C-allele at rs4410790 was associated with lower intake of cereal (regression coefficient -0.038, P=4.40E-08) and higher intake of coffee (regression coefficient 0.120, P=4.71E-131). This SNP was crucial in establishing a genetic correlation between caffeine and cereal intake.
title: Increased brain volume from cereal, decreased brain volume from coffee -- shared genetic determinants and impacts on cognitive function, body mass index (BMI) and other metabolic measures: cohort study of UK Biobank participants

finding: The CYP3A5 rs776746 variant (TT homozygotes) had a significant association with increased chronic kidney disease risk (HR 2.12, p=0.002) and was also linked to a higher likelihood of changing antihypertensive treatment (HR 1.59, p=0.02).
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: Individuals with the ABCB1 rs2032582 AA homozygote variant were more likely to experience edema after treatment (HR 1.65, p=0.03).
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: CYP3A4 rs2740574 CC homozygotes had an increased risk for kidney disease compared to common homozygotes (HR 1.14, p=0.04).
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: Located in NPC1L1, which encodes a key mediator of cholesterol absorption, rs41279633 was associated with CAD and identified as having strong biological priors.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: This variant was linked to the regulatory region of HDAC9, illustrating its potential role in CAD through transcriptional regulation.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The SNP rs2070744 in NOS3 was found to be associated only with early T2D diagnosis, indicating its specific role in the genetic predisposition to early-onset T2D.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs4410790, which lies in the AHR gene region, was also examined and demonstrated a significant association with fasting plasma caffeine levels. Similarly to rs2472297, this finding supported the genetic influence on caffeine metabolism and its implications for BMI assessment, reinforcing the argument for using cis-Mendelian randomization approaches in pharmacological studies over behavioral proxies.
title: Comparison of caffeine consumption behavior with plasma caffeine levels as exposures in drug-target Mendelian randomization and implications for interpreting effects on obesity

finding: The SNP rs10486483, associated with Crohn's Disease, originally had a credible set of 85 variants. After applying a FDR threshold of 0.10 using the Trait Specific Annotation Based Locus (TSABL) model, this credible set was reduced to just 3 variants, indicating a significant prioritization of likely causal variants.
title: TSABL: Trait Specific Annotation Based Locus Predictor

finding: The SNP rs6466720 was associated with the EBV amino acid variant BRLF1:p.Lys316Glu. It had a p-value of 6.85×10^-11 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.41. BRLF1 is involved in the lytic reactivation of EBV from latency, indicating that this SNP is relevant to viral transcription and possibly tumorigenesis, as related variations have been previously implicated in nasopharyngeal and gastric carcinomas.
title: The influence of human genetic variation on Epstein-Barr virus sequence diversity

finding: Identified in the Pain Questionnaire cohort and also replicated in the fibromyalgia cohort, indicating its relevance to both conditions.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: This SNP (GTF2I) was replicated in recent heart failure GWAS, affirming its association with heart failure.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: The SNP rs62474683 also achieved genome-wide significance in relation to suicide attempts, with a p-value of 1.91×10⁻¹⁰. This SNP remained significant even after controlling for other psychiatric disorders, indicating its relevance to suicidal behavior.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis of suicide attempt in 43,871 cases identifies twelve genome-wide significant loci

finding: The SNP rs2282989 was significantly associated with neutrophil cell count, indicating its potential role in the immune response during critical illness due to COVID-19.
title: Neutrophils cause critical illness in COVID-19 and reveal CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: The SNP rs42041 showed a significant association with neutrophil cell count, further supporting its involvement in the immune overreaction in critically ill patients with COVID-19.
title: Neutrophils cause critical illness in COVID-19 and reveal CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: The SNP rs42030 was associated with neutrophil cell count and could be implicated in mechanisms related to immune response in critically ill COVID-19 patients.
title: Neutrophils cause critical illness in COVID-19 and reveal CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: The SNP rs78366656 displayed a significant association with neutrophil cell count, reinforcing its potential relevance as a genetic factor in the immune overreactive response in severe COVID-19 cases.
title: Neutrophils cause critical illness in COVID-19 and reveal CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: This SNP, associated with the Kell blood group antigen, was positively linked to K antigen expression, indicating its significance in blood group contribution to blood donors.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The variant was shown to regulate protein levels of KLK11, suspected to be involved in carcinogenesis.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The SNP rs2107448 was associated with the SP4 gene, which was identified by six post-GWAS approaches, highlighting its significance in the regulation of astrocytes and GABAergic neurons, further connecting it to the biological mechanisms underlying bipolar disorder.
title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

finding: Linked to pituitary gland volume (β = 0.03), this SNP is expressed during spermatogenesis, connecting it to reproductive hormone regulation.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs4410790 was reported at the AGR3-AHR locus and had been previously associated with coffee consumption, confirming its relevance.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs799166, linked to the MLXIPL-VPS37D locus, was previously identified in the CCGC study and was associated with increased coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs17685, positioned in the POR locus, was confirmed as significant in previous studies regarding coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The EPHA1:rs11762262-A variant was acknowledged as protective against Alzheimer's disease.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The RELN:rs201731543-C variant was confirmed as resilient among the evaluated variants.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The variant rs6461378 (g.842031C>T; SUN1 H118Y) was identified as the top steatosis-associated variant in a meta-analysis involving over 120,000 participants. It was positively associated with hepatic steatosis and showed significant associations with metabolic traits related to NASH including increased serum fatty acids, insulin resistance, and cardiovascular disease. In cell culture studies, the H118Y variant demonstrated increased proteasomal degradation compared to wild-type SUN1, leading to decreased insulin sensitivity and greater lipid accumulation.
title: A common variant that alters SUN1 degradation associates with hepatic steatosis and metabolic traits in multiple cohorts

finding: In SS patients, NUBI expression decreased with the dose of the minor A-allele of rs77466830, pointing to its role in regulating gene expression specifically within the context of SS.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The variant rs4489253, located on chromosome 7, exhibited a strong association with ITR, shown by a p-value of 8.39x10^-6. It was associated with robust odds ratios of 3.516, providing significant insights into the genetic factors affecting treatment response.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: This variant was associated with aortic root diameter and aortic valve mean gradient and was located at an enhancer predicted to regulate the elastin gene (ELN), a critical extracellular matrix protein linked to supravalvular aortic stenosis and valve defects, indicating its role in valve structuring.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The SNP rs11982272, located in the gene MAD1L1, was identified as a shared risk locus between Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) and disruptive behavior disorders (DBD). Although it was reported to have only a moderate association with ADHD in a large genome-wide association study (GWAS), the finding was significant in the context of MAD1L1, which has been implicated in various psychiatric disorders, including schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
title: Integrative multi-omics analysis of genomic, epigenomic, and metabolomics data leads to new insights for Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder

finding: The rs1990622 variant was found to be associated with protection against frontotemporal lobar degeneration with TAR DNA binding protein inclusions (FTLD-TDP), revealing an odds ratio of 0.61 and a significance level of p = 1.08×10^-11. This finding indicated a potential protective role of TMEM106B against this specific form of neurodegenerative disease.
title: An AluYb8 retrotransposon characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The rs13237518 variant was associated with a protective effect against Alzheimer's disease, presenting an odds ratio of 0.96 and a significance of p = 4.90×10^-11. This suggested that variations in the TMEM106B locus could influence the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease.
title: An AluYb8 retrotransposon characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The SNP rs80308281 was linked to retinal D<sub>f</sub> and is associated with the SLC12A9 gene, reported to be connected to arterial blood pressure and heart rate, with a P-Value of 1.51 x 10<sup>-10</sup>.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian randomization study implicates inflammaging biomarkers in retinal vasculature, cardiometabolic diseases and longevity

finding: The study identified the variant associated with rs3789806 in a 5% variant allele frequency (VAF) context using nanopore sequencing (NS) with a mixture of human cell line genomic DNA. The improvement in calling somatic single-base mutations with the formulation allowed the variant to be detected above the typical error rate.
title: Oncogene Concatenated Enriched Amplicon Nanopore Sequencing for Rapid, Accurate, and Affordable Somatic Mutation Detection

finding: Similar to rs3789806, the variant at rs9648696 was detected at a 5% VAF under the NS method. The high error rates of nanopore sequencing initially complicated the detection, but by utilizing a variant read fraction subtraction technique, the mutation became significantly detectable.
title: Oncogene Concatenated Enriched Amplicon Nanopore Sequencing for Rapid, Accurate, and Affordable Somatic Mutation Detection

finding: Located in the ABCB4 gene, this SNP was found to have a very potent effect (OR=1.87) on cALT risk, highlighting its relevance in hepatocyte lipid transport and potential disease processes.
title: A genome-wide association study of chronic ALT-based non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in the Million Veteran Program with histological and radiological validation

finding: The variant rs61730509 (Ala934Thr) was highly linked to rs115038698, indicating a significant role in the increased risk of cALT within African-American populations.
title: A genome-wide association study of chronic ALT-based non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in the Million Veteran Program with histological and radiological validation

finding: The SNP rs10276547 was highlighted as significant in the context of chromosomal mapping related to Kawasaki disease, specifically showing relevance in the 3D chromatin interaction analysis.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: This SNP was linked to the NDUFA5 gene and identified as having significant biological implications for Kawasaki disease through eQTL analysis, indicating its role in gene expression changes.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The rs141647689 variant in SDK1 was linked to urinary bladder cancer, also showing significant association with prostate cancer, with an odds ratio of 9.29 and a p-value of 3.45×10^-6.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The intergenic SNP rs13239597 was validated as an allele-specific enhancer for IRF5, a key gene associated with SLE. It played a significant regulatory role, enhancing IRF5 expression in immune cells.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The SNP rs4917014, located in the IKZF1 gene, had a trans-eQTL effect with 50 target genes, many of which were immune-related and associated with SLE, highlighting its role in immune regulation.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The SNP rs201802880, affecting the NCF1 gene, resulted in protein destabilization due to mutation at a conserved site, implicating its importance in immune response through NADPH oxidase activity.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: This SNP located upstream of RNF32 was associated with pituitary gland volume (β = 0.03, SE = 0.01) and expressed during spermatogenesis, indicating its potential role in testosterone-related pathways.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs2072443 was identified as a significant loss-of-function variant in TMEM176B, which adversely affected IL-1β release in primary human monocytes and monocyte-derived macrophages, and partially in lymphocytes. This finding connected TMEM176B to the modulation of the NLRP3 inflammasome in these leukocyte types, providing insight into its role within the context of colorectal cancer (CRC), where TMEM176B's expression inversely correlates with NLRP3 levels.
title: Inverse correlation between NLRP3 and TMEM176B as a possible tool for colorectal cancer progression

finding: The SNP rs55789728, located in the MAD1L1 gene, was found to be a shared locus across the analyses, contributing to our understanding of genetic overlap.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs3918226, located within the intron of the NOS3 gene, exhibited a significant increase in association from GWAS analysis (P<sub>GWAS</sub> = 5.98×10<sup>-5</sup>) to MTAG analysis (P<sub>MTAG_HF</sub> = 1.09×10<sup>-22</sup>). It was confirmed with P<sub>MTAG_HF_R</sub> = 4.22×10<sup>-5</sup>.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs2528382 was identified as a significant eQTL for the gene URGCP, associated with tumor growth and progression. The finding emerged from multi-ancestry analysis using the SuShiE model, which successfully fine-mapped this SNP in mRNA data from TOPMed MESA. It was further validated in additional datasets including whole blood eQTL data from the eQTLGen Consortium and several studies focused on asthma. The rs2528382 SNP, a non-coding exon variant within the 5' UTR, was found to reside within a proximal enhancer region, indicated by H3K27ac signals, and was shown to localize within open chromatin regions in various immune cell types. This evidence collectively suggests that rs2528382 plays a functional role in regulating the expression levels of URGCP.
title: Improved multi-ancestry fine-mapping identifies cis-regulatory variants underlying molecular traits and disease risk

finding: The SNP rs3918226 was found within the intron of the NOS3 gene and was linked to heart failure. Its significance increased from the GWAS HF analysis (P GWAS = 5.98×10^-5) to the MTAG HF analysis (P MTAG HF = 1.09×10^-22). It replicated with P MTAG HF_R = 4.22×10^-5 and was also associated with systolic blood pressure and myocardial infarction.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: Found in GRM8 on chromosome 7, this SNP showed a significant p-value of 2.79E-08 and related to reward-related learning and memory in the context of smoking.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: There was significant association (p=2.10E-08) with the CACNA2D1 gene, previously related to nervousness and impulsive behaviors.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: Identified with a nominal association (p=5.50E-07) in FOXP2, associated with multiple behavioral traits related to impulsivity.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs144380855 reached genome-wide significance for gestational length (beta = -2.07, P = 5.3×10^-10), indicating its potential role in reducing gestational duration.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The SNP rs9065 at the PDIA4 locus had significant evidence of eQTL and sCJD risk colocalization, supporting its role in increased sCJD risk due to genetic upregulation of PDIA4 expression.
title: Multiomic Analyses Direct Hypotheses for Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease Risk Genes

finding: The missense variant rs75326924 was identified in relation to thyroid-stimulating hormone, providing new insights into its genetic implications in metabolism and disease.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The rs6968865 SNP within the AHR locus showed a discordant genome-wide significant association with increased difficulty awakening (β Conditional = 0.011, SE = 0.002, p = 3.20×10^-11) and morning chronotype (β Conditional = -0.04, SE = 0.006, p = 2.40×10^-10) in the conditional analysis, reflecting its role in both conditions and supporting its relevance in circadian functioning.
title: Sleep inertia drives the association of evening chronotype with psychiatric disorders: epidemiological and genetic evidence

finding: The lead SNP rs2107595 was identified as having a strong association with abdominal aortic calcification (AAC), with a p-value of 1.47x10^-20. This SNP disrupts a predicted transcription factor binding site, increasing the binding of NOTCH signaling protein RBPJ and is implicated in enhancing TWIST1 expression in vascular cells, which correlates with increased AAC and risk of cardiovascular diseases.
title: Calcification of abdominal aorta is a high risk underappreciated cardiovascular disease factor in a general population

finding: The rs57301765 SNP was noted to be in strong LD with rs2107595 and constituted part of the credible set for associations with cardiovascular disease and SBP. Its role in relation to AAC strengthened the findings associated with rs2107595, indicating overlapping genetic influences.
title: Calcification of abdominal aorta is a high risk underappreciated cardiovascular disease factor in a general population

finding: The rs7776725 SNP was associated with accelerated brain aging and mapped to the intron of FAM3C, a gene involved in pancreatic cancer and Alzheimer's disease, suggesting its relevance to specific brain aging modes.
title: Population clustering of structural brain aging and its association with brain development

finding: The SNP rs5011436, located in an intron of the TMEM106B gene, exhibited a significant negative association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) (B=-0.002, p=9.1×10−4) and a positive association with depression (B=0.007, p=3.2×10−9). This SNP was associated with various brain morphologies, showing significant relationships to the volume of the posterior corpus callosum (B=0.035, p=3.4×10−6), mid posterior corpus callosum (B=0.026, p=6.6×10−4), anterior corpus callosum (B=0.024, p=8.6×10−4), lower volume of the third ventricle (B=-0.025, p=5.0×10−6), and larger area of the inferior temporal gyrus (B=0.017, p=5.3×10−4). The findings illustrated that the C allele of this SNP conferred risk for depression while offering a protective effect against AD.
title: Genetic overlap between Alzheimer’s disease and depression mapped onto the brain

finding: The presence of the risk allele rs1990622 in the TMEM106B gene was associated with variability in the age at onset (AAO) of behavioural variant Frontotemporal Dementia (bvFTD). This finding demonstrated that pathological genetic mutations could affect the AAO in bvFTD, marking it as a significant genetic factor influencing disease onset.
title: Anterior cingulate sulcation is associated with onset and survival in frontotemporal dementia

finding: A significant association was noted between the variant rs45446698, located upstream of the CYP3A7 gene, and the metabolite 4-androsten-3alpha,17alpha-diol monosulfate (2). Individuals with the TT homozygote genotype had higher and more stable levels of this sulfated steroid compared to those with the TG heterozygote genotype.
title: Longitudinal analysis of genetic and environmental interplay in human metabolic profiles and the implication for metabolic health

finding: The eQTL rs11979881 in the ARMC10 gene was identified as a new evidence linking it causally to chronotype. It was not previously associated with this phenotype, making the finding novel.
title: Mendelian randomisation analysis using GWAS and eQTL data to investigate the relationship between chronotype and neuropsychiatric disorders and their molecular basis

finding: The SNP rs5011436 was in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the 343 bp deletion of an Alu element in the 3'UTR of the TMEM106B gene, which was previously identified as associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) clinical traits. This deletion was linked to decreased TMEM106B protein levels and demonstrated significant associations with multiple AD-related phenotypes, including tangle density and cognitive resilience.
title: Structural variants linked to Alzheimer’s Disease and other common age-related clinical and neuropathologic traits

finding: The SNP rs1800795, associated with the IL-6 gene, also exhibited significant effects on cognitive impairment in breast cancer patients, suggesting a role in the immune-inflammatory processes relevant to conditions like aMCI.
title: Is amnestic mild cognitive impairment a neuro-immune condition?

finding: This SNP was another significant finding linked with heart failure, corroborating its association as part of the identified loci in the study.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP remained significant at a stringent Bonferroni-corrected threshold, further underlining its relevance in the genetic landscape of heart failure.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs868824, intronic to IMMP2L, replicated the association with age at onset, showing a significant effect (β = -1.0935 years; p=4.31×10-4), highlighting its relevance in understanding the biological mechanisms related to MS.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The SNP rs73547325, a Leu1174Met variant in the MGAM2 gene, was classified as hypomorphic and was found in 18 IBS patients. Its presence positively correlated with the treatment response rate to the FODMAP-lowering diet, particularly in carriers who showed enhanced efficacy.
title: Functional variation in human Carbohydrate-Active enZYmes (hCAZymes) in relation to the efficacy of a FODMAP-reducing diet in IBS patients

finding: This SNP was involved in significant observations with sleep-related behavioral studies.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The minor allele of rs1990622 was associated with a protective effect against frontotemporal lobar dementia with TDP pathology (FTLD-TDP), with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.61. This SNV was recognized as a leading genome-wide association study (GWAS) hit which displayed significant linkage to a 322 base pair deletion in the 3' untranslated region of TMEM106B. Furthermore, it was established that rs1990622 acted as a protein quantitative trait locus (pQTL) influencing TMEM106B protein levels.
title: A 3’ UTR Deletion Is a Leading Candidate Causal Variant at the TMEM106B Locus Reducing Risk for FTLD-TDP

finding: Recognized as the strongest association within the AUTS2 gene relating to dyslexia, with evidence suggesting its regulatory role.
title: Discovery of 42 Genome-Wide Significant Loci Associated with Dyslexia

finding: The intergenic variant rs2699453 was identified in credible sets suggesting a possible influence on PAU risk.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The intergenic variant rs2098112 was part of the credible sets derived from fine-mapping, indicating a possible role in the genetics of PAU.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs4410790, linked to the AGR3-AHR locus, was confirmed as a previous finding by CCGC in relation to coffee consumption, maintaining its significance in the genetic landscape of coffee intake.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs799166, located at the MLXIPL-VPS37D locus, was also among the previously identified SNPs associated with coffee consumption, reaffirmed its established connection to the trait.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs1989903 indicated a significance with a p-value of 2.47×10⁻¹⁰ in the context of OUD-MTAG, suggesting associations with FOXP2 and providing insights into additional genetic contributions to OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: This SNP acted as a cis-eQTL for IKZF1, a transcription factor essential for B-cell development, reinforcing its role in immune function.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: The SNP rs573762901 was found to interact with LTST in its association with HDL-c levels, indicating a noteworthy genetic association in this context.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The SNP rs543672875 mapped to the ALKBH4 gene and showed an interaction with STST in relation to HDL-c levels, indicating a significant association.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: Related to the ATXN7L1 gene, this SNP was noted for its potential association with fatty acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: The SNP rs12666575, located in the MAD1L1 gene, was previously associated with an increased susceptibility to schizophrenia in a Chinese population, linking it to broader neurodevelopmental concerns. Its implication in neurodevelopmental delay was reiterated in the study, suggesting a mechanism where differential DNA methylation might explain the associations between prenatal tobacco and alcohol exposures and neurodevelopmental outcomes.
title: DNA Methylation as a Potential Mediator of the Association Between Prenatal Tobacco and Alcohol Exposure and Child Neurodevelopment in a South African Birth Cohort

finding: This SNP had significant relevance to PSA levels, enhancing understanding of genetic factors in prostate cancer detection.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs35000415 located at locus 7q32.1 was significantly associated with SLE, with a P-value of 1.9×10⁻⁴⁵. This SNP was highlighted as a significant marker for SLE across both European and Chinese populations.
title: Genome-wide Association Clustering Meta-analysis in European and Chinese Datasets for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus identifies new genes

finding: The rs6945340/HIP1 variant was associated with the largest number of enriched pathways (n=391 across all tissues), particularly highlighting the heart left ventricle. Notable pathways included the Krebs cycle and oxidative phosphorylation, with extremely low p-values (p=4.8×10−30 and p=3.2×10−5, respectively).
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The SNP rs2107448 was identified through multiple analyses and was associated with the SP4 gene, which demonstrated specific regulatory activity in astrocytes and GABAergic neurons related to bipolar disorder.
title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

finding: This SNP was part of a significant PW coding model where it exhibited a non-benign effect contributing to low glucose levels when located toward the 5’ end of the GCK gene.
title: A power-based sliding window approach to evaluate the clinical impact of rare genetic variants

finding: Similar to rs373418736, this SNP was identified in a significant PW coding model, associated with high glucose levels contrary to the effects of variants in another region of the GCK gene.
title: A power-based sliding window approach to evaluate the clinical impact of rare genetic variants

finding: The rs2897075_T allele, associated with increased risk for both IPF and COVID-19, showed a connection to decreased expression of TRIM4 and ZKSCAN1. TRIM4 is crucial for regulating interferon induction pathways in response to viral infections, suggesting that this genetic variant might influence the innate immune response relevant to both chronic lung disease and outcomes from SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Genetic overlap between idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and COVID−19

finding: The SNP rs34291892 within the ALDH1A2 gene showed a significant association, providing insights into its role in retinoic acid metabolism and knee pain, evidenced by a p-value of 1.69 × 10^-9.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP rs17139584 on chromosome 7 was identified as the most significant association with bacterial pneumonia (p = 1.21 × 10<sup>−36</sup>). This finding emphasized the involvement of the MET gene and the CFTR gene in conferring susceptibility to bacterial pneumonia, indicating multiple independent loci contributing to interindividual variability.
title: The genetic architecture of human infectious diseases and pathogen-induced cellular phenotypes

finding: The minor allele of rs76398985 was part of a super variant on Chromosome 7 associated with increased risk of COVID-19 related mortality (OR=1.594, p=5.47×10−9).
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was included in a super variant on Chromosome 7 linked to COVID-19 mortality (OR=1.594, p=5.47×10−9). Its association suggests significant implications in susceptibility to severe outcomes from COVID-19.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Contained within a super variant on Chromosome 7 associated with COVID-19 mortality (OR=1.594, p=5.47×10−9). This highlighted its importance in contributing to mortality risk.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Included in a super variant on Chromosome 7 linked to COVID-19 associated mortality (OR=1.594, p=5.47×10−9), suggesting its relevance in understanding COVID-19 severity.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was part of a significant super variant on Chromosome 7 (OR=1.594, p=5.47×10−9) associated with mortality from COVID-19.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Part of super variant chr7_151 (OR=1.594, p=5.47×10−9), indicating its potential impact on risk associated with COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: The SNP rs3807865 at chromosome 7 was significantly correlated with the broad phenotype of depression (β = 0.033, SE = 0.005, p = 4.74 × 10^-11), confirming earlier findings from a previous GWAS.
title: Investigating the role of the relaxin-3/RXFP3 system in neuropsychiatric disorders and metabolic phenotypes: a candidate gene approach

finding: The SNP rs1554505 at chromosome 7 showed significant association with ICD10-coded depression phenotype (β = -0.047, SE = 0.013, p = 2.04 × 10^-4), which was consistent with previous literature.
title: Investigating the role of the relaxin-3/RXFP3 system in neuropsychiatric disorders and metabolic phenotypes: a candidate gene approach

finding: The SNP rs5011432 at chromosome 7 was significantly linked to the lifetime phenotype depression (β = 0.048, SE = 0.011, p = 1.96 × 10^-5), corroborating past results.
title: Investigating the role of the relaxin-3/RXFP3 system in neuropsychiatric disorders and metabolic phenotypes: a candidate gene approach

finding: The SNP rs34217249 was identified as significant for anterior brain arterial diameter (P=3.11×10^-8), located at the ADAP1 locus.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The rs34985488 variant in the NAT16 gene was classified as deleterious by SIFT and was associated with DKD in the analysis of low-frequency variants. It was replicated for CKD with a P-value of 0.0028 in the FinnGen data, highlighting its potential as a risk factor.
title: Whole-exome and Whole-genome Sequencing of 1097 Individuals with Type 1 Diabetes Reveals Novel Genes for Diabetic Kidney Disease

finding: The candidate causal variant rs2107595 was prioritized through multi-trait colocalization and found to directly influence the expression of TWIST1, a master transcription factor. Increased expression of TWIST1 was associated with a decreased risk of IA, suggesting that higher TWIST1 levels might promote smooth muscle cell proliferation and extracellular matrix production, stabilizing the vascular wall and thereby reducing IA risk.
title: Dissecting the Genetic Architecture of Intracranial Aneurysms

finding: Detected as significant near CACNA2D1, implicated in behavior traits such as nervousness.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs7783012 was identified as one of two genome-wide significant independent SNPs in the context of cannabis use disorder. This finding was derived from a GWAS that involved a large sample size of 363,884 individuals of European and African ancestry, indicating a significant genetic association with cannabis use disorder.
title: Association between cannabis use and brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank: an observational and Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs734004 genotype CG was associated with decreased susceptibility to gastric cancer (GC), highlighting its potential role as a protective factor against the disease.
title: EZH2: A Critical Competing Endogenous RNA in Cancer Research - A Scoping Review

finding: The rs734005 genotype TC was reported to correlate with decreased susceptibility to gastric cancer (GC), suggesting its involvement in lowering the risk for the disease.
title: EZH2: A Critical Competing Endogenous RNA in Cancer Research - A Scoping Review

finding: The rs2072407 genotype TC was found to be associated with decreased susceptibility to gastric cancer (GC), indicating a potential protective effect against the disease.
title: EZH2: A Critical Competing Endogenous RNA in Cancer Research - A Scoping Review

finding: This SNP, located in an alternatively spliced exon of the CUX1 gene, was noted for its link to neurodevelopmental disorders and is expressed primarily in the cerebellum, suggesting its potential impact on mood disorders.
title: Genome-wide significant risk loci for mood disorders in the Old Order Amish founder population

finding: This SNP is linked to the CUX1 gene (K500Q mutation) and was highlighted for its potential deleteriousness and predictiveness of mood disorder risk in the studied population.
title: Genome-wide significant risk loci for mood disorders in the Old Order Amish founder population

finding: The female-specific locus rs45446698 near CYP3A7 was identified with significant differences in effect size between genders.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The allele frequency of rs1800795 was reported to connect to severity in COVID-19 cases through its impact on inflammatory responses.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs1800796 variant's allele frequency was connected to COVID-19 complications, being notable in the Indian population.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The lead variant rs3918226, located in the NOS3 gene, was associated with Raynaud's syndrome with genome-wide significance. This SNP's association indicated a role of eNOS signaling in vascular responses related to RS, effectively linking nitrogen oxide synthesis to dysautonomia symptoms.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The SNV rs10235487 was identified as a cis-meQTL that regulated the methylation site cg16500036, which was associated with poor outcomes like myocardial infarction and stroke in coronary artery disease (CAD) patients. It was found that increased methylation of cg16500036 led to decreased expression of the gene AUTS2, which was implicated in the context of adverse CAD outcomes. This relationship was supported by a significant negative correlation between rs10235487 and AUTS2 expression.
title: DNA Methylation Predicts Adverse Outcomes of Coronary Artery Disease

finding: The SNP rs2304693 was associated with TBRG4 and showed significant impacts on MT gene expression across various tissues.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: This SNP, situated in an intron of ELMO1, displayed a significant association with pSSNS with a p-value of 1.72 × 10^-8. This represented a significant finding in the context of the genetic study of the disorder.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: SNP rs10486660 was associated with traits related to placental morphology and marked an eQTL for TBX20, suggesting its relevance in placental development.
title: Genome-wide association study of placental weight in 179,025 children and parents reveals distinct and shared genetic influences between placental and fetal growth

finding: An upstream variant of RNF32 was positively associated with pituitary gland volume (β = 0.03) and expressed in reproductive tissues, suggesting a role in endocrine function.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs12667816 was found to specifically affect the anterior amygdaloid area, highlighting its targeted influence within the genetic landscape of the amygdala nuclei.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Amygdala Nuclei

finding: The SNP rs13235918 was identified in the context of cancer screening reductions during the COVID-19 pandemic. It was linked to variations in breast cancer screening participation, as reported in the study by Dennis et al. (2021), which highlighted the significant declines in screening volume and uptake across the U.S. during 2020.
title: A Rapid review on the COVID-19 Pandemic’s Global Impact on Breast Cancer Screening Participation Rates and Volumes from January-December 2020

finding: The intronic variant rs2897075:C>T in ZKSCAN1 was significantly associated with hospitalization (OR = 1.05, P = 8.9 × 10^-9) and linked to the risk for idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The rs1990622 variant was originally associated with protection against frontotemporal lobar degeneration with TAR DNA binding protein inclusions (FTD-LD), with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.61 (p = 1.08x10^-11), indicating its role as a protective factor in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: An AluYb8 mobile element further characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The rs13237518 variant was associated with protection against Alzheimer's disease, exhibiting an odds ratio (OR) of 0.96 (p = 4.90x10^-11), signifying its significance in the protective haplotype related to neurodegenerative diseases.
title: An AluYb8 mobile element further characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The rs3173615 variant, known for its non-synonymous coding change (Thr185Ser), characterized the protective haplotype and correlated with lower aggregation potential of TMEM106B protein in individuals homozygous for the protective allele, reflecting its impact on neurodegenerative disease protection.
title: An AluYb8 mobile element further characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The SNP rs60738304 was found to have a beta coefficient of 0.68, indicating a significant association with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) based on IGAP summary statistics, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.305. This SNP was a key component in the simulation analysis for estimating individual SNP effects.
title: Multivariate Modeling of Direct and Proxy GWAS Indicates Substantial Common Variant Heritability of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The missense variant rs6967330-A in CDHR3 was associated with increased susceptibility to acute viral bronchiolitis, particularly when caused by viruses other than RSV. The study indicated that the A allele increased cell surface expression of CDHR3 and was linked to greater replication of rhinovirus C in bronchial epithelium. This finding was significant for non-RSV bronchiolitis with a nominal association (p=6e-3), while no significant association was found for RSV bronchiolitis (p=0.29). This suggested that children with the rs6967330-A genotype might be at higher risk for developing asthma later in life due to bronchiolitis triggered by various viral agents.
title: Genetic susceptibility to acute viral bronchiolitis

finding: The SNP rs881926 was identified near the SFRP4 gene and was associated with kyphotic angles, indicating its significant role in the genetic risk factors related to increased spinal curvature.
title: Aging of the Spine: Characterizing genetic and physiological determinants of spinal curvature

finding: The rs78233367 variant at the 7p21.1 locus demonstrated association with psoriasis (OR: 1.06, P=1.3×10^-8), near the AHR gene, which is targeted by a recently approved therapy for psoriasis.
title: GWAS meta-analysis of psoriasis identifies new susceptibility alleles impacting disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets

finding: SNP rs7783012 was associated with cannabis use phenotypes and implicated in various externalizing behaviors, suggesting it may operate through the common liability.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: Patients with the CA genotype of rs11764843 in the HDAC9 gene showed a slower reduction in negative symptom scores over time compared to AA genotype carriers.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: Individuals carrying the GA genotype of rs1178119 in the HDAC9 gene had a slower rate of symptom improvement on the PANSS compared to those with AA genotype.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The GRM3 SNP-rs724226 was associated with changes in the PANSS total score among African Americans taking risperidone.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: In patients with schizophrenia, the rs11764843 in the HDAC9 gene was associated with a slower reduction in negative symptom scores, indicating its relevance to treatment effectiveness.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: Similar to rs11764843, the HDAC9 rs1178119 genotype was associated with a slower rate of reduction in negative symptoms over time during treatment.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The GRM3 SNP-rs724226 was found to be associated with changes in PANSS total scores among African Americans taking risperidone, indicating its potential role in treatment response.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: This variant was acknowledged for its association with brain shape, indicating genetic influence on subcortical structure characteristics.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Identified as a significant eQTL for AMZ1, rs1183079 also demonstrated associations with shape features of the right lateral ventricle.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The SNP was noted for its role in the genetic architecture of brain shape, supporting its previous associations with broader neurological and psychiatric contexts.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The SNP rs10273639C/T was associated with increased PRSS1 mRNA expression in a dosage-dependent manner in pancreatic tissue. It was significantly correlated with alcoholic chronic pancreatitis (ACP) and non-alcoholic chronic pancreatitis (NACP) with pooled odds ratios of 1.67 and 1.28, respectively. The findings suggested that the risk [C] allele amplified the risk of ACP when combined with alcohol consumption.
title: Role of the common PRSS1-PRSS2 haplotype in alcoholic and non-alcoholic chronic pancreatitis: meta- and re-analyses

finding: rs75682113 was identified as a significant locus associated with MSS in the meta-analysis, with a hazard ratio (HR) of 2.09 (95% CI 1.61-2.71, P=2.08 x 10^-8). Although it did not replicate in the LMC (P=0.411), it remained genome-wide significant in the combined discovery and replication sets, showing promise for further confirmation.
title: Higher polygenic risk for melanoma is associated with improved survival

finding: The SNP rs10248420, associated with the maternal MDR1-ABCB1 genetic score, influenced the relationship between maternal antiseizure medication use and offspring birth weight. The birth weight difference between exposed and unexposed offspring was -66.8 grams in the lowest genetic score category and -317 grams in the highest, with an interaction p-value of 0.037.
title: Interaction between placental efflux transporters and use of antiseizure or antidepressant drugs during pregnancy on birth weight in the Norwegian Mother, Father and Child Cohort Study

finding: The SNP rs2235015, also part of the maternal MDR1-ABCB1 genetic score, showed evidence of interaction with prenatal antiseizure medication in relation to lower birth weight, with p-values for interactions of 0.058 in the sensitivity analyses.
title: Interaction between placental efflux transporters and use of antiseizure or antidepressant drugs during pregnancy on birth weight in the Norwegian Mother, Father and Child Cohort Study

finding: The SNP rs12532321, tagging NME8/GPR141, showed significant association with low T1D PRS, indicating it may be part of the genetic risk factors for type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs118182411, associated with CALN1, was significantly related to low T1D PRS, marking it as a notable genetic locus influencing type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs77205087, linking to ZNF804B, was significantly associated with low T1D PRS, suggesting its involvement in the susceptibility to type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: Found to be associated with mild progression subtype (Subtype I), highlighting genetic intricacies in symptom development.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Located in the 7p11.2 locus, the SNP rs622568 was significantly associated with hospitalized COVID-19, marking it as a new identification in genetic studies.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs776746 was associated with a significantly strong effect on the clearance of tacrolimus, as reported in multiple studies, including this study. Individuals carrying the CYP3A5*3 allele, which is a loss-of-function allele, exhibited reduced clearance of tacrolimus and required lower doses to maintain comparable tacrolimus concentration levels. This SNP was estimated to explain 39% of the variability in dose requirements among subjects, confirming its well-established relationship with tacrolimus clearance.
title: Effects of Last Dosing Time on Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis of Tacrolimus Performed using Extracted Data from Electronic Health Records

finding: The C allele of rs1617640 (promoter) was associated with anemia in an additive inheritance model, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.96 (p-value 0.04). This SNP was linked to lower hemoglobin levels and elevated inflammation markers, indicating its impact directly on erythropoietin (EPO) levels.
title: Erythropoietin single nucleotide polymorphisms are associated with anemia and dyslipidemia in a cardiovascular disease population

finding: The GG genotype of rs507392 (intron) was associated with protection against dyslipidemia in a recessive model (OR value = 0.29; p-value = 0.048). This genotype correlated with lower plasma EPO levels but increased cholesterol, LDL, and non-HDL levels, suggesting a complex role in lipid metabolism.
title: Erythropoietin single nucleotide polymorphisms are associated with anemia and dyslipidemia in a cardiovascular disease population

finding: The study found that the IL-6 gene rs1800795 variant (174 G>C) was significantly associated with waist-hip-ratio (WHR) and insulin resistance (IR) in North Indian adult women. Specifically, the group with a WHR greater than 0.85 exhibited a higher frequency of the mutant genotype GC+CC (89.19%) and the mutant allele C (75.68%). It was noted that metabolic parameters such as WHR, total cholesterol (TC), triglycerides (TG), insulin levels, and HOMA-IR were significantly correlated with this genetic variant, indicating a link between the IL-6 rs1800795 variant and metabolic risk factors.
title: Association of Interleukin-6 gene (rs1800795) variant with waist-hip-ratio and Insulin resistance: A cross sectional study in adult women

finding: The SNP rs10807797 at the 7p21.1 locus was associated with variations in ΔNIHSS, with significance shown across multiple populations except for the Polish and Mexican cohorts. It involves genes that may play a role in excitotoxicity.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: The rs10281425 SNP at the TMEM106B locus was confirmed to be associated with FTLD-TDP A, particularly impacting TMEM106B mRNA expression through an increase seen in disease-associated fragments.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: Identified in the genome-wide association studies for heart failure, reinforcing the genetic basis of HF through multi-population analyses.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP was also significant in heart failure studies, marking its relevance in the genetic architecture of HF risk.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: Despite being the nearest SNP to the OPN1SW gene, which is related to color vision, this SNP was looped to CALU, a gene functionally relevant to atrial fibrillation, with a posterior inclusion probability of 0.91, highlighting its role in identifying distal risk genes.
title: Single-cell genomics improves the discovery of risk variants and genes of Atrial Fibrillation

finding: This variant near the LEP gene demonstrated a significant association with T2D, presenting an odds ratio of 10.4 (95% CI: 4.5-24.2, p = 4.53 x 10^-8). It was enriched in African ancestry and disrupted a binding motif for NFATc transcription factors, crucial for glucose metabolism.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: The study found that the IL-6-174 G/C polymorphism (rs1800795) was significantly associated with Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome (PCOS). Specifically, the mutant 'C' allele showed a stronger correlation in women with PCOS compared to those without (p<0.0001; OR=1.91; 95% CI=1.38-2.66). Women with the homozygous CC and heterozygous GC genotypes exhibited higher values of Waist-to-Hip Ratio (WHR) and Homeostatic Model Assessment (HOMA) index, indicating an association with metabolic risk indicators. Additionally, significantly elevated serum IL-6 levels were observed in PCOS women possessing these mutant genotypes (p=0.0094). Thus, the rs1800795 polymorphism was implicated in heightened metabolic syndrome risk among PCOS patients.
title: Interleukin-6 -174 G/C promoter gene polymorphism and polycystic ovary syndrome: A cross sectional investigation in adult women

finding: The CDHR3 rs6967330 missense variant was associated with increased susceptibility to acute viral bronchiolitis, particularly with non-RSV infections. The A allele enhanced expression of the CDHR3 protein in airway epithelium, which correlated with higher rhinovirus-C replication. This association indicated that the rs6967330-A genotype predisposed infants to more severe bronchiolitis and potentially contributed to later asthma development.
title: Genetic susceptibility to acute viral bronchiolitis

finding: SNP rs34217249 was identified as being associated with anterior brain arterial diameter, reaching genome-wide significance (P = 3.11×10^-8), and identified within the ADAP1 gene.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The rs748670681 variant at 7p22.1 is near RNF216, known for its regulation of the NF-κB signaling pathway, which is crucial in inflammatory responses often seen in psoriasis.
title: Genetic study of psoriasis highlights its close link with socio-economic status and affective symptoms

finding: In the context of circulating leptin levels, the study found a strong association between carriers of the missense variant rs774055408 located in the leptin gene (LEP) and elevated measures of circulating leptin (P=6.2×10^-12). This association reinforced the validity of using the genetic instrument in subsequent analyses related to adiposity.
title: Time-varying and tissue-dependent effects of adiposity on leptin levels: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs149007767 was associated with the regulation of the gene RTEN, contributing to the understanding of shared genetic regulation in numerous molecular phenotypes, specifically between hematopoietic processes and lipid metabolism.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The SNP rs2405442 regulated the expression of the proteins PILRB and PILRA, demonstrating that it affected multiple proteins with the same directional influence.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The SNP rs11766947 was associated with both the expression and protein levels of IL-6, revealing the shared regulation between cytokine levels and its receptor, which is influential in inflammatory responses.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: This SNP suggested positive effects on offspring birthweight by being associated with the pathways for de novo serine production.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs11556924, an exonic non-synonymous variant within the ZC3HC1 gene, was found to have high combined annotation-dependent deletion (CADD) scores, indicating potentially deleterious effects. This suggests its involvement in mechanisms that could influence cardiovascular disease outcomes.
title: Contribution of leukocyte telomere length to major cardiovascular diseases onset: phenotypic and genetic insights from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: rs139729994, which corresponds to the variant 3600G>A, was identified as one of the four CF-causing variants among over 4,000 CFTR variants analyzed. This variant was characterized within the context of its prevalence and impact on cystic fibrosis diagnoses.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: rs193922500, representing the V456A variant, was also reported as a CF-causing variant. It was highlighted for its age of origin, estimated to be about 215 generations ago (~5,300 years), making it one of the key variants in understanding CFTR diversity.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The variant rs76713772, corresponding to the 1717-1G>A change, was noted as a CF-causing variant. This SNP was recognized for its estimated age of about 425 generations ago (~10,600 years), contributing to the historical context of CF variants.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: Identified as the V520F variant, rs77646904 was characterized as one of the most prevalent CF-causing variants specifically in East Asian populations. Its significance contributed to the understanding of variant distribution across different ancestries.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The SNP rs213950, denoting the c.1408G>A (V470M) variant, was discussed for its association with chronic pancreatitis risk rather than cystic fibrosis, indicating its context-dependent impact on health outcomes.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The variant rs113993960, which corresponds to the F508del variant, was analyzed as the most common CF-causing variant. It was discussed in relation to its estimated origin about 600 generations ago and its potential selective advantage against infectious diseases like tuberculosis.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The hypertension-associated SNP rs3735533 located within the HOTTIP long non-coding RNA had a lower odds ratio in the top quartile of CVD topic weight (1.07±0.02) as opposed to the bottom quartile (1.13±0.02). This finding indicated a potential relationship between HOTTIP and blood pressure regulation, as well as conotruncal heart malformations.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: This SNP was associated with an increased risk of NAFLD in African Americans, linked to a nearby variant with predicted deleterious effects.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: This variant was highlighted for its strong association with NAFLD risk in African Americans and was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs115038698.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs3087234 was significantly associated with lower risk of autoimmune diseases but increased risk of basal cell carcinoma, underscoring its role in immune regulation and pleiotropy.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The rs4410790 variant was associated with caffeine intake, influencing related biomarkers including body mass index and kidney health.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: This SNP was marked pathogenic and was annotated to have associations with congenital disorder glycosylation.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: This SNP was identified as having some previously studied GWAS association.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: This SNP was identified as having some previously studied GWAS association.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: This SNP was studied to have negative associations with Bechet’s disease in the Han Chinese population.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: The rare SNP rs144662445 in AKAP9 was nominally significant with p=0.04 in combined analyses.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The rare SNP rs149979685 in AKAP9 showed nominal significance (p=0.03) in the aggregate analysis.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci
