finding: For SNP rs7384878, the gene CUX1 was identified as a potential risk gene in relation to AD.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: This SNP was identified as a protein expression quantitative trait locus (vQTL) for CCL24 and interacted positively with rs112610805 to affect eosinophil counts, resulting in a suppressive interaction in the analyzed cohorts.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This SNP served as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for CCL26 and positively interacted with rs10281069, which led to a significant suppressive effect on eosinophil count.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This SNP was linked to appetite changes, which are relevant to eating behaviors in the context of depression. It was one of the lead variants for the depression symptom phenotype associated with TMEM106B, indicating a potential genetic overlap in symptoms of depression.
title: Investigating the genetic relationship between depression symptoms and Alzheimer’s Disease in clinically diagnosed and proxy cases

finding: This SNP was associated with depressed mood and was also linked to TMEM106B as a causal gene from previous studies. Its identification in the context of depression symptomatology suggests relevance to genetic understanding of mood disorders.
title: Investigating the genetic relationship between depression symptoms and Alzheimer’s Disease in clinically diagnosed and proxy cases

finding: This SNP was part of the lead variants for the PHQ-9 sum score, reinforcing the genetic association of TMEM106B with overall depression symptoms and supporting earlier findings regarding the gene's involvement in mood disorders.
title: Investigating the genetic relationship between depression symptoms and Alzheimer’s Disease in clinically diagnosed and proxy cases

finding: The SNP rs157934 was associated with insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF-1) levels, showing a robust genome-wide significant association (p=2 × 10^-109), indicating its potential role in metabolic traits that may relate to anxiety and COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs13234269 demonstrated a strong association with high-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels (p=5 × 10^-102), suggesting it may influence cardiovascular aspects related to the comorbidity of anxiety disorders and COVID-19.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs62465482, located in or near the ASL gene, was proposed as a better biomarker for liver disease diagnosis compared to traditional markers.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs776746 in the CYP3A5 gene was associated with a significant impact on tacrolimus clearance. Patients carrying the CYP3A5*3 loss-of-function allele demonstrated a reduced clearance rate, necessitating smaller doses of tacrolimus to achieve equivalent therapeutic concentrations. This particular SNP accounted for 39% of the variability in dose requirements among individuals, suggesting it was a key factor influencing tacrolimus pharmacokinetics.
title: Effects of Last Dosing Time on Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis of Tacrolimus Performed using Extracted Data from Electronic Health Records

finding: SNP rs12670840 was replicated in an additional cohort, indicating its association with age-related ocular disorders.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The SNP rs63750695, relating to the mutation c.2192_2196delAGTTA in the PMS2 gene, was observed in 0.88% (5 out of 571) of patients and was noted in African patients, being associated with Lynch syndrome, colorectal cancer, and ovarian carcinoma.
title: Comprehensive Study of Germline Mutations and Double-Hit Events in Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer

finding: This allele in the ZSAC21|TRIM4 locus was implicated as a risk allele for IPF, contributing to genetic architecture understanding of lung-associated traits.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: The SNV rs569607645 in CRHR2 was shown to be located in the cholesterol-binding motif of the protein's transmembrane helices. This specific variant resulted in a glycine to arginine substitution (G231R), which negatively impacted the receptor's functionality, potentially impairing stress coping and feeding suppression mechanisms in patients with eating disorders.
title: Rare CRHR2 and GRM8 variants identified as candidate factors associated with eating disorders in Japanese patients

finding: The SNP rs62474683 was identified as the index SNP for an intergenic locus on chromosome 7 highly associated with SA (OR for A allele = 1.06, P=1.91×10^-10). This SNP remained genome-wide significant after conditioning on major depressive disorder (MDD), indicating a unique association with SA that is not mediated by psychiatric disorders. It has been implicated in risk-taking behavior and smoking, demonstrating a stronger effect on SA compared to other phenotypes.
title: Dissecting the shared genetic architecture of suicide attempt, psychiatric disorders and known risk factors

finding: Though not showing high posterior probability, rs2300584 has been repeatedly noted as an index variant for T2D in previous GWAS studies, contributing to its understanding.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The SNP rs113993960, a known pathogenic variant for cystic fibrosis (CFTR Phe508del), was confidently associated with COPD but not with smoking.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: This SNP showed variation across populations but retained significance in relation to PSA levels.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Finally, SNP rs55722505 exhibited association with IgA levels (Beta=0.048, P=8.61×10^-14), with candidate genes identified supporting its functional implications.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs17145750 located near <italic>MLXIPL</italic> showed a positive association from infancy, with effects directionally opposing in adult BMI, indicating different regulatory mechanisms at different life stages.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: Identified as significantly associated with childhood BMI, rs287621 showed peak association at six months before declining, indicating a specific role during early growth phases linked to <italic>KLF14</italic>.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The association with rs10487505 in <italic>LEP</italic> was broad and late, suggesting differing roles in childhood compared to infancy.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: Positioned upstream of <italic>KLF14</italic>, rs12672489 displayed an early rise in association with childhood BMI but did not persist into adulthood.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: At the ABCB4 locus, rs115038698 was highlighted for being in high linkage disequilibrium with a missense variant (Ala934Thr), which conferred an increased risk of cALT, thus marking it as a significant genetic contributor in African Americans.
title: A trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of unexplained chronic ALT elevation as a proxy for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease with histological and radiological validation

finding: As a missense variant (Ala934Thr) in the ABCB4 locus, rs61730509 was associated with increased risk of cALT in African Americans, linking it to liver disease risk through its functional impact.
title: A trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of unexplained chronic ALT elevation as a proxy for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease with histological and radiological validation

finding: The SNP rs7776725 was discovered to be significantly associated with accelerated brain aging, providing additional evidence in relation to the global gray matter volume phenotype. This SNP was mapped to the intron of FAM3C, a gene encoding a secreted protein implicated in pancreatic cancer and Alzheimer's disease, highlight its potential relevance to both brain aging and neurodegeneration.
title: Population clustering of structural brain aging and its association with brain development

finding: The study identified rs62474683 located in an intergenic region on chromosome 7 as the SNP most strongly associated with suicide attempts (SA), with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.05 (95% CI 1.04-1.07) and a highly significant p-value of 8.72×10⁻¹². The frequency of the A allele in SA cases was 0.57 compared to 0.56 in controls, indicating a minor increase in risk for the A allele in the context of suicidal behavior.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis of suicide attempt in 43,871 cases identifies twelve genome-wide significant loci

finding: The SNP GPNMB rs199347 was identified as significantly associated with the activity of the sensorimotor network in Parkinson's disease patients, demonstrating a marked influence on global and nodal network metrics within that population.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs12113142 was associated with the Notch signaling pathway activity. The context of this finding indicated that enhanced Notch activity may relate to immune responses in conditions like sepsis, suggesting its potential as a molecular target for further research in immunopathology related to sepsis.
title: Androgen receptor pathway activity assay for sepsis diagnosis and prediction of favorable prognosis

finding: The SNP rs4726467 located within the TBXAS1 gene was identified to have robust association with mortality in PD (HR=2.04 [95% CI 1.63 to 2.56], p-value 7.71×10^-10).
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and clinical progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The study reported that the IL-6-174 G/C polymorphism (specifically the mutant 'C' allele) was significantly associated with an increased risk for the metabolic syndrome (MetS) in women with Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome (PCOS). The presence of the mutant CC genotype in PCOS women correlated with a higher waist-hip ratio (WHR) exceeding 0.85 and elevated serum IL-6 levels, indicating that this genotype may serve as a risk indicator for developing metabolic syndrome in this population. Specifically, the odds ratio was calculated as 1.91, with a 95% confidence interval of 1.38-2.66, suggesting a robust association.
title: Interleukin-6 -174 G/C promoter gene polymorphism and polycystic ovary syndrome: A cross sectional investigation in adult women

finding: The causal inference of the myeloid DC SSC-A parameter was significantly driven by rs189299852, marking it as a key factor in the mediation analysis of immunological mediators.
title: Causal effect of the gut microbiota on the risk of psychiatric disorders and the mediating role of immunophenotypes

finding: The SNP rs75682113 on chromosome 7 was significantly associated with MSS in the meta-analysis (P = 1.07 x 10^-8) and remained genome-wide significant in the combined discovery and replication analysis (P = 2.13 x 10^-8) despite not replicating in the LMC. This SNP is located in an intron of the SUGCT gene, which is implicated in disease susceptibility, although no eQTL associations were reported for this SNP.
title: Higher polygenic risk for melanoma is associated with improved survival

finding: The variant rs3918226 was found to be an intron variant in *NOS3* (nitric oxide synthase 3), located in its regulatory region, which is important in vasoconstriction and dilation. This SNP showed a genome-wide significant association with Raynaud's syndrome, suggesting a role for endothelial nitric oxide signaling in the syndrome's pathology.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The LOC401312-LOC541472 locus (lead SNP rs58879058) disclosed a novel association with copper levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: At the CYP3A7-CYP3A51P locus (lead SNP rs4646462), a known association with estrone was confirmed.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The CPS1-ERBB4 locus (lead SNP rs10272406) indicated pleiotropic effects among various metabolites.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The CYP3A5 locus (lead SNP rs1419745) was linked to estrone and other hormones.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The variant rs2891691 was identified as a novel locus between the ORC5 and LHFPL3 genes. It had a minor allele frequency of 1.7% in Latino individuals and was associated with a 2-fold increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes (OR=2.0, P=3.4×10-9). Additionally, the effect of this variant was observed to be sex-specific, showing a stronger association in women (OR=2.4, P=6.6×10-8) compared to men (OR=1.5, P=0.018).
title: The power of TOPMed imputation for the discovery of Latino enriched rare variants associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs12673181 was discovered to have a novel association with lifetime cannabis use, with a p-value of 6.90E-09. It is located upstream of the GRM3 gene, which encodes the inhibitory mGlu3 receptor affecting neurotransmission. Although this SNP did not have known associations with cannabis-related traits prior to this study, other variants of GRM3 have been implicated in substance use and psychiatric conditions.
title: Genome-wide association studies of lifetime and frequency cannabis use in 131,895 individuals

finding: Like the others, rs150966198 was significantly associated with HF at the Bonferroni correction level, thereby contributing to the genetic understanding of heart failure.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP, rs6944634, was notably significant after Bonferroni correction, making it a valuable candidate for further research in heart failure genetics.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The allele at rs2004640, part of the IRF5 TCTA haplotype, was associated with increased risk of mortality in European-American patients with acute COVID-19, particularly influencing younger individuals. This was noted in the context of its gain-of-function role in the IFN pathway.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: Similar to rs2004640, this SNP was also part of the IRF5 TCTA haplotype linked to higher mortality risk in European-American patients, contributing to the hypothesis that IFN pathway activation relates to COVID-19 severity.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: As part of the IRF5 TCTA haplotype, rs10488631 was analyzed and found to contribute to the association with increased mortality in COVID-19 among younger European-Americans.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: This SNP, also within the IRF5 TCTA haplotype, showed a direct correlation with elevated mortality risk in acute COVID-19 cases among younger European-American patients, highlighting the role of genetic variants in disease outcomes.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: Showed significant association with CACNA2D1, with previous links to feeling nervous.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with the injury/inflammation component (PC3). The T allele predicted higher injury/inflammation scores, contributing positively to latent AD, thereby supporting its association with neuronal injury.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The rs139729994 variant (3600G>A) was characterized as a CF-causing variant and was dated to have originated approximately 270 generations ago (around 6,750 years ago). However, it did not demonstrate any significant differences in allele frequencies compared to other variants of similar ages within the populations in AVA, indicating no selective pressure.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The rs193922500 variant (V456A) was identified as one of the four CF-causing variants from the CFTR gene locus. It was estimated to have emerged about 215 generations ago (around 5,300 years), but, like the other variants, it showed no significant differences in allele frequencies, suggesting no selective pressure during its origination.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The rs76713772 variant (1717-1G>A) was another CF-causing variant found. It was the youngest of the identified variants, with an origin approximately 425 generations ago (around 10,600 years). Similar to others, it did not exhibit significant differences in allele frequencies when compared with variants of similar ages, indicating lack of selective pressure.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The rs77646904 variant (V520F) was also a CF-causing variant and common in the East Asian population. It dated back approximately 338 generations (around 8,450 years). It too did not show significant differences in allele frequencies compared to similar variants, implying no selective pressures influencing its frequency.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The rs113993960 variant (F508del) was recognized as the most prevalent CF-causing variant, especially within European populations. It has been estimated to have arisen about 600 generations ago as a response to historical selective pressures, including an association with tuberculosis, which contributed to its high frequency in carriers.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The rs3211938 variant in CD36 was associated with higher RDW in the African ancestry cohort, corroborating its association with RBC parameters previously highlighted.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: This SNP was associated with ascending aortic distensibility, being located 12.6 kilobases upstream of ELN, a gene encoding elastin, highlighting its role in cardiovascular development.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The MLXIPL variant rs12531645-G was also associated with increased lipid levels, strongly linked to VLDL and triglyceride concentrations, and showed significant correlations with inflammatory markers C-reactive protein and glycoprotein acetyls.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: The rs58120505 SNP was found in the intronic region of MAD1L1 and identified as a strong candidate effector gene for SCZ, but specific associations were not delineated.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights interferon regulatory transcription factor 3 as a schizophrenia hub gene

finding: The SNP rs45446698 was found to associate with the odds of missingness of several metabolites including bile acids and steroid-related metabolites. This SNP had been previously linked to atorvastatin metabolism and breast cancer, suggesting its role in metabolic processes affecting steroid and bile acid biosynthesis.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The analysis indicated that rs858275 was strongly associated with GPNMB SOMAmer levels, suggesting its role as a cis-SNP. Additionally, locus visualization linked this SNP to the risk of developing Parkinson's disease through the GPNMB locus, highlighting its importance in understanding the disease's pathogenesis.
title: Parkinson’s disease causality and heterogeneity: a proteogenomic view

finding: The SNP rs3807989 was identified as the most activated SNP in the GLN-model for classifying individuals with atrial fibrillation (AF). It represented an intron variant in the CAV1 gene, which is involved in critical cellular functions and has previously been linked to AF across various populations. Its allele distribution suggested a relatively balanced selection scenario between risk and reference alleles.
title: An assessment of the value of deep neural networks in genetic risk prediction for surgically relevant outcomes

finding: A stop-gain variant eQTL for CD36, this SNP colocalized with alkaline phosphatase levels, achieving a PP4 of 1.00 and frequency of 11.5% in 1000 Genomes Africans.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The EPHA1:rs11762262-A variant exhibited protective associations against AD, contributing to the resilience framework in studied populations.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The RELN:rs201731543-C variant was categorized as resilient, indicating its significance in the overall genetic landscape associated with AD.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs17160467, near the gene BCL9, was part of a set of findings that supported the involvement of Wnt/β-catenin signaling in COPD pathogenesis, adding to the understanding of underlying biological mechanisms.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: Identified at 7q32.2-<italic>TMEM209</italic>, this locus was notably associated with TET2-CH specifically.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs111754768 in THSD7A demonstrated strong genetic signals for susceptibility to squamous cell carcinoma in African-ancestry subjects.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs111796602, located in an intron of ELMO1, was discovered through population-specific analysis and presented a significant association with pSSNS with a p-value of 1.72 × 10−8, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The variant rs13245319 was associated with IBS, kidney stones, and obesity, indicating a potential link to gastrointestinal symptoms and associated traits within the context of COVID-19+ diarrhea.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: The SNP was associated with lower HDL cholesterol levels and represented a novel association to a quantitative trait.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP showed a strong association (P-value 6.1E-06) in a meta GWAS for general cognition and was associated with neurocortism, intelligence, and educational attainment.
title: Genetic Variations in Evolutionary Accelerated Regions Disrupt Cognition in Schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs2157752 showed an association with TUD (p-value of 5.32E-09), related to the GRM8 gene, which is important for mediating reward-related learning and memory in the context of substance use.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorder prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The variant rs2896218 was found to have a significant protective association with strabismus overall and specifically with both esotropia and exotropia under the dominant model. It was also associated with patients diagnosed at birth, suggesting its role in early strabismus development.
title: Exploring WNT2 Polymorphisms in Comitant Strabismus: A Genetic Association Study

finding: The variant rs3779550 demonstrated a significant risk association with strabismus and was specifically associated with a positive family history. However, it showed a protective association for patients without a family history of strabismus.
title: Exploring WNT2 Polymorphisms in Comitant Strabismus: A Genetic Association Study

finding: The SNP rs2285544 was associated with protective effects against strabismus and its subtypes, esotropia and exotropia, indicating its potential role in the genetic predisposition to these conditions.
title: Exploring WNT2 Polymorphisms in Comitant Strabismus: A Genetic Association Study

finding: The variant rs4730775 was significantly associated with exotropia and showed a risk association with strabismus in patients diagnosed at birth. Its role as a risk factor for exotropia was further supported by adjustment for age and gender.
title: Exploring WNT2 Polymorphisms in Comitant Strabismus: A Genetic Association Study

finding: The variant rs3840660 exhibited a risk association with exotropia after adjusting for demographic factors, indicating its potential relevance in strabismus.
title: Exploring WNT2 Polymorphisms in Comitant Strabismus: A Genetic Association Study

finding: The SNP rs1424597 located at the PLXNA4 locus was identified as being significantly associated with an increased risk of pulmonary embolism (PE). Specifically, the minor A allele was associated with a 1.49 odds ratio (OR) in the MARTHA study (p = 6.1×10^-3), and a 1.74 OR in a combined analysis of the MARTHA and EOVT studies for patients over 37 years of age (p = 5.42×10^-4). The findings highlighted the potential role of PLXNA4 as a new susceptibility gene for PE.
title: An artificial neural network approach integrating plasma proteomics and genetic data identifies PLXNA4 as a new susceptibility locus for pulmonary embolism

finding: The rs113993960 variant in CFTR, which leads to the deletion of the crucial F508 residue in the CFTR protein, was reported at a frequency of 0.0052 in the Russian dataset. This confirmed earlier studies indicating its high prevalence in Russia.
title: Expanding the Russian allele frequency reference via cross-laboratory data integration: insights from 6,096 exome samples

finding: The rs11764843 SNP in the HDAC9 gene was linked to a slower rate of reduction in negative symptom scores in schizophrenia patients, suggesting its role in treatment efficacy.
title: Pharmacogenomic Diversity in Psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: Similar findings were observed for rs1178119 in the HDAC9 gene, where specific genotypes correlated with treatment response metrics in patients with schizophrenia.
title: Pharmacogenomic Diversity in Psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The GRM3 SNP rs724226 was associated with changes in PANSS total scores among African-American patients taking risperidone, indicating its relevance for treatment response.
title: Pharmacogenomic Diversity in Psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The investigation showed that GG carriers of the <italic>GPNMB</italic> rs199347 had higher GM to Fun node coupling, WM to Fun node coupling, and GM to WM node coupling compared to both AA and AG carriers, again with a statistical significance of p less than 0.0001. This SNP was noted to confer a reduced risk of PD. The study suggested that the higher coupling strength in GG carriers may relate to the protective effects of this genetic variant, aligning with observations that GG genotype levels are lower than in AA carriers, which correlates with higher UPDRS-III scores in PD patients, thus underscoring its relevance in disease pathology.
title: Altered structural-functional coupling in Parkinson’s disease

finding: This SNP was identified as a potential causal variant in the GWAS relevant to fatty acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: The EPHA1:rs11762262-A variant displayed protective characteristics, aligning with findings related to genetic resilience in AD.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The RELN:rs201731543-C variant contributed to protective findings related to AD, reinforcing its relevance in the genetic investigation.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: This SNP was found associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I), suggesting it could affect the escalation of symptoms.
title: Integrative analyses of multimodal clinical, neuroimaging, genetic, and transcriptomic data identify subtypes and potential treatments for heterogeneous Parkinson’s disease progression

finding: Identified as a single variant in the dominant component for the CAD GWAS within the TWIST1 locus, it was confirmed to influence the expression of TWIST1 in human arterial smooth muscle cells via recent CRISPR studies, qualifying it as a positive original finding.
title: Redefining tissue specificity of genetic regulation of gene expression in the presence of allelic heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs2533629 was associated with schizophrenia, demonstrating an increase in binding affinity and reduced suppressive impact through experimental methods. It showed significant delta repression scores, aligning it as a critical regulatory variant.
title: The contribution of silencer variants to human diseases

finding: Individuals homozygous for the CC genotype of rs1045642 showed significantly higher verapamil AUCs (area under the curve) compared to the TT and TC genotypes. This association indicated that rs1045642, a synonymous SNP in the ABCB1 gene, played a primary role in the variability of verapamil metabolism among individuals.
title: A dose-finding study to guide use of verapamil as an adjunctive therapy in tuberculosis

finding: SNP rs2066992 was associated with the IL6 gene, which encodes a cytokine related to immune response, implicating a role in inflammation and complement-related pathways.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: rs12670840 was validated in the meta-analysis with ASSET, showing significant association with ocular diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: This SNP mapped to CHRM2 with a p-value of 2.21×10^-9 but was not polymorphic in European cohorts, although it showed association in the AMR population.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: The SNP rs3812316 was strongly linked to triglyceride levels and the Free Cholesterol in LDL/LDL Cholesterol ratio, suggesting its influence on lipid composition in response to dietary carbohydrates.
title: Lipoprotein profile and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: Linked to the gene TOMM7 in super-variant chr7_23, this SNP was noted for its connection to mitochondrial function and inflammatory responses relevant to COVID-19.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: The SNP rs4729607 was reported to be in near perfect LD with a ~13 kb deletion on chromosome 7, associated with hemoglobin (HGB) and hematocrit (HCT) traits. This deletion was also shown to alter expression levels in several nearby genes linked to iron metabolism and erythropoiesis.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies common and rare structural variants contributing to hematologic traits in the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with the CACNA2D1 gene, which relates to feelings of nervousness and impulsivity.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: The variant rs74504435 was identified as a lead variant influencing EGFR expression specifically in astrocytes, with a posterior probability of 0.946 for its association. This genetic signal colocalized with risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD), whereas the associated regulatory signal in oligodendrocytes did not indicate a relationship with AD risk.
title: Single-Nucleus Atlas of Cell-Type Specific Genetic Regulation in the Human Brain

finding: The SNP rs2107595 was associated with the ascending aorta minimum area (DAo min area) and showed colocalization with systolic blood pressure in the 7p21.1 region, with a posterior probability of 0.960 for shared causality.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs2307036 was associated with reading disability and indicated its role in cognitive function, showcasing the complexity of genetic interactions.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The hypertension-associated SNP rs3735533 located within the HOTTIP long non-coding RNA showed a lower odds ratio in the top quartile of CVD topic weight (1.07±0.02) compared to the bottom quartile (1.13±0.02). The interaction test revealed a P value of 0.0015, signifying a potential inverse relationship between this SNP and cardiovascular topic weight.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: The rs7384878 SNP was significantly related to LOAD and showed mediation effects through the superior parietal cortex and putamen, where its association indicated a thicker superior parietal cortex leading to an increased LOAD proxy score.
title: Brain morphology mediating the effect of genetic risk variants on Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The AUTS2 variant rs3735260 was associated with higher volume in the optic radiation near the primary visual cortex, particularly pronounced in the right hemisphere, relating to its genetic contribution to dyslexia.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The SNP rs1476535 was mentioned as a shared causal SNP within the list of loci connecting PTSD to cardiovascular diseases.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs8180817 was also identified as a locus related to PTSD, contributing to cardiovascular phenotype correlations.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs2470937 was involved in colocalization findings relating to PTSD and cardiovascular risk factors.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs34809719 was recognized as having significant connections to the PTSD variations and cardiovascular disease traits.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs13237518 was identified among dramatically relevant loci associated with PTSD and cardiovascular trait associations.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The index SNP rs62474683 also reached genome-wide significance for SA, with a p-value of 1.91×10^-10. This SNP was located in an intergenic region and remained significant after conditioning on psychiatric disorders, showcasing its potential role in genetic susceptibility to SA.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis of suicide attempt identifies twelve genome-wide significant loci and implicates genetic risks for specific health factors

finding: The SNP rs10270358 was associated with seeing a doctor for anxiety or depression and chronic disability/infirmity, both of which could potentially reduce wellbeing. This finding was consistent with the analysis of the primary Mendelian randomisation study.
title: Exploring the lifetime effect of children on wellbeing using two-sample Mendelian randomisation

finding: The SNP rs1045642 showed a moderate-to-high alternate allele frequency in the Japanese population, about 60%. The nanopore-based genotyping confirmed the presence of the alternate G allele in three of the five studied individuals.
title: Rapid detection of single nucleotide polymorphisms using the MinION nanopore sequencer: a feasibility study for perioperative precision medicine

finding: The SNP rs115325598 was identified as significantly associated with acne severity at the genome-wide significance level among participants of African ancestry, with a P-value of 3.15 × 10^-8. This variant is located in the intron region of the gene ATXN7L1, and the effect allele C had a frequency of 16% in severe acne cases. The odds ratio was calculated to be 8.22.
title: Genome-wide association study analysis of disease severity in Acne reveals novel biological insights

finding: SNP rs42044 in the CDK6 gene was confirmed as significant in the GWA analyses for body mass index (BMI) and neutrophil cell count, suggesting its relevance in critically ill COVID-19 associated traits.
title: Critically ill COVID-19 associated trait genetics reveals CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: This SNP was linked to higher expression of IKZF1 and conferred protection against ovarian cancer while also increasing the risk for autoimmune disorders, particularly type 1 diabetes, suggesting a dual role in immune regulation and cancer susceptibility.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: Identified as a missense variant associated with platelet count, contributing to CD36 deficiency.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This variant was fine-mapped for inflammatory bowel disease in Finnish populations.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Fine-mapped as associated with height but was not significant across all populations.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Identified as one of the credible variants in fine-mapping regions close to lead SNPs related to PAU, this intergenic SNP showed promising links to substance use through genetic correlation.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: This SNP, another intergenic variant, was included in credible sets showing significant association with PAU risk, supporting further research into underlying mechanisms.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The rs201498350 variant, also referred to as ABCB4:c.2784-12T>C, was strongly associated with severe liver disease in the Puerto Rican population studied. In vitro analysis confirmed that this variant disrupted splicing of the ABCB4 pre-mRNA, leading to a protein product missing exon 23, which encodes critical functional regions of the protein. Homozygous carriers exhibited advanced liver disease, and heterozygous individuals also showed increased risk of liver disease, indicating a dose-dependent relationship with allele presence. The carrier rate of this variant was found to be approximately 1.95% in Puerto Rican individuals, underlining the potential influence of a founder effect in this population. The identification of this variant as 'Likely Pathogenic' for progressive familial intrahepatic cholestasis type 1 (PFIC1) further substantiated its importance in genomic medicine.
title: Leveraging Health Systems Data to Characterize a Large Effect Variant Conferring Risk for Liver Disease in Puerto Ricans

finding: SNP rs12535226, located in the first intron of the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) gene, was identified as a novel risk locus for LOAD. The variant had a minor allele frequency of 48% in European-ancestry populations. It was confirmed to have a regulatory role and was found to be an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) in the cerebellum and temporal cortex, linking it to potential biological mechanisms associated with LOAD susceptibility.
title: An integrated genome and phenome-wide association study approach to understanding Alzheimer’s disease predisposition

finding: This SNP was associated with a significantly shorter transcript length in ADAM22 (rs=-0.54, p=0.05), suggesting a potential reduction in TNFα levels, indicating a better response to the drug BIRB796.
title: Combining explainable machine learning, demographic and multi-omic data to identify precision medicine strategies for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs4727512, located in the CUX1 gene, showed a much higher frequency of high-risk genotypes (HRG) in trigeminal neuralgia (TN) cases (37%) compared to controls, and the frequency of idiopathic cases in the HRG group (6%) was lower than in the low-risk genotype (LRG) group (25%). This finding suggested a significant association with idiopathic TN.
title: Role of common and rare genetic variants in the aetiology of trigeminal neuralgia

finding: This SNP was identified in a large-scale meta-analysis as being associated with suicide attempts (SA) in approximately 30,000 SA cases compared to over 500,000 controls, showing significant results even after conditioning on GWAS findings for depression.
title: Clinical, genomic, and neurophysiological correlates of lifetime suicide attempts among individuals with alcohol dependence

finding: This SNP was an intronic variant within the ABCA13 gene and showed nominal significance for association with asthma exacerbations. It was linked to potential effects on impaired lipid transport or inflammation, with previous associations noted in lung conditions and evidence of its expression being affected by asthma and smoking.
title: Asthma exacerbations and eosinophilia in the UK Biobank: a Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs7807369 was significantly associated with increasing risk of high on-treatment platelet reactivity (HTPR) in African Americans, with a p-value of 4.56 x 10<sup>-9</sup>. This association was supported by an odds ratio of 9.11, suggesting a substantial increase in risk. Additionally, higher expression of THSD7A was linked to HTPR.
title: Investigation of genomic and transcriptomic risk factors in clopidogrel response in African Americans

finding: The SNP rs1149515 was validated in the Million Veteran’s Program cohort and found to be associated with significantly lower risk of major adverse cardiac events (MACE) among homozygous carriers of the C allele (OR = 0.54, p = 0.0179). This study highlights its role in cardiovascular outcomes.
title: Investigation of genomic and transcriptomic risk factors in clopidogrel response in African Americans

finding: The SNP rs7792678 was linked to higher expression of THSD7A and associated with increased risk of HTPR. It was categorized in the potential enhancer/promoter region, supporting its regulatory role in THSD7A expression, with a frequency of the effect allele of 0.414 among African Americans.
title: Investigation of genomic and transcriptomic risk factors in clopidogrel response in African Americans

finding: SNP rs7811849, located in high linkage disequilibrium with rs7807369, was observed to influence THSD7A expression, further validating its association with HTPR through enhancer/promoter regulation.
title: Investigation of genomic and transcriptomic risk factors in clopidogrel response in African Americans

finding: The missense variant rs34896991, located in the SAMD9 gene, was significantly associated with reduced 28-day survival in sepsis patients. It was linked to a hazard ratio of 1.64, indicating an increased risk of mortality. SAMD9 was overexpressed in the peripheral blood of non-surviving sepsis patients compared to those who survived, suggesting its role in the inflammatory response.
title: A Genome-Wide Association Study of Survival in Patients with Sepsis

finding: The variant rs6460068 was found to be associated with aortic root diameter and aortic valve mean gradient, overlapping a VIC enhancer that was predicted to regulate ELN, an extracellular matrix protein critical for heart valve integrity. This association highlighted a pathway relevant to congenital heart defects, particularly supravalvular aortic stenosis.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: This SNP was the only one identified from the CC-GWAS analysis comparing BDI vs BDII, located on chromosome 7p22.3, presenting significant p-values of 2.83×10^-8 (OLS) and 6.07×10^-5 (EXACT), highlighting a specific genetic distinction between the two subtypes.
title: Patterns of convergence and divergence between bipolar disorder type I and type II: evidence from integrative genomic analyses

finding: The association of this variant was noted in connection with protein levels and gene <italic>TMEM106B</italic>.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: At the C1GALT1 locus, the SNP rs10246303-T was associated with decreased modified Tiffeneau-Pinelli index and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). This association contributed to understanding genetic factors related to IgA glycosylation.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: The SNP rs10238682-G was identified as a positive regulator of C1GALT1 expression. It was associated with higher serum gd-IgA levels and showed strong linkage disequilibrium (R² > 0.8) with lead SNPs, emphasizing its potential role in IgA nephropathy risk.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: The synonymous SNV on PILRA was exome-wide significant in the AD-age score linear regression and suggestive in the Cox regression, indicating its relevance in AD risk.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs12113284 appeared in the review by Martel et al., which discussed liquid biopsy approaches for solid ophthalmic malignancies including retinoblastoma. This research emphasized the relevance of genetic markers in liquid biopsy methodologies, linking this SNP to advancements in diagnostic techniques for RB.
title: TFF1 – a new Biomarker in Liquid Biopsies of Retinoblastoma under Therapy

finding: Another significant finding (p=2.47×10^-10) from the OUD-MTAG study was linked to the FOXP2 gene, suggesting a notable association with OUD risk.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: This SNP was located in FOXP2 on chromosome 7 and was the second most strongly associated locus with ADHD-CUD, having an OR of 1.05 and a P-value of 6.67×10^-16. It was also associated with ADHD and CUD separately.
title: Disentangling the shared genetics of ADHD, cannabis use disorder and cannabis use and prediction of cannabis use disorder in ADHD

finding: The rs38904 SNP was associated with the CFTR gene's expression in secretory TA precursor cells and intestinal stromal cells, suggesting that downregulation of CFTR may be protective against Crohn's disease (CD). This finding corroborated that CFTR loss-of-function mutations provided a protective effect against CD.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: The SNP rs11976145 was identified as the lead eQTL for TBX20, a gene associated with cardiac development. It colocalized with CAD GWAS signals, supporting its implication in CAD risk pathways.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The variant rs10249005 showed overlap in association with TBX20's eQTL in STARNET aorta, reinforcing the complex genetic regulation connected to TBX20 and its relevance in coronary artery disease.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs13237518, associated with TMEM106B, exhibited significant variations in IS thickness suggesting a relationship between this SNP and neurodegenerative diseases is noteworthy.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The minor allele of TMEM106B rs1990622 was linked to a decreased risk of Frontotemporal Dementia (FTD) and associated with greater gray matter volume in GRN mutation carriers, particularly in the left thalamus. This association was retained in presymptomatic GRN mutation carriers. The minor allele also associated with increased cognitive scores among all C9orf72 mutation carriers and presymptomatic C9orf72 mutation carriers, suggesting that the minor allele may serve as a protective factor against cognitive decline.
title: Gene specific effects on brain volume and cognition of TMEM106B in frontotemporal lobar degeneration

finding: This SNP was identified as a trans-ancestry variant linked with lower testosterone levels in African and Hispanic ancestry groups but associated with higher testosterone levels in the European ancestry group. This indicated differential effects based on ancestry.
title: Discovery of Novel Trans-Ancestry and Ancestry-Specific Gene Loci for Total Testosterone in a Multi-Ancestral Analysis of Men in the Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP near the BAIAP2L1 gene was associated with lower odds of prostate cancer in the European ancestry group, reinforcing the relationship between testosterone and prostate cancer risk.
title: Discovery of Novel Trans-Ancestry and Ancestry-Specific Gene Loci for Total Testosterone in a Multi-Ancestral Analysis of Men in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs41301394 was identified as a genome-wide significant intronic variant within the POR gene, which is crucial for xenobiotic metabolism. The analysis associated this SNP with the clozapine:norclozapine metabolic ratio, presenting a high posterior probability of being a causal variant (PPI=0.437). This finding suggested that the metabolic ratio might be more strongly related to norclozapine pharmacokinetics rather than clozapine plasma concentrations.
title: Pharmacokinetics and pharmacogenomics of clozapine in an ancestrally diverse sample: A longitudinal analysis and GWAS using clinical monitoring data from the UK

finding: SNP rs939955 was associated with triglyceride levels, demonstrating a significant association with a p-value of 2.47 × 10^-9 in the KoGES study and a p-value of 1.2 × 10^-4 in BBJ.
title: Genome-wide study on 72,298 Korean individuals in Korean biobank data for 76 traits identifies hundreds of novel loci

finding: This SNP, located in TMEM106B, was found to increase injury/inflammation scores (PC3) by +0.26SD (SE=0.04, p=1.3*10^-9). It also had significant mediation effects on latent AD, highlighting its role in neuronal injury/inflammation.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: This SNP displayed strong associations with non-AD inflammation in males (-1.20SD, SE=0.22, p=2.4*10^-8) without similar findings in female participants.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs2267735 in the ADCYAP1R1 gene was reported to be associated with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms. A meta-analysis found significant links between this SNP and PTSD, indicating its relevance in the disorder's etiology. This association was further supported by a longitudinal study that examined the gene-environment interactions, emphasizing that variations in rs2267735 contributed to the progression and expression of PTSD symptoms over time.
title: Circulating PACAP levels are associated with increased amygdala-default mode network resting-state connectivity in posttraumatic stress disorder

finding: The SNP rs10227454 was also identified in the female-only analysis as a genome-wide significant risk locus on chromosome 7, with a p-value of 4.99×10−8, located near the gene FOXP2, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors associated with borderline personality disorder (BPD).
title: Genome-wide association study of borderline personality disorder identifies six loci and highlights shared risk with mental and somatic disorders

finding: In a sensitivity analysis, rs4727799 located in FOXP2 was noted as a genome-wide significant association with borderline personality disorder (BPD), confirming its relevance observed prior in the main analysis.
title: Genome-wide association study of borderline personality disorder identifies six loci and highlights shared risk with mental and somatic disorders

finding: Genetic screening for the Serpine 1 mutation (rs1799768) indicated that more than 50% of the patients harbored some mutation, with approximately 42% detected as homozygous dominant (5G/5G), 39% as heterozygote (5G/4G), and 15% as homozygous recessive (4G/4G). This finding suggested a significant risk increase for thrombophilia among these individuals.
title: KASP-PCR method to screen thrombophilia genetic risk factors

finding: The rs6945340/HIP1 variant showed the largest number of enriched pathways (n=391, all tissues) with heart left-ventricle being the primary tissue. Significant pathways related to this variant included Krebs cycle and oxidative phosphorylation, which were associated with heart failure.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify drug targets for heart failure

finding: The variant rs142738614 was associated with a higher risk for rheumatoid arthritis and suggested for potential repurposing of drugs targeting autoimmune conditions.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: This SNP located at 7p11.2 was significantly associated with MacTel (P=5.9×10^-9), reaffirming its relevance in the disease architecture.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The SNP rs56232506, which corresponds to the gene TNS3, was part of a complex interaction identified in the NCT02430480 cohort. It showed significant mediation with CMB 216 in predicting response to NADT (total effect p < 0.05; average causal mediation effects p < 0.05), thus providing independent prognostic capability when analyzed alongside other clinical factors.
title: AI-Powered cellular morphometric biomarkers discovered in needle biopsy of prostatic cancer predict neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy response and prognosis: an international multicenter retrospective study

finding: The SNP rs2385537 was associated with the isoform ENST00000476671 of KMT2E, linked to the risk of CDG with an adjusted P value of 7.63 × 10^-3. This SNP was within the gene body and related to previous findings of ADHD, ASD, BP, and SCZ, where KMT2E is involved in histone methylation and neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs7803925 near the ZNF800 locus was associated with TC relative change, showing a beta of -0.078 and a p-value of 4.09e-08.
title: Leveraging large-scale biobank EHRs to enhance pharmacogenetics of cardiometabolic disease medications

finding: The study indicated that the rs342293 polymorphism was associated with adverse cardiac events in patients who underwent percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). This association provided insight into genetic factors influencing patient outcomes in CAD-related interventions, establishing a link between this SNP and clinical significance in cardiac risk assessments.
title: The prognostic value of mean platelet volume in patients with coronary artery disease: a systematic review with meta-analyses

finding: The SNP rs858275 was identified as having a strong association with GPNMB protein levels in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). This finding was part of a larger analysis linking protein quantitative trait loci (pQTLs) to genetic variants, suggesting that this SNP may influence the abundance of the GPNMB protein, which has been shown to be upregulated in the substantia nigra of Parkinson's disease (PD) patients.
title: Parkinson’s disease causality and heterogeneity: a proteogenomic view

finding: The SNP rs13245319 was associated with gastrointestinal disorders including IBS and was linked to obesity and kidney stones; however, it was not statistically significant concerning COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: The variant rs551227135 was associated with the CFTR gene, specifically NM_000492.4:c.1210-11_1210-10insG, which had a MAF of 0.9%. It was classified as a 'mild' pathogenic variant, linked to non-classical presentations of cystic fibrosis, such as CABVD, recurrent pancreatitis, and late-onset cystic fibrosis. This finding contributed to understanding carrier risks in the population.
title: Complete genomic profiles of 1,496 Taiwanese reveal curated medical insights

finding: The SNP rs6465810 at locus 7q22.1 was identified as a novel association for orofacial clefts, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors for cleft lip and palate.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiethnic non-syndromic orofacial cleft families identifies novel loci specific to family and phenotypic subtypes

finding: SNP rs1016193 was associated with the cis-regulation of PRKAG2 expression and with altered IFNB1 expression in response to Mtb infection, underlining its role in immune response.
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis-dependent Monocyte Expression Quantitative Trait Loci and Tuberculosis Pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs11763147 in <italic>VKORC1L1</italic> was found to be associated with CCT in a combined meta-analysis of European and Asian samples (P=4.0×10<sup>−9</sup>), indicating its potential role in influencing CCT.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis identified genes pleiotropically associated with central corneal thickness

finding: The intronic variant rs2897075:C>T in ZKSCAN1 significantly associated with hospitalization (OR = 1.05, 95% CI = 1.03–1.07, P = 8.9 × 10−9) and lung function.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: rs79226025 was associated with ALL in the replication cohort, following the initial association driven by Latin American (LAT) participants. The lead SNP from the discovery cohort showed strong replication (P = 6.81 x 10^-9 combined with discovery cohort).
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The rs113993960 variant in CFTR was found to lead to the deletion of a crucial F508 residue of the CFTR protein, and was present at a high frequency (AF = 0.0063) in the Russian population, confirming earlier genetic epidemiology studies.
title: Expanding the Russian allele frequency reference via cross-laboratory data integration: insights from 7,452 exome samples

finding: The SNP rs10260816 was among the 210 causal variants previously associated with cardiovascular traits in Europeans, contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on cardiovascular health.
title: Distinct Genetic Loci and Variations in Blood Pressure and Pulse Rate in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was positively associated with cardiovascular traits, displaying p=1.9×10^-8 in the AFR population and p=4.0×10^-16 in the EUR population.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: The study identified rs2233580 in the PAX4 gene (p.R200H; CADD score = 29.8) as a variant associated with both peptic ulcer disease (PUD) and type 2 diabetes. This variant was common in East Asian populations but almost monogenic in non-East Asian populations.
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: EPHA1:rs11762262-A was identified as a protective variant.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: RELN:rs201731543-C was included among resilient alleles in the ancestry analysis.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The variant rs221783 was associated with decreased glucose levels (p = 1.8 x 10<sup>-11</sup>, effect = -0.03 SD) and HbA1c levels (p = 3.6 x 10<sup>-7</sup>, effect = -0.02 SD). It was also linked to increased cholesterol (p = 7.0 x 10<sup>-12</sup>, effect = 0.03 SD) and a decreased risk of T2D (p = 0.005, OR = 0.96). This association was observed in an analysis of 294,042 unrelated White individuals and replicated in Biobank Japan and FinnGen, reinforcing its significance in glucose metabolism and diabetes risk.
title: Gene-level analysis of rare variants in 363,977 whole exome sequences reveals an association of GIGYF1 loss of function with diabetes

finding: The study investigated the RARRES2 gene polymorphism (rs17173608) and its association with serum Chemerin levels in the context of acute myocardial infarction (AMI) risk factors within an Iranian population. It was reported that this SNP was positively associated with increased risk of AMI, highlighting its role in cardiovascular disease mechanisms related to diabetes mellitus.
title: A Bibliometric Analysis of Research Hotspots and Frontiers in Diabetes and Cardiovascular Disease Comorbidity from 2005 to 2024

finding: The rs113993960 variant in CFTR was associated with cystic fibrosis, demonstrating a significant odds ratio (OR=14.67) that highlights its pathogenic role in this condition.
title: Decoding Genetics, Ancestry, and Geospatial Context for Precision Health

finding: The common promoter variant rs1617640 was associated with increased plasma erythropoietin (EPO) levels and was linked to a reduced risk of overall clonal haematopoiesis (CH) (OR=0.68; 95% CI=0.50-0.93; P=0.01), as well as decreased risks for both <italic>DNMT3A</italic>-mutant (OR=0.68; 95% CI=0.48-0.96; P=0.03) and <italic>TET2</italic>-mutant (OR=0.48; 95% CI=0.24-0.97; P=0.04) CH. These findings highlighted the protective role of higher genetically predicted plasma EPO levels against clonal haematopoiesis and its common subtypes.
title: Genetically predicted plasma erythropoietin levels and clonal haematopoiesis risk: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The rare missense mutation rs11976235 was also associated with increased plasma EPO levels. Although the MR analysis indicated a negative association with overall CH (OR=0.87; P=0.26) and <italic>DNMT3A</italic>-mutant CH (OR=0.81; P=0.12), statistical significance was not achieved. However, this SNP corroborated the potential protective effect of elevated EPO levels against <italic>TET2</italic>-mutant CH, aligning with the results obtained through rs1617640. Overall, the findings supported the hypothesis that EPO elevating strategies might help in reducing the risk of CH.
title: Genetically predicted plasma erythropoietin levels and clonal haematopoiesis risk: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The rs12700027 variant in the BRAT1/LFNG genes was significant for heterogeneity across ancestry groups (p = 0.00019) and was strongly associated in the European ancestry cohort (β = 0.0327, p = 1.2e-15, MAF = 0.10). It replicated nominally in a replication cohort (p = 0.0065).
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The SNP rs11768878 was found to be significantly associated with peak forward velocity at the aortic annulus (Ao_FVmax) with a log10 p-value of 43.30, indicating its relevance in cardiac flow dynamics.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: The SNP rs34098933 showed significant correlation with forward left ventricular stroke volume, achieving a log10 p-value of 8.33, highlighting its role in cardiac volume measurements.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: The variant rs4719607 was linked to BSA-indexed aortic valve regurgitation volume with a log10 p-value of 7.34, reinforcing its association with aortic valve pathophysiology.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: Variant rs7782306 exhibited significant relevance to aortic valve regurgitation fraction in the context of aortic annulus area with a causal relationship involving the ELN gene.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: The SNP rs79970906 was identified as significantly associated with brushite stone composition. This association was part of a study that replicated variants linked to kidney stone disease at the NXPH1 gene on chromosome 7, suggesting a functional role of the gene in the context of kidney stone formation.
title: Evaluation of genetic associations with clinical phenotypes of kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs4725104 also showed a significant association with brushite stone composition and was located within the coding region of the NXPH1 gene. This variant was part of the same significant findings regarding kidney stone composition subtypes.
title: Evaluation of genetic associations with clinical phenotypes of kidney stone disease

finding: With a probability of 96.2%, the SNP rs4556017 was identified as a causal variant exuding eQTL effects on the ACHE gene. This gene encodes an enzyme that hydrolyzes acetylcholine and could influence gut motility, making it relevant for potential HEM susceptibility mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 944,133 individuals provides insights into the etiology of hemorrhoidal disease

finding: The SNP rs11770437 was identified in the ELN gene, a major hub gene for ECM organization related with HEM pathophysiology, particularly due to its association with connective tissue properties.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 944,133 individuals provides insights into the etiology of hemorrhoidal disease

finding: The SNP rs42039 was introduced as an instrument associated with both BMI and stroke, and although it was initially assumed to be valid, it was ultimately excluded by the PSEE method due to suspicions of being an invalid instrument.
title: Penalized Semiparametric Estimation for Causal Inference with Possibly Invalid Instruments

finding: The SNP rs4632959 colocalized with the CpG cg03676485 (LFNG), which was associated with both systolic and diastolic blood pressure. This SNP explained approximately 100% of the observed PPFC, highlighting a critical role for DNA methylation in blood pressure regulation.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: The SNP rs4728142 was a strong cis-mQTL variant for the CpG cg12816198 (IRF5) and was linked to systolic blood pressure. The MR analysis indicated a causal pathway whereby this SNP affects DNA methylation levels, influencing blood pressure outcomes.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: This intergenic SNP was experimentally validated as an allele-specific enhancer of IRF5, a key gene associated with SLE.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The SNP rs4582488 was shown to be significantly associated with ACE gene expression in multiple tissues, implying a link between the SNP and cardiovascular health, particularly in association with resting heart rate and heart rate response to exercise.
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: The lead variant for locus 3, rs17167210, was identified with a p-value of 1.5 × 10^−9. It was located in the intron of the EXOC4 gene and functioned as an eQTL for EXOC4 and LRGUK in brain tissue, suggesting its role in gene regulation relevant to RTV.
title: Genome-wide association study in 404,302 individuals identifies 7 significant loci for reaction time variability

finding: The SNP rs11768150 was a nearby intronic variant of rs17167210, displaying a CADD score of 13.5 suggestive of potential deleterious effects. It had high linkage disequilibrium with the lead variant in locus 3, further supporting its relevance in gene regulation related to RTV.
title: Genome-wide association study in 404,302 individuals identifies 7 significant loci for reaction time variability

finding: This variant was implicated in type 2 diabetes and was part of the locus colocalizing for type 2 diabetes and knee osteoarthritis with a high posterior probability, showing its importance in the genetic architecture of both diseases.
title: Insights into the comorbidity between type 2 diabetes and osteoarthritis

finding: Associated with appendicular lean mass, this SNP colocalized with type 2 diabetes and knee osteoarthritis. Its genetic association suggested contrary effects between the two diseases, making it a significant marker in understanding their comorbidity.
title: Insights into the comorbidity between type 2 diabetes and osteoarthritis

finding: Linked to the MACC1 gene, rs182113773 was pinpointed in the cardiometabolic joint test with a p-value of 2.71×10^-8, demonstrating regulatory roles in transcription within immune cells, suggesting significance in mediating immune responses that affect COVID-19 severity.
title: Gene-environment interaction analysis incorporating sex, cardiometabolic diseases, and multiple deprivation index reveals novel genetic associations with COVID-19 severity

finding: This SNP revealed an additional signal in chromosome 7 that was associated with accelerated brain aging. Mapped to the intron of FAM3C, which encodes a secreted protein implicated in pancreatic cancer and Alzheimer's disease, its association with a specific brain aging mode was further validated by another study employing a data-driven decomposition approach.
title: Population clustering of structural brain aging and its association with brain development

finding: The SNP rs111593852 associated with TRIM24 showed significant evidence (p = 3.75 × 10^-7, beta = 0.87).
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The GPNMB rs199347 G allele was significantly associated with alterations in small-worldness properties of the white matter network, indicating its role in brain network topology related to Parkinson's disease.
title: Parkinson’s disease-associated genetic variants synergistically shape brain networks

finding: The intronic SNP rs2944819 located within the gene CALN1 was identified as a candidate for schizophrenia risk. This SNP was situated within an open chromatin region (OCR) mapped in developing GABAergic neuron populations from the caudal ganglionic eminence.
title: Genetic implication of prenatal GABAergic and cholinergic neuron development in susceptibility to schizophrenia

finding: The intronic SNP rs11972718 located within the gene NXPH1 was also found to be a potential risk variant for schizophrenia. It was located within an OCR specifically mapped in the medial ganglionic eminence neuron populations.
title: Genetic implication of prenatal GABAergic and cholinergic neuron development in susceptibility to schizophrenia

finding: This SNP, associated with CALN1, showed evidence for an interaction with LTST affecting HDL-c, which was a novel finding in the context of sleep and lipid interactions.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: This SNP, associated with ALKBH4, demonstrated an interaction with STST in HDL-c levels, representing a novel discovery of genetic influences on lipids linked to sleep.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The rs1990622(A) variant was identified as a strong pQTL for TMEM106B protein levels, showing significant associations with increased protein levels in both plasma and cerebrospinal fluid across multiple cohorts, while it lacked consistent association with mRNA expression. This suggested a mechanism by which the TMEM106B locus influences protein levels post-transcriptionally.
title: A 3’UTR Insertion Is a Candidate Causal Variant at the TMEM106B Locus Associated with Increased Risk for FTLD-TDP

finding: The variant rs45446698, located upstream of the CYP3A7 gene, was associated with higher and more stable levels of 4-androsten-3alpha,17alpha-diol monosulfate (2) in individuals with the TT homozygote compared to TG heterozygotes, indicating its role in regulating this sulfated steroid.
title: Longitudinal analysis of genetic and environmental interplay in human metabolic profiles and the implication for metabolic health

finding: The SNP rs6466720 was associated with the EBV amino acid variant BRLF1:p.Lys316Glu, which plays a role in lytic reactivation of EBV. The finding highlighted its significant association with the variation in this protein, which has implications in viral transcription and latency.
title: The influence of human genetic variation on Epstein-Barr virus sequence diversity

finding: The SNP rs2280548, associated with the MAD1L1 gene, had a significant association with mLOX (OR=1.03) and was also implicated in mLOY, highlighting shared genetic architecture.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The rs1990622 variant was associated with protection against frontotemporal lobar degeneration with TAR DNA binding protein inclusions (FTD-LD) with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.61 and a p-value of 1.08 x 10^-11. This finding highlighted the protective effect of this variant in those at risk for neurodegenerative diseases.
title: An AluYb8 mobile element characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The rs13237518 variant was associated with protection against Alzheimer’s disease, exhibiting an odds ratio (OR) of 0.96 and a p-value of 4.90 x 10^-11, indicating its role in reducing the risk of developing Alzheimer's.
title: An AluYb8 mobile element characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The rs36170929 locus achieved genome-wide significance (p=4.39e-8) and was associated with COVID-19 breakthrough infection (BI). It mapped to the uncharacterized protein-coding gene LOC102725191, and the top gene associated with this SNP was VWDE, known to be involved in inflammation and hemostasis, possibly related to increased thrombosis risk in COVID-19 patients.
title: Genome-wide association study of COVID-19 Breakthrough Infections and genetic overlap with other diseases: A study of the UK Biobank

finding: rs308107 was associated with increased regulatory activity in enhancer, promoter, and CTCF-Cohesin categories.
