It was linked to the expression levels of the <italic>RERE</italic> transcript in the brain. <italic>RERE</italic> is known as a syndromic autism gene, and variants in this SNP have been associated with autism, particularly in relation with major depression and intelligence.
title: An unbiased de novo network analysis uncovering causal genes and the developmental intersection between autism and co-occurring traits

finding: The rs10276352 (G>A) SNP functioned as a significant sQTL associated with a cryptic exon inclusion in the SP4 gene. Its association was linked to schizophrenia (SCZ) and bipolar disorder (BIP), suggesting that the risk allele increased the inclusion of a 181 bp unannotated exon, potentially leading to nonsense-mediated decay and loss of functional domains critical for SP4's activity.
title: Cross-ancestry, cell-type-informed atlas of gene, isoform, and splicing regulation in the developing human brain

finding: The study identified that <italic>GPNMB</italic> rs199347 significantly modified the activity of the sensorimotor network (adjusted <italic>p</italic> < 0.0007, FDR corrected). It was correlated with the global topology of functional networks, specifically shaping the nodal metrics of bilateral caudate. This finding was contextualized in the understanding of its role as a protective genetic locus in Parkinson's disease, as carriers of the G allele exhibited higher global efficiency in functional networks.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: Found to be associated with HF, this SNP also remained significant after strict replication criteria were applied, indicating its potential relevance to HF risk.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP was part of the small set of SNPs that remained significant at the conservative threshold, establishing its role in the context of HF.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: SNP rs17685 was associated with reduced risk of both OUD and alcohol use disorder (AUD) and also served as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene POR.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs2696880, an intronic variant in CNOT4, was identified as a significant GWS variant linked with various substance use traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs6974377 was noted for its intergenic association with SP4, linked to smoking traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs1990622 was located downstream of TMEM106B and showed a strong association with depression (P = 2.30 × 10−16). Functional studies validated the regulatory effect where the G allele conferred significantly higher luciferase activity compared to the A allele, suggesting its role as a functional risk variant.
title: Cross-ancestry genome-wide association study and systems-level integrative analyses implicate new risk genes and therapeutic targets for depression

finding: The SNP rs12113175 was identified as significant in the context of glioma metabolism, particularly related to the response of brain tumors to the mutant IDH1 inhibitor BAY1436032. This finding was associated with non-invasive measurement of drug responses in a clinical setting, indicating its relevance in the metabolic profiles of gliomas, which were captured through advanced spectroscopic techniques.
title: Individualized diversity in the extracellular metabolome of live human gliomas

finding: The SNP rs42044, located in the CDK6 gene, was confirmed as significant in GWA analyses for body mass index (BMI) and neutrophil cell count, supporting its association with critically ill COVID-19 status.
title: Critically ill COVID-19 status associated trait genetics reveals CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: At the PTPRZ1 locus, the rs77810251 variant's association with HDL levels differed in the 'ever-smoking' exposure group, where the minor A allele was positively associated with HDL levels (Interaction P=9.5×10⁻⁷), but showed no association in the 'never-smoking' group. This suggested that smoking could disrupt the relationship between this SNP and HDL levels.
title: Multi-omics insights into the biological mechanisms underlying gene-by-lifestyle interactions with smoking and alcohol consumption detected by genome-wide trans-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: A significant finding near CACNA2D1 (p=2.10E-08) related to nervousness and impulsivity.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: The rs1008898 SNP within the C1GALT1 gene exhibited statistically significant interaction with IL5RA (P < 0.001) for IgAN pathogenesis, suggesting a key role in disease development.
title: Candidate genes for IgA nephropathy in pediatric patients: exome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs12113142 was associated with the Notch signaling pathway, which was identified as abnormally active in both Crohn's disease (CD) and ulcerative colitis (UC). It was noted that measuring activity in this pathway might provide clinically relevant information to differentiate IBD types and predict treatment resistance to anti-TNF-α, especially in patients with colon-localized IBD.
title: Improved diagnosis of inflammatory bowel disease and prediction and monitoring of response to anti-TNF alpha treatment based on measurement of signal transduction pathway activity

finding: This SNP was found significantly associated with Subtype I, reinforcing its role in mild symptom characteristics.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs10273639 was identified as being in linkage disequilibrium with a functional PRSS1 promoter variant, which was associated with a protective effect against chronic pancreatitis (CP). This finding highlighted the relevance of the PRSS1 gene in the context of CP and indicated that variants could serve as protective factors, possibly influencing disease susceptibility.
title: A proposed general variant classification framework using chronic pancreatitis as a disease model

finding: SNP rs13234970 was identified in association with appetite changes and was noted as the nearest gene variant linked to TMEM106B. This gene has been previously implicated in depression and its dysregulation associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) subtypes.
title: Investigating the genetic relationship between depression symptoms and Alzheimer’s Disease in clinically diagnosed and proxy cases

finding: The variant rs3807866 was associated with depressed mood and, like rs13234970, was identified as a lead variant near TMEM106B, which has been suggested to play a causal role in depression.
title: Investigating the genetic relationship between depression symptoms and Alzheimer’s Disease in clinically diagnosed and proxy cases

finding: The SNP rs12699338 was identified as linked to the sum score of the PHQ-9, further supporting the involvement of TMEM106B in depression-related phenotypes, and was recognized in previous GWAS concerning various depressive symptoms.
title: Investigating the genetic relationship between depression symptoms and Alzheimer’s Disease in clinically diagnosed and proxy cases

finding: The SNP rs776746 was associated with 39% of the variability in tacrolimus dose requirement among subjects. Individuals carrying the CYP3A5*3 loss-of-function allele demonstrated reduced clearance and therefore required significantly lower doses of tacrolimus to maintain therapeutic drug levels. The study confirmed the strong impact of this SNP on tacrolimus metabolism, reinforcing evidence from prior studies regarding its causal effect on clearance.
title: Sensitivity of Estimated Tacrolimus Population Pharmacokinetic Profile to Inaccurate Assumptions about Dose Timing and Absorption: An Investigation in Real-World and Simulated Data

finding: The SNP rs4721411, located at the MAD1L1 locus, exhibited a positive association with axial motor presentation in Parkinson's disease, showing a Beta of 0.54 and a P-value of 1.6e-7.
title: Association of genetic variation at the GJA5/ACP6 locus with motor progression in Parkinson’s

finding: The SNP rs12113266 was identified as a significant marker relating to outcomes in cancer patients infected with SARS-CoV-2, particularly influencing disease prognosis. This association underscored the interaction between viral infections and cancer pathophysiology.
title: Network biology and bioinformatics-based framework to identify the impacts of SARS-CoV-2 infections on lung cancer and tuberculosis

finding: The SNP rs13225633 was explored for its role in the metastasis of lung cancer, further demonstrating its relevance in the clinical context of disease management in COVID-19 scenarios, as identified in the transcriptome analyses pertaining to competitive outcomes in lung cancer patients.
title: Network biology and bioinformatics-based framework to identify the impacts of SARS-CoV-2 infections on lung cancer and tuberculosis

finding: The SNP rs776746, associated with the CYP3A5*3 allele, was linked to significant variability in tacrolimus metabolism. This allele was found to classify patients into poor metabolizers, significantly affecting tacrolimus clearance and dose response in lung transplant recipients.
title: Development and validation of a population pharmacokinetic model to guide perioperative tacrolimus dosing after lung transplantation

finding: The SNP rs10264272, associated with the CYP3A5*6 allele, also contributed to variations in tacrolimus pharmacokinetics. It was linked to intermediate metabolizer status among patients, which influenced how these individuals metabolized tacrolimus compared to extensive metabolizers.
title: Development and validation of a population pharmacokinetic model to guide perioperative tacrolimus dosing after lung transplantation

finding: The SNP rs35599367 was found to be significant in affecting tacrolimus pharmacokinetics, with data indicating it plays a role in the metabolic pathway after controlling for CYP3A5 variant effects. This variant further influenced tacrolimus dose response post-lung transplantation.
title: Development and validation of a population pharmacokinetic model to guide perioperative tacrolimus dosing after lung transplantation

finding: The lead variant rs4731702 at the KLF14 locus was identified as a cis-eQTL for the KLF14 transcription factor. It was associated with the expression of 385 target genes in trans, 18 of which had independent cis associations for other metabolic traits, indicating its relevance to gene regulation in type 2 diabetes.
title: Trans-eQTL mapping prioritises USP18 as a negative regulator of interferon response at a lupus risk locus

finding: The SNP rs3110823 in the gene STMP1 showed a significant association in the EUR cohort (βA allele = 0.056, p = 2.24 × 10⁻⁶) at a replication threshold of 4.5 × 10⁻⁴. This demonstrated a positive finding as it was replicated from larger GWAS.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of mtDNA copy number in a multi-ancestry cohort

finding: Associated with mortality in PD (HR=2.04 [95% CI 1.63 to 2.56], p=7.71 x 10^-10) and identified within the TBXAS1 gene.
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and motor progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: This SNP, the top locus near ASNS, showed significant association with motor progression (p < 5 x 10^-8).
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and motor progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs150022429 was associated with stroke of any mechanism in the analysis from the TOPMed study, linked to the gene AUTS2, and also driven by rare variants.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Analyses Support a Role of Vitamin D Metabolism in Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs141857337 was associated with hemorrhagic stroke in the results from the TOPMed study, indicating its role in the genetic etiology of this condition.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Analyses Support a Role of Vitamin D Metabolism in Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs6466720 was associated with the amino acid variant BRLF1:p.Lys316Glu, showing an OR of 1.41 and a p-value of 6.85×10^-11. BRLF1 is pivotal for the lytic reactivation of EBV from latency and regulation of viral transcription. This variant had not been previously documented but is in moderate linkage disequilibrium with another variant known to be prevalent in certain cancers.
title: The influence of human genetic variation on Epstein-Barr virus sequence diversity

finding: The SNP rs2855983 was identified as the lead PRSS2 expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) variant with the largest effect size in pancreatic tissues. This variant was in complete LD with the haplotype structure and was the top SNV associated with alcoholic chronic pancreatitis (P=1e-40) in a large-scale association study.
title: Structural evolution of trypsinogen gene redundancy confers risk for pancreas diseases

finding: rs12705966 was highlighted as part of a locus statistically significantly associated with chronic pain, reflecting its role in the shared genetic background underlying various chronic pain types.
title: Decomposing the genetic background of chronic back pain

finding: The alternate allele of rs10950456 in MAD1L1 was associated with a decreased risk of mCA and lower cancer risk, supporting its role in chromosomal stability and cancer protection.
title: Genetic variant in SPDL1 reveals novel mechanism linking pulmonary fibrosis risk and cancer protection

finding: The rs2049603 variant was identified as significantly associated with osteoarthritis (OA) in the multi-ancestry genetic analyses of Veterans in the Million Veteran Program (MVP) and was replicated in the UK Biobank (UKB) among European descent participants.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: The rs1916980 SNP also showed significant association with osteoarthritis (OA) within the FOXP2 gene region during multi-ancestry analyses, with replication confirmed in the UK Biobank for European ancestry.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: The rs2396724 variant was found to be significantly associated with osteoarthritis (OA) in the MVP multi-ancestry analysis and showed persistent association in MVP-EUR, although it was only nominally significant in UKB-EUR.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was confirmed to be associated with osteoarthritis (OA) in the Hispanic Veterans, as well as in the MVP and UKB combined analyses, indicating its relevance across ancestry groups.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs1045642 in the ABCB1 gene showed a significantly higher frequency of homozygosity in the high-risk infant cohort compared to Ensembl (43.6% vs. 18.7%, p<0.001). This variant is associated with opioid pharmacokinetics and may influence opioid transport across the blood-brain barrier.
title: Identifying Opioid-Related Pharmacogenomic Variants in High-Risk Hospitalized Infants: A Pilot Study

finding: Similar to rs1045642, rs2032582 in the ABCB1 gene also exhibited a significantly higher frequency of homozygosity in high-risk infants when compared to Ensembl (42.7% vs. 15.9%, p<0.001), suggesting its involvement in opioid metabolism.
title: Identifying Opioid-Related Pharmacogenomic Variants in High-Risk Hospitalized Infants: A Pilot Study

finding: The SNP rs10279675, located near ORC5, showed a significant interaction with cumulative prenatal stress, affecting DNAm at cg06592260 in EPPK1 (B=-0.012, SE=0.002, p=2.76×10^-13).
title: Interactive effects of genotype with prenatal stress on DNA methylation at birth

finding: An association involving rs2188287 in ORC5 was identified through its interaction with cumulative prenatal stress for DNAm at the cg06592260 site in EPPK1, with B=-0.013, SE=0.002, p=1.85×10^-13.
title: Interactive effects of genotype with prenatal stress on DNA methylation at birth

finding: The interaction of rs10251976 in ORC5 with cumulative prenatal stress influenced DNAm at cg06592260 in EPPK1, shown by significant results (B=-0.012, SE=0.002, p=7.32×10^-13).
title: Interactive effects of genotype with prenatal stress on DNA methylation at birth

finding: The SNP rs4632959 was shown to colocalize with the CpG cg03676485 (<LFNG>) which is related to systolic and diastolic blood pressure. This SNP achieved a PPFC of 0.99, indicating it explained approximately 100% of the colocalization with blood pressure measurements.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: SNP rs4728142, an intergenic variant associated with hypertension, was identified as a strong <cis>-mQTL for the CpG cg12816198 (<IRF5>), with a PPFC of 7e-215. It was the leading instrumental variable in MR analysis of systolic blood pressure, indicating a causal relationship where this SNP influences DNA methylation affecting blood pressure.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: The intronic SNP rs4721243 of MAD1L1 was identified as a novel finding associated with the conversion from active surveillance to active treatment in patients with low-risk prostate cancer. It was located at a previously identified prostate cancer locus, with a combined hazard ratio (HR) of 5.65 and a p-value of 7 x 10^-10.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Prostate Cancer Conversion from Active Surveillance to Treatment

finding: The SNP rs12705715 was nominally significant in the FinnGen replication analysis, contributing to locus 9.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Traumatic Brain Injury in U.S. Military Veterans Enrolled in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs190894416 was identified as a novel signal associated with dysentery. It demonstrated a striking odds ratio of 16 with a corresponding P-value of 6.9 × 10^-9, revealing it as a strong genetic factor contributing to this infectious disease.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: Located near the FLNC gene, SNP rs143973349 was uniquely identified in the analysis restricted to European ancestry and has established connections to various forms of familial cardiomyopathy.
title: Clinical and Genetic Associations of Deep Learning-Derived Cardiac Magnetic Resonance-Based Left Ventricular Mass

finding: This was the most significant association for LVMI analysis, located close to TTN and was earlier indicated in relationships with increased risks of both HCM and DCM.
title: Clinical and Genetic Associations of Deep Learning-Derived Cardiac Magnetic Resonance-Based Left Ventricular Mass

finding: SNP rs748670681 in the TNRC18 gene locus demonstrated a significant association with anterior uveitis (p = 7.1 x 10^-24) and multiple autoimmune conditions, including inflammatory bowel disease (p = 2.0 x 10^-132).
title: Genome-wide association study of anterior uveitis

finding: SNP rs6961970, found in the intronic region of the FOXP2 gene, was also identified as one of the lead SNPs in the novel anxiety loci with high CADD scores, suggesting functional relevance.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs1800796, associated with Interleukin-6 (IL-6), was found to relate to the risk of ischemic stroke (IS) in indigenous West African Men, indicating a potential link between inflammatory processes and IS risk.
title: Integrative genetic analysis reveals new relationships between intraocular pressure, glaucoma and ischemic stroke risk: A study based on combined SNP-to-gene, mendelian randomization and pathway investigations

finding: The non-synonymous variant rs34372369 located in <italic>EPHA1</italic> was found to be associated with LDL-C, nonHDL-C, and TC specifically in females. This was significant with p-values lower than 5×10^-8 for females, while male p-values exceeded 0.05, indicating the association was selective to females.
title: Implicating genes, pleiotropy and sexual dimorphism at blood lipid loci through multi-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs45446698, located in the CYP3A7 gene, was associated with the odds of missingness of multiple metabolites related to steroids and bile acids. It had previous associations with breast cancer, oestrone levels, and atorvastatin metabolism.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The G allele at rs113525298 was associated with increased minimum number of first-out-of-bed minutes and decreased minimum number of total-vigorously-active minutes. This SNP, located near the ELFN1 gene implicated in ADHD, was significantly more enriched in healthy controls compared to individuals with ADHD, suggesting a potential protective role against hyperactivity disorders.
title: Digital phenotyping from wearables using AI characterizes psychiatric disorders and identifies genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs111593852 in TRIM24 showed significant association with PSP (p = 3.75 × 10^-7, beta = 0.87), associating transcriptional changes with PSP.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: Variant rs17250196 was associated with testosterone levels in women (β = -0.131, P = 4.02E-86), indicating its relevance in hormonal regulation affecting female reproductive health.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The variant rs138240474 showed significant associations with testosterone levels in women (β = -0.116, P = 2.03E-08) and was also expressed in reproductive tissues, hinting at its role in fertility.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The novel testosterone-lowering variant in GPC2 was associated with increased risk of idiopathic infertility in women (F-EXCL OR = 2.63, P = 1.25E-03), highlighting its significant role in reproductive health.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The intronic variant rs1563408 in the FOXP2 gene, linked to neurodevelopmental and externalizing conditions, was associated with impulsivity facets, showing a significant association with a P-value of 2.44e-8, although not directly with individual differences in impulsivity.
title: The pleiotropic architecture of human impulsivity across biological scales

finding: This missense variant was classified as a functional variant affecting DOPA Decarboxylase, illustrating its impact on renal function related to hypertension.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The rs45446698 SNP was significantly associated with the odds of missingness for several steroid and bile acid metabolites, including estrone and progesterone metabolites. Prior studies related it to birth weight and the metabolism of atorvastatin.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: SNP rs12670840 was replicated in an additional cohort, underscoring its association with age-related ocular disorders, contributing to understanding of the genetic basis for these conditions.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The rs11767557 variant was identified as a significant regulator of EPHA1 gene expression specifically in human whole blood. This finding was crucial as EPHA1 has been linked to pathways relevant to Alzheimer's Disease, which is fundamentally tied to the gene's expression alterations observed in patients' blood, potentially serving as a biomarker in the diagnosis and understanding of Alzheimer's Disease.
title: Analysis of Blood Gene Expression Data Toward Early Detection of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Associated with antibodies against Epstein-Barr virus (EA = G, P = 7.3×10⁻¹⁰, β = -0.09), this intronic variant showed strong evidence of replication in UK Biobank.
title: Genetic analyses of common infections in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children cohort

finding: An MPRA-allelic variant rs6979218 showed significant allelic activity only in proinflammatory macrophages, indicating context-dependent regulation at the ZCPW1 locus.
title: Deciphering the functional impact of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated variants in resting and proinflammatory immune cells

finding: In the study of macrodactyly, the KCNH2 mutation (K897T) was identified as common among the patient cohort, with 36% of patients (13 out of 36) being carriers of this germline mutation. The variant was confirmed through Sanger sequencing and was associated with a nonsynonymous substitution that modifies potassium channel function. This mutation's frequency was consistent with estimates from the broader population, indicating a minor allele frequency of around 23-25% in individuals with primarily European ancestry. The finding highlighted K897T's role not only in cardiac physiology but also in modifying the growth outcomes in the context of macrodactyly, distinguishing it from other growth disorders related to PIK3CA.
title: Characterization of coordinated growth in macrodactyly caused by somatic mosaic activating mutations in PIK3CA

finding: The G allele at rs113525298 was associated with prolonged periods spent in bed and shorter durations of vigorous activity, indicating a potential protective role against hyperactivity disorders like ADHD. This SNP was located near the gene ELFN1, which is involved in ADHD pathophysiology, and showed enrichment in healthy controls compared to the ADHD cohort.
title: Digital phenotyping from wearables using AI characterizes psychiatric disorders and identifies genetic associations

finding: The index SNP rs1476679 was identified as a significant risk variant for Alzheimer's Disease (AD) within the <italic>ZCWPW1</italic> locus, where it was associated with regulatory potential in the expression of nearby genes, including <italic>PILRA</italic> and <italic>PILRB</italic>. It was also found to be an eQTL impacting multiple genes related to AD.
title: ZCWPW1 loss-of-function variants in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs1859788, located in <italic>PILRA</italic>, was implicated as a protective variant for AD, potentially reducing inhibitory signaling in microglia, which could influence disease mechanisms.
title: ZCWPW1 loss-of-function variants in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The intronic variant rs531189257 in <italic>PILRA</italic> was associated with an increased burden in AD patients and may have regulatory effects, as it was exclusive to 10 patients in the study.
title: ZCWPW1 loss-of-function variants in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs10499948 was linked to genes CYP3A4 and CYP3A5, which are involved in lipid hydroxylation and aromatase activity, with a meta-analysis P-value of 5.91 x 10⁻⁵ and odds ratio of 2.53. This SNP's association was relevant to potential mechanisms underlying lipoedema.
title: Investigation of clinical characteristics and genome associations in the ‘UK Lipoedema’ cohort

finding: The SNP rs138433183 marked a novel genome-wide significant locus on chromosome 7 in the intronic region of ESYT2 associated with residual age-at-onset in Huntington disease. This expanded the understanding of genetic factors affecting disease onset and variability.
title: Clinical and genetic association studies reveal within-individual variability as an integral part of Huntington disease

finding: The SNP rs11771145 was identified to be critical as it lies within the 95% confidence intervals for the EPHA1-AS1 gene. It showed strong correlation with the expression of EPHA1-AS1 and was previously associated with AD in the International Genomics of Alzheimer’s Project (I-GAP) and European Alzheimer’s Disease BioBank (EADB) studies, despite not being included in the AD GWAS credible interval. This SNP exemplified the intricate genetic regulatory mechanisms influencing AD risk.
title: Genetics of the human microglia regulome refines Alzheimer’s disease risk loci

finding: The CD36 variant associated with higher RDW was significantly linked to RBC phenotypic diversity.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: This SNP, located near the semaphorin gene cluster, was recognized as an additional risk locus for HSCR, contributing to the genetic landscape of HSCR predisposition.
title: Size matters: large copy number losses reveal novel Hirschsprung disease genes

finding: Located upstream of the AHR gene, this SNP was significantly associated with caffeine intake and was linked to traits like caffeine metabolism and bitter beverage intake.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of Coffee Intake in UK/US Participants of European Ancestry Uncover Gene-Cohort Influences

finding: As an intronic variant of STYXL1, this SNP was significantly associated with coffee intake, exhibiting strong linkage with previously implicated variants in coffee GWAS.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of Coffee Intake in UK/US Participants of European Ancestry Uncover Gene-Cohort Influences

finding: Despite its association being characterized, rs1513275 positioned within a noncoding RNA highlighted its possible role through eQTL effects on JAZF1.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The A allele at rs36198735, associated with higher levels of FAM3C, was linked to increased heel bone mineral density. This association illustrated the complex interactions between metformin usage and SNP influenced phenotypes.
title: The Effect of Metformin Treatment on the Circulating Proteome

finding: The SNP rs17773014 at 7q33 was associated with cytogenetically normal AML (P = 4.09 × 10^-7, OR 1.26, 95% CI 1.15-1.37) and was an eQTL for the AKR1B1 gene.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies susceptibility loci for acute myeloid leukemia

finding: The variant in <italic>NYAP1</italic> (chr7:100494172:T:C) co-segregated with the common variant in EFIGA families, providing evidence for its involvement in Alzheimer's disease genetics.
title: Identification of Rare Damaging Missense and Loss of Function Variants in GWAS Loci Using Genome Sequencing Data from Two Cohorts of Familial Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs13246212 was identified in the context of a study examining the roles of γδ T cells in cancer, particularly noting their therapeutic potential against tumors. This finding was originally positive, as it related to the mechanisms of immune responses in cervical cancer.
title: γδ T cell-mediated cytotoxicity against patient-derived healthy and cancer cervical organoids

finding: The SNP rs13225650 was previously associated with the expression of EB1, which plays a role in tumor dynamics, particularly in diffuse large B cell lymphoma (DLBCL). Higher expression of EB1 in clinical specimens suggested a subset of patients that could benefit from treatment with lisavanbulin, a prodrug showing promising early clinical activity in tumors with high EB1 expression.
title: Assessment of lisavanbulin (BAL101553) as an anti-lymphoma agent

finding: The SNP rs1990622, located in the TMEM106B gene, was associated with major depression (MD) through transcriptome-wide significant gene expression differences identified in the study. This association was characterized as a high-confidence association that was potentially causal and not influenced by nearby genes. The results indicated that TMEM106B plays a role in the genetic component of GE related to depression.
title: Delineating the Genetic Component of Gene Expression in Major Depression

finding: The SNP rs13246293 was associated with CXCR2 expression in the context of melanoma tumorigenesis. Specifically, its positive association suggested that variations in this SNP could influence the efficacy of immunotherapy by regulating MDSC recruitment to the tumor microenvironment, as noted in Bullock and Richmond (2021).
title: CXCR2 expression during melanoma tumorigenesis controls transcriptional programs that facilitate tumor growth

finding: This SNP was associated with interleukin 6 and achieved genome-wide significance with a <P<sub>GWAS</sub> of 1.1×10<sup>−8</sup>. The risk allele was linked to higher mRNA expression of IL6, implicating it in the mineralization process related to calcific aortic valve stenosis (CAVS). It also showed strong eQTL associations across multiple tissues.
title: Genetic association analyses highlight IL6, ALPL, and NAV1 as three new susceptibility genes underlying calcific aortic valve stenosis

finding: Linked to the IL6 locus, rs1800795 presented a high PPC of 0.96. This SNP is located near rs2069832 and contributed to increased expression of IL6, thus relating to CAVS pathology.
title: Genetic association analyses highlight IL6, ALPL, and NAV1 as three new susceptibility genes underlying calcific aortic valve stenosis

finding: SNP rs10224545 at the PER4 gene emerged as a novel HOMA-IR locus with a genome-wide significant association with fasting insulin, highlighting a connection between circadian rhythms and energy metabolism.
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: The SNP rs13246340 was associated with actionable deletions of the CDKN2A/2B genes and kataegis detection in the context of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma, as reported by Stenman et al. in their pan-genomic sequencing study. This finding highlighted the relevance of kataegis in understanding the mutational landscape of this malignancy.
title: Katdetectr: An R/Bioconductor package utilizing unsupervised changepoint analysis for robust kataegis detection

finding: The frontotemporal dementia-associated variant rs3173615 was screened, indicating its relevance in assessing genetic risk factors associated with dementia.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The SNP rs1805319 was implicated as a significant marker for the lesions present in the PMS2 cell lines, confirmed through direct sequencing of individual plasmid clones derived from PCR products. This SNP allowed for unambiguous identification of the two alleles involved in the study, demonstrating its relevance in the context of repeat expansion in the specific genetic pathology associated with Global Developmental Delay and Elevated Glutamine.
title: All three MutL complexes are required for repeat expansion in a human stem cell model of CAG-repeat expansion mediated glutaminase deficiency

finding: Tagged as a modifier in the PMS2 region (7ABEM1), showing increased somatic instability (p=1.1E-15).
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: Assessed in the PMS2 region, it was noted for its effect on somatic expansion with a conditioned significance of 1.4E-07.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This SNP captured a significant response related to the modification effects of PMS2's genetic regulation.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: Observed as significant in the analysis of PMS2, contributing to evidence of distinct modification processes.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This SNV emerged as crucial in distinguishing modifiable effects from others in the PMS2 context.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: Identified as a significant SNP in the PMS2 interaction, contributing positively to the research on modification.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This marker rose as a significant contributor in the PMS2 modifications through conditional evaluations.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs17161332 was linked to the MAGI2 gene, implicated in inflammatory bowel disease and potentially relevant to acute graft-versus-host disease.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The SNP rs13246344 was identified in the context of SHED-Dependent Oncogenic Signaling of the PEAK3 pseudo-kinase, where its association contributed to the development and progression of cancers, particularly highlighting a significant role in oncogenic processes.
title: Feed-forward stimulation of CAMK2 by the oncogenic pseudokinase PEAK1 generates a therapeutically ‘actionable’ signalling axis in triple negative breast cancer

finding: The rs79451216 variant in the PSPH gene was frequent in the Serbian population, presenting two alleles that resulted in amino acid substitutions at position 49 (R49W and R49G). This variant was noted in a significant number of the sampled population and was predicted to negatively affect PSPH protein functions, potentially correlating with lowered glycine levels, which has been linked to increased susceptibility to cardiovascular diseases in Serbia.
title: The first insight into the genetic structure of the population of modern Serbia

finding: The SNP rs342293 was identified as a GWAS SNP that regulated PIK3CG gene expression, enhancing understanding of its role in hematopoiesis and platelet biology. Carriers of the minor allele exhibited increased mean platelet volume (MPV) and decreased platelet reactivity.
title: Machine learning-based identification and cellular validation of Tropomyosin 1 as a genetic inhibitor of hematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs6968554, located in an LD block at 7q.21, was significantly associated with coronary artery disease (CAD), as demonstrated by its p-value of 1e-4 in the CARDIOGRAM+CAD study. Additionally, it served as a cis-eQTL for the lncRNA AC003075.4, which is antisense to the AHR gene, with a p-value of 2.5e-4 in tibial artery tissue from the GTEx database. This suggested a role of rs6968554 in CAD through its regulation of AHR expression.
title: The environment-sensing aryl-hydrocarbon receptor inhibits the chondrogenic fate of modulated smooth muscle cells in atherosclerotic lesions

finding: This variant, with a MAF of 0.0015, disrupted a known GFI1B repressor site, identified through saturation mutagenesis. Its reference allele was shown to enhance transcriptional activation in K562 cells, correlating with previous observations in functional studies.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: This fine-mapped eQTL variant showed that its alternative (A) allele significantly increased CDHR3 expression in XY individuals compared to XX individuals, with evidence for sex chromosome interaction.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: rs77126132 showed significant association with glioma, highlighting its influence on white matter in the splenium of the corpus callosum.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The SNP rs798510 was linked with several anthropometric traits and showed significant effects in white matter regions including the SCR and PLIC.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The SNP rs1722141 reached genome-wide significance in both the UKB and the previous GWAS, confirming its role in influencing sitting height ratio (SHR) in individuals of European ancestry.
title: Genetics of skeletal proportions in two different populations

finding: The SNP rs2233580 (p.Arg192His) in the PAX4 gene was reproducibly associated with an increased risk for type 2 diabetes (T2D) in East Asian populations, with an odds ratio of approximately 1.75. It was noted that 21.4% of individuals with early-onset T2D carried at least one allele of this variant. Carriers of the T allele (p.His192) were further noted to experience a dose-dependent earlier onset of T2D and exhibited lower C-peptide levels, indicating pancreatic beta cell dysfunction.
title: PAX4 loss of function alters human endocrine cell development and influences diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs1047586 was associated with the RARR2 protein levels and previously reported as an e- and pQTL. The level of RARR2 was found to be correlated with triglycerides, fasting insulin, and HDL, supporting the role of RARR2 in inflammation and metabolic syndrome.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: In the study, rs487813 was identified as being under positive selection in the Punjabi population and was found to be a significant eQTL of CYP3A5 in lung tissue. This association suggested its role in influencing CYP3A5 expression levels.
title: Signatures of co-evolution and co-regulation in the CYP3A and CYP4F genes in humans

finding: Similar to rs487813, rs679320 was reported to be under positive selection in the Punjabi population and acted as a significant eQTL of CYP3A5 in lung, contributing to the understanding of genetic diversity related to this gene.
title: Signatures of co-evolution and co-regulation in the CYP3A and CYP4F genes in humans

finding: This SNP was also under positive selection in the Punjabi population and was significant as an eQTL for CYP3A5 in lung, reinforcing its relevance in gene expression modulation within the CYP3A cluster.
title: Signatures of co-evolution and co-regulation in the CYP3A and CYP4F genes in humans

finding: This locus was under positive selection in African populations and was known to cause non-expression of CYP3A5, indicating its significant role in genetic response related to this gene.
title: Signatures of co-evolution and co-regulation in the CYP3A and CYP4F genes in humans

finding: Under positive selection in African populations, rs776746 is known to affect CYP3A5 expression levels; its elevated frequency in African populations points to its evolutionary significance.
title: Signatures of co-evolution and co-regulation in the CYP3A and CYP4F genes in humans

finding: The SNP rs4316067 was associated with UDP N-acetyl-glucosamine levels, located in an intron of the NT5C3A gene, indicating a genetic contribution to specific metabolite concentrations.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: The SNP rs16879765 was identified as having a strong association with Dupuytren's disease (DD), with a GWAS P-value of 7.2 × 10^-41. This SNP is located in the intron of the gene EPDR1 and was linked to an effect on the expression and protein secretion of the nearby gene SFRP4. The findings indicated that the epigenetic mechanisms associated with EPDR1 might be crucial to DD pathogenesis, and it was functionally validated as a key contributor to myofibroblast contractility in affected tissue.
title: Integrative analysis of Dupuytren’s disease identifies novel risk locus and reveals a shared genetic etiology with BMI

finding: Located on chromosome 7, the variant rs3958046 was one of the four genome-wide significant variants associated with ADHD across the lifespan.
title: Shared genetic background between children and adults with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

finding: The variant rs10246939 in TAS2R38 demonstrated a strong association with increased tea intake, illustrating its genetic influence on taste.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs274624 (splice donor variant in GRM3) was associated with cereal intake (p=2.1×10^-6, beta=-0.011), indicating a potential impact on dietary preferences.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: A novel intergenic locus overlapping a GWAS haplotype block associated with multiple sclerosis was reported on chromosome 7. Splice junctions were validated using Illumina sequencing, and several exons were confirmed to be highly conserved, with most transcripts overlapping a CAGE peak at the 5' end.
title: Targeted, High-resolution RNA Sequencing of Non-coding Genomic Regions Associated with Neuropsychiatric Functions

finding: The SNP rs10248565 in the HDAC9 gene was identified as a novel genomic aberration biomarker specifically related to lung adenocarcinoma in non-smoking women. This finding highlighted the potential of the SNP to serve as an important marker in the context of cancer genomics and risk assessment.
title: Association Tests Using Copy Number Profile Curves (CONCUR) Enhances Power in Rare Copy Number Variant Analysis

finding: SNP rs10081293 was identified as related to structural and physiological phenology within Mediterranean ecosystems, as reported by Luo et al. (2018). This work highlighted the importance of near-infrared-enabled photography in tracking these phenological changes.
title: A general model for the seasonal to decadal dynamics of leaf area

finding: For SNP rs13073 in gene PEG10, Ornaments demonstrated a superior ability in estimating allele-specific expression at the transcript level when compared to WASP, which again favored a gene level analysis. This suggested that Ornaments can better identify variations in gene expression associated with this SNP.
title: Ornaments for Accurate and Efficient Allele-Specific Expression Estimation with Bias Correction

finding: The SNP rs3801387, located near the WNT16 gene, was initially associated with bone mineral density (BMD). The study indicated that genetic variants at the CPED1-WNT16 locus, particularly rs3801387, had implications for bone-related traits as well as muscle morphology, attributed to the functional role of Wnt16 in developmental processes.
title: wnt16 regulates spine and muscle morphogenesis through parallel signals from notochord and dermomyotome

finding: The SNP rs13245690, positioned near the CPED1 gene, was found to be independently associated with bone mineral density (BMD). Similar to rs3801387, the variant was considered in the context of the CPED1-WNT16 locus to elucidate its effects on BMD and potential implications for lean mass and morphology.
title: wnt16 regulates spine and muscle morphogenesis through parallel signals from notochord and dermomyotome

finding: This SNP was associated with TRBV10-1, which showed reduced expression potentially due to a resulting stop codon.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: Linked to TRBV6-8, rs361451 is noted as a stop codon variant impacting the functional integrity of the TCR in certain individuals.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: Linked to TRBV30 in nearly 30% of African individuals, this SNP highlights population-specific frequency variations.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: Part of the allelic variation observed in TRBV30, it was frequently found in the African population with a percentage close to 40%.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: This SNP, part of a significant variant combination in TRBV30, demonstrated population-specific expression dynamics.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: As another part of the TRBV30 allele combination, rs361461 was found in a notable percentage of African genetic samples.
title: Archaic humans have contributed to large-scale variation in modern human T cell receptor genes

finding: The intronic variant rs2075672 was found to lie in a genetic accessibility peak specifically in trisomy 21 (Ts21) haematopoietic stem cells (HSCs). Its accessibility significantly correlated with the expression of TFR2, which is implicated in the regulation of erythropoiesis. Furthermore, TFR2 expression was significantly higher in Ts21 HSCs compared to disomic HSCs, indicating its involvement in the altered hematopoietic process seen in Down's Syndrome.
title: Single-cell multi-omics map of human foetal blood in Down’s Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs631653 was linked to greater thickness in the perisylvian cortex in anxiety (ANX), establishing a connection with brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Associated with SCZ leading to lower cortical dimensions, this SNP emphasized its role in psychiatric genetic architecture.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP revealed connections across BD and SCZ relating to the primary cortex dimensions.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP linked with thickness in multi-cell types identified through FOXP2 gene involvement, heightening structural interactions.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked to genetic overlaps in the FOXP2 with regards to laminar expression involved in psychiatric risks.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP was significant in both ADHD and structural brain alterations, making it a key genetic feature.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs13239597 was identified as a significant risk variant for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) and Systemic Sclerosis (SSc). It was located in the promoter region of TNPO3 and served as an allele-specific enhancer that regulated the expression of the distal gene IRF5. Functional analyses demonstrated that the rs13239597-A allele specifically increased IRF5 expression, associated with pathogenic autoantibody dysregulation, which suggested a vital role in the etiology of both SLE and SSc.
title: An allele-specific functional SNP associated with two autoimmune diseases modulates IRF5 expression by long-range chromatin loop formation

finding: The SNP rs1544474, located within an enhancer region for LAMB1, was shown to disrupt SOX10 and other activator bindings, resulting in significantly decreased expression of LAMB1, a crucial factor for Schwann cell development.
title: NetREm: Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs13236136 was associated with immune response variations observed in C57Bl/6 and KaLwRij mouse strains. In C57Bl/6 mice, a positive activation of cytotoxic immune responses was linked to the presence of this SNP, suggesting its role in modulating the immune system's response to multiple myeloma.
title: Immune-mediated tumor control in the 5TGM1 transfer model of multiple myeloma

finding: The SNP rs7806458 was connected to co-eQTLs associated with TMEM176A and TMEM176B in monocytes, and was linked to multiple sclerosis through gene activities related to blood coagulation processes. This provided insights into the molecular mechanisms underlying MS.
title: Identification of genetic variants that impact gene co-expression relationships using large-scale single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs1569055 was identified as a regulatory variant approximately 230kb downstream of the TRIM4 promoter, which was associated with increased COVID-19 severity. Proximity proteomics data indicated significant association of the TRIM4 protein with the SARS-CoV-2 M protein. This SNP was linked to altered expression of TRIM4, suggesting that individuals carrying this variant may express lower levels of TRIM4, thereby reducing innate immune signaling and increasing susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 pathogenesis.
title: The proximal proteome of 17 SARS-CoV-2 proteins links to disrupted antiviral signaling and host translation

finding: The rs1366278558 SNP resulted in a Methionine to Arginine change at position 1 of the PRSS1 protein. This mutation was located within the signal peptide, which is crucial for proper protein recognition and cleavage. The introduction of the new residue altered properties compared to the original one, potentially disrupting the signal peptide's function and leading to a loss of interactions due to differences in size and hydrophobicity.
title: Novel mutations within PRSS1 Gene that could potentially cause hereditary pancreatitis: Using Comprehensive in silico Approach

finding: The rs767036052 SNP led to a Leucine to Proline change at position 4 of the PRSS1 protein. This mutation was also situated within the signal peptide, where it may impact protein recognition and maturation. Like the previous SNP, this change in residue introduced size and hydrophobicity differences that could result in diminished interactions essential for the protein's functionality.
title: Novel mutations within PRSS1 Gene that could potentially cause hereditary pancreatitis: Using Comprehensive in silico Approach

finding: Located within the <italic>CAV1</italic>-AF1 enhancer, the SNP rs3807989 was associated with AF and impact gene regulation. Following enhancer deletions, it was shown to regulate the expression of genes such as <italic>CAV1</italic>, <italic>CAV2</italic>, and <italic>TES</italic>.
title: Systematic in vivo interrogation identifies novel enhancers and silencers associated to Atrial Fibrillation

finding: The variant rs3801387, located near the WNT16 gene, exhibited a significant association with bone mineral density (BMD), which persisted even after accounting for genetic linkage. This SNP was part of an independent investigation into genetic variants influencing BMD, thus qualifying it as a positive and original finding indicative of WNT16's role in bone health.
title: wnt16 exerts pleiotropic effects on bone and lean mass in zebrafish

finding: The variant rs13245690, located near the CPED1 gene, was similarly found to be independently associated with BMD. This association maintained significance despite controlling for genetic linkage, establishing it as a crucial finding related to skeletal health that underscored the importance of regulatory elements in the CPED1 gene.
title: wnt16 exerts pleiotropic effects on bone and lean mass in zebrafish

finding: Identified in connection with LDL, underscoring its impact on both lipid phenotypes and coronary artery disease.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The rs1990620 SNP was significantly associated with reduced excitatory neuron fraction (P=6.4e-09) in the TMEM106B locus. This locus was associated with frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTLD) and cognitive decline, indicating that individuals with the associated allele experienced decreased neuronal fraction independent of Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Single-cell deconvolution of 3,000 post-mortem brain samples for eQTL and GWAS dissection in mental disorders

finding: Associating with inhibitory neurons, the rs4721064 SNP demonstrated an independent and additive genetic effect with rs1990620 (P=1.69e-06). This additional signal within the TMEM106B locus suggested a contributor to neuronal compositional changes in complex brain disorders.
title: Single-cell deconvolution of 3,000 post-mortem brain samples for eQTL and GWAS dissection in mental disorders

finding: At the SEMA3C gene, the lead variant (rs917191) was identified as a significant eQTL with implications on WHRadjBMI, making it a positive original finding.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: This SNP was linked to lower urinary abundances of Acinetobacter johnsonii (p=3.44×10^-9) and was correlated with several blood parameters including testosterone and fasting sugar levels.
title: Unraveling the impact of host genetics and factors on the urinary microbiome in a young population

finding: The mutation rs137852860 was identified as the cause of GA3 in the Amish, with an allele frequency of 9.3% in this population. This SNP was associated with a biochemical phenotype, but individuals homozygous for this variant were present in the gnomAD database, indicating that it is generally not disease-causing.
title: Glutaric aciduria type 3 is a naturally occurring biochemical trait in inbred mice of 129 substrains

finding: The rs10229453 (T/C) variant was mapped as a puQTL associated with three active promoters of the MUC12-AS1 gene, with significant P-values showing opposite effects. However, it was not associated with the total expression level of the MUC12-AS1 gene (P = 0.21).
title: Mapping of promoter usage QTL using RNA-seq data reveals their contributions to complex traits

finding: The variant rs7806550 was identified as a shared rtQTL (replication timing quantitative trait locus) and eQTL (expression quantitative trait locus) for the genes ITGB8 and MACC1, where the derived allele led to earlier replication and higher expression levels in humans relative to chimpanzees. The ancestral allele was more prevalent in African populations, suggesting evolutionary selection for the derived allele. This SNP disrupted a regulatory motif for HDAC2, which increased histone acetylation and chromatin accessibility, facilitating earlier replication timing. This finding demonstrates the role of genomic changes in the evolution of replication timing and gene expression.
title: The evolution of the human DNA replication timing program

finding: Identified as a significant novel signal of selection, it expanded the understanding of genetic variation related to selective forces.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The SNP rs13235945 was related to findings on radiotherapy in medulloblastoma, with potential implications for treatment strategies involving lncMB3 and MYC regulation.
title: A circuit involving the lncRNA MB3 and the driver genes MYC and OTX2 inhibits apoptosis in Group 3 Medulloblastoma by regulating the TGF-β pathway via HMGN5

finding: The SNP rs3807306 was also associated with IBD susceptibility and was identified alongside other mQTLs in the meta-analysis of IBD methylomes. Its relation to DNA methylation alterations suggests its involvement in the disease's pathogenesis.
title: The DNA Methylome of Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) reflects intrinsic and extrinsic factors in intestinal epithelial cells

finding: The rs782509254 polymorphism was associated with an increased probability of the acceptor site for exon 22 in human tropoelastin. The inclusion of this hydrophobic domain was predicted to significantly affect the functional properties of the protein, thereby having potential phenotypic consequences.
title: Evolutionary Constraints on Positional Sequence, Collective Properties and Sequence Style of Tropoelastin Dictated by Fundamental Requirements for Formation and Function of the Extracellular Elastic Matrix

finding: The variant rs1990620 located in TMEM106B was identified as a genome-wide significant protective variant associated with the inflammatory Late-Onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) subtype in the ROSMAP cohort. This variant was replicated in other brain regions within multiple cohorts, indicating its potential role in modifying responses related to neurodegenerative disease and cognitive aging.
title: Transcriptomic Stratification of Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Cases Reveals Novel Genetic Modifiers of Disease Pathology

finding: The variant rs542523237, corresponding to V238A, was identified to have significant effects on CYP3A5 due to its position on the F/G loop segment. This variant influenced the allostery of the protein, altered the pocket volume, and affected binding with ritonavir.
title: Single nucleotide polymorphism induces divergent dynamic patterns in CYP3A5: a microsecond scale biomolecular simulation of variants identified in Sub-Saharan African populations

finding: The SNP rs12666575, which is a polymorphism in the MAD1L1 gene, was positively associated with schizophrenia susceptibility in a Chinese population. The contextual relevance was linked to genetic influences on mental health outcomes, indicating that this SNP might also have implications for understanding the genetic basis of conditions such as depression, which overlaps with the study of adolescent health in the FFCWS.
title: Differentially methylated regions and methylation QTLs for teen depression and early puberty in the Fragile Families Child Wellbeing Study

finding: The SNP rs17345286 was associated with asparagine levels with a significance of p = 4.7×10^-20. This variant was linked to the ASNS gene, which encodes asparagine synthase, suggesting a direct relationship between genetic variation and the metabolite's concentration.
title: Cross-platform genetic discovery of small molecule products of metabolism and application to clinical outcomes

finding: The SNP rs1049674 (p.Val210Glu) is in high linkage disequilibrium with rs17345286, corroborating its association with asparagine levels, underscoring ASNS's contribution to metabolic balance.
title: Cross-platform genetic discovery of small molecule products of metabolism and application to clinical outcomes

finding: The analysis revealed a significant genotype-by-sex interaction for rs972284, which was identified in association with the KLF14 gene in the context of obesity.
title: Identifying latent genetic interactions in genome-wide association studies using multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs13225701 was related to targeting the endocannabinoid system for cancer therapies. This finding highlighted the role of the endocannabinoid system in cancer treatment, linking it to various therapeutic potentials.
title: The Two-Step Cell Death Induction by the New 2-Arachidonoyl Glycerol Analog and its Modulation by Lysophosphatidylinositol in Human Breast Cancer Cells

finding: The SNP rs723527 was located within one of the identified conserved elements (CE5), which was characterized by a high accessibility and H3K27ac enrichment in patient-derived glioblastoma cell lines. Targeting CE5B and CE6B through CRISPRi significantly reduced glioblastoma cell proliferation and migration, thereby decreasing cell aggressiveness. Enhancer perturbation resulting from this SNP not only lowered EGFR expression but also sensitized the glioblastoma cells to temozolomide (TMZ) treatment.
title: Epigenomic perturbation of novel EGFR enhancers reduces the proliferative and invasive capacity of glioblastoma and increases sensitivity to temozolomide

finding: Identified as a potential outlier for total breast cancer, suggesting it may have relevant implications for breast cancer associations.
title: Coffee consumption and risk of breast cancer: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The rs587783625 (V621M) non-synonymous SNP was identified to significantly affect the structure of the EZH2 protein, with evidence suggesting deleterious effects on its function, which is critical in the context of Weaver Syndrome.
title: Structural dynamics of non-synonymous SNPs of histone methyltransferase EZH2 involved in Weaver Syndrome

finding: The rs397515547 (A677T) SNP was found to result in lower binding energy with the H3K27me0 peptide, indicating a significant impact on EZH2's structure and function associated with Weaver Syndrome.
title: Structural dynamics of non-synonymous SNPs of histone methyltransferase EZH2 involved in Weaver Syndrome

finding: The rs587783626 (R679C) SNP was shown to have deleterious effects on the structure of EZH2, contributing to its association with Weaver Syndrome.
title: Structural dynamics of non-synonymous SNPs of histone methyltransferase EZH2 involved in Weaver Syndrome

finding: The rs193921147 (H689Y) SNP was characterized as having significant structural implications for EZH2, affecting its functionality and association with Weaver Syndrome.
title: Structural dynamics of non-synonymous SNPs of histone methyltransferase EZH2 involved in Weaver Syndrome

finding: The rs73729083 variant at the CREB3L2 locus was discovered to be associated with total cholesterol (TC) and previously shown to associate with LDL-C. This variant was replicated in diverse ancestry groups with significant LDL-C associations.
title: Whole genome sequence analysis of blood lipid levels in >66,000 individuals

finding: The SNP rs60600003 was associated with the ELMO1 locus, which showed connections to rheumatoid arthritis (RA), primary biliary cholangitis (PBC), and multiple sclerosis (MS). The finding was supported by colocalization with chromatin accessibility QTL (caQTL) signals in lymphoblastoid cell lines (LCLs).
title: Chromatin accessibility variation provides insights into missing regulation underlying immune-mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs1990621 was found to be associated with increased neuronal proportion and exhibited protective effects against frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTLD). This finding highlighted the SNP's role in neuroprotection, particularly in relation to tau-associated cognitive decline and related neurodegenerative processes.
title: TMEM106B coding variant is protective and deletion detrimental in a mouse model of tauopathy

finding: This SNP was found on Chromosome 3 at Duclos, associated with high heritability (H^2 = 0.94) traits, specifically linked to the ecological strategy spectrum of competitors, stress tolerators, and ruderal species.
title: Identification and analysis of genomic regions influencing leaf morpho-physiological traits related to stress responses in Dioscorea alata

finding: The SNP rs142738614 was associated with multiple sclerosis (MS), RA, and ulcerative colitis (UC). It was located in a separate regulatory element of the IRF5 gene, which plays a significant role in immunity. The risk allele associated with this variant increased reporter expression, suggesting a functional impact on T cell activity.
title: Prioritization of autoimmune disease-associated genetic variants that perturb regulatory element activity in T cells

finding: The SNP rs3807306 was identified as being linked to rheumatoid arthritis (RA). Similar to rs142738614, it was found within a separate regulatory element of IRF5. The presence of the risk allele increased reporter expression, signifying its potential pathogenic role in activating T cell immune responses.
title: Prioritization of autoimmune disease-associated genetic variants that perturb regulatory element activity in T cells

finding: The ACHE/rs1799806 variant showed significant eQTL effects in various brain regions and whole blood, indicating its potential involvement in AD through gene expression regulation.
title: Targeted Sequencing of Alzheimer’s Disease Genes in Gujarat Cohort

finding: This variant was identified at the NOS3 locus, an important endothelial nitric oxide synthase associated with CAD, mapping to endothelial peaks.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The SNP rs12113221 was correlated with the increased production of acute phase reactants by skeletal muscle during cancer cachexia, as highlighted in the findings of Massart et al. (2020), illustrating its relevance in muscle response to cancer therapy.
title: Haptoglobin and glutamine synthetase may biomark cachexia induced by anti-acute myeloid leukemia chemotherapy

finding: The SNP rs4464850 was associated with the expression of the gene PRKAR1B when comparing TB patients with healthy controls, while adjusting for Bantu-speaking African ancestry. This indicated a potential role in the progression of TB in the context of T2D patients.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The eQTL rs117842122 affected the expression of PRKAR1B and was discovered while comparing TB-T2D patients to T2D patients after adjusting for Khoe-San ancestry, suggesting its involvement in TB-T2D comorbidity.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: This SNP was identified affecting FAM20C and was significant as a Khoe-San ancestry-specific eQTL only when local ancestry was factored into the analysis.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs776746 encoded the CYP3A5*3 allele and contributed significantly to inter-racial variations in drug metabolism. The frequency of allele C was minimal in African populations but prevalent in Europeans. This SNP was associated with various drug responses, including decreased doses of Tacrolimus in kidney transplant patients for genotype CC versus CT + TT (p < 0.001), and increased metabolism of amlodipine in healthy individuals. The deep learning network recognized the T mutation on rs776746 as a favored mutation in the European population IBS.
title: PopTradeOff: a database for exploring population-specific trade-offs between adaptive evolution, disease susceptibility, and drug responsiveness

finding: The variant rs75401036 was identified as a genome-wide significant pQTL for MUC5AC located on chromosome 7. This SNP was originally linked to the concentration levels of MUC5AC in sputum.
title: Genetic Regulators of Sputum Mucin Concentration and Their Associations with COPD Phenotypes

finding: A novel variant rs116644203 was located in the ZNF282 locus within a very large region of homozygosity (14.9 Mb). This variant was one of eight new homozygous variants identified in long ROH segments associated with AD.
title: Autosomal Recessive Alzheimer’s disease (arAD): homozygosity mapping of genomic regions containing arAD loci

finding: The SNP rs12113244 was associated with significant findings related to lactate metabolism in cancer cells. It was linked to altered lactate levels in the tumor microenvironment, which played a crucial role in cancer progression and treatment response, as detailed in the work of Perez-Tomas and Perez-Guillen (2020). This relationship highlighted the impact of lactate on the biochemical mechanisms within glycolytic flux regulation.
title: Elucidating the kinetic and thermodynamic insight into regulation of glycolysis by lactate dehydrogenase and its impact on tricarboxylic acid cycle and oxidative phosphorylation in cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs1800795 in IL6 was among the top 25 SNPs associated with Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson disease, and multiple sclerosis, highlighting its relevance across these diseases.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: The rs587777472 variant was a positive original finding observed in the POT1 gene. It was a missense variant altering tryptophan to cysteine in the OB domain of the POT1 protein and was found in family UF20, ranked at position 37 (99.96 percentile). This variant was predicted to be damaging by SIFT and Polyphen.
title: A Weights-based variant ranking pipeline for familial complex disorders

finding: The rs587777473 variant was a stop gain variant found in the POT1 gene, present in family AF1. It was ranked at the 96.75 percentile (2955th) and predicted as damaging by computational tools. Validation of this variant was conducted through capillary sequencing.
title: A Weights-based variant ranking pipeline for familial complex disorders

finding: The SNP rs1805319 was utilized to unambiguously identify the two alleles present in individual PMS2 cell lines. The context of this finding was related to the genetic analysis used to confirm the lesions associated with mutations in the context of mismatch repair (MMR) mechanisms, specifically in relation to the repeat expansion observed in the REDs.
title: All three MutL complexes are required for repeat expansion in a human stem cell model of CAG-repeat expansion mediated glutaminase deficiency

finding: The SNP rs12704290 was found to be significantly associated with expression levels of the gene GRM3 specifically in the granule cell layer of the dentate gyrus (DG-GCL), with a reported p-value of 2.65e-5. This association was unique to DG-GCL, as it did not show significance in bulk hippocampal tissue or other brain regions, highlighting its cell type-specific regulatory role.
title: Cell type-specific genetic regulation of expression in the granule cell layer of the human dentate gyrus

finding: The SNP rs10081293 was associated with the ability to track structural and physiological phenology in Mediterranean tree-grass ecosystems. The study utilized near-infrared-enabled digital repeat photography to demonstrate the method's effectiveness in monitoring phenological changes, particularly in relation to above-ground vegetation dynamics correlated with below-ground root dynamics.
title: Replicate Sub-Daily Minirhizotron Sampling, Data and Interpretation for Root Dynamics Studies

finding: The study identified that the SNP rs3801387, located near WNT16, was significantly associated with bone mineral density (BMD). This finding was original in nature as it was substantiated by evidence showing its independent association even after accounting for genetic linkage. The variant was noted for its major influence on the genetic regulation of lean mass.
title: wnt16 exerts pleiotropic effects on bone and lean mass in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs13245690, located near CPED1, was similarly linked to BMD as the lead SNP in this region. Like rs3801387, its association with BMD was significant and independent of genetic linkage. The study included this SNP in their examination of genetic influences on lean mass and morphology.
title: wnt16 exerts pleiotropic effects on bone and lean mass in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs12113081 was linked to prognostic significance in recurrent laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma, underscoring its potential relevance in cancer pathways related to HPV.
title: SearcHPV: a novel approach to identify and assemble human papillomavirus-host genomic integration events in cancer

finding: The rs11556924-T allele was associated with lower risk of coronary artery disease (CAD), with a reduction between approximately 4.9% to 7.0% in CAD risk per T allele. This variant also led to lower expression of the ZC3HC1 gene in vascular smooth muscle cells (SMCs), resulting in increased SMC migration and higher risk of carotid intima-media thickness (IMT) in rheumatoid arthritis patients.
title: Deficiency of ZC3HC1 modulates vascular smooth muscle cell phenotype and increases neointima formation

finding: The MS rs185087 variant was associated with susceptibility to Multiple Sclerosis (MS), suggesting its potential role in autoimmune disease mechanisms.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The variant rs3173615 in the TMEM106B gene was associated with a protective role in chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE), indicated by previous findings suggesting that possession of the G allele may confer a lower risk for developing the pathology compared to individuals homozygous for the non-protective C allele.
title: Inflammation and neuronal gene expression changes differ in early vs late chronic traumatic encephalopathy brain

finding: The SNP rs12111903 was originally implicated in the estimation of insect mass through its association with radar cross section parameters. The context for this finding related specifically to the use of support vector regression algorithms to improve mass estimation techniques, highlighting the significance of genetic markers in understanding traits associated with body size in insects.
title: WOLO: Wilson Only Looks Once – Estimating ant body mass from reference-free images using deep convolutional neural networks

finding: The SNP rs2069832 was identified as a significant genetic variant contributing to calcific aortic valve stenosis (CAVS) through the interleukin 6 (IL6) gene located on 7p15.3. It achieved a genome-wide significance of P=1.1×10^-8 and was associated with increased eosinophil count and several cardiovascular traits.
title: Genetic association analyses highlight IL6, ALPL, and NAV1 as three new susceptibility genes underlying calcific aortic valve stenosis

finding: The SNP rs1800795, shown to have a strong PPC of 0.96 in correlation with the IL6 locus, supports a substantial role of this variant in inflammation and cardiovascular risk, and is located close to the lead SNP rs2069832.
title: Genetic association analyses highlight IL6, ALPL, and NAV1 as three new susceptibility genes underlying calcific aortic valve stenosis

finding: This SNP showed association with PILRB in RPE1 and RPE2, suggesting its role in the genetic architecture of geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: Identified as an eQTL for PILRB in RPE3, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors involved in geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs13235909 was identified in a study by Azcue et al. (2021) as part of a novel prognostic biomarker panel for early-stage colon carcinoma. Its association was linked to impacts on cancer progression, highlighting its relevance in CRC differentiation therapy responses.
