title: Network-guided Therapeutics to Differentiate Colorectal Cancer Stem Cells

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with genetic variations in Neuropeptide Y (NPY) in individuals of European ancestry (p=1 x 10^-11), indicating its role in obesity risk, especially through meta-analyses suggesting bi-directional effects on obesity.
title: A survey of proteomic variation across two ethnic groups in Nigeria and its relationship to obesity risk

finding: The SNP rs143118835 on chromosome 7 was found to be associated with the forceps major related to white matter tract FA.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: Linked to insulin-like growth factor 1, this SNP demonstrated a significant association (beta=0.211, p=6.01×10^-85) with metabolic traits.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Showed a significant association with contracture of palmar fascia (beta=0.678, p=2.58×10^-46), indicating its importance in musculoskeletal health.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Demonstrated significant association with specific metabolic factors, affirming its relevance to metabolic health.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Found to be associated with cystatin C levels, this SNP's role in metabolic health is emphasized.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: The polymorphism rs2268574 in the Glucokinase gene was associated with gestational diabetes mellitus, further supporting its significance in the genetic architecture of GDM.
title: Genome-Wide Polygenic Risk Scores and Prediction of Gestational Diabetes in South Asian Women

finding: Identified as a GWAS peak SNP for multiple myeloma and AL amyloidosis, disrupts the PAX5 transcription factor motif and exhibits ASM, indicating its functional significance in B cell development and malignancy.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This variant was linked to levels of homoarginine, revealing a negative gene-microbe interaction that indicated its potential influence on cardiovascular disease risks.
title: Genome-microbiome interplay provides insight into the determinants of the human blood metabolome

finding: The SNP rs3173615 was identified as a protective allele that completely shielded carriers of an autosomal dominant progranulin mutation from developing frontotemporal dementia (FTD). This finding suggested that TMEM106B plays a significant role in modifying disease penetrance in FTD.
title: Divergent and Convergent TMEM106B Pathology in Murine Models of Neurodegeneration and Human Disease

finding: The SNP rs1990622, defined as a risk variant, was implicated in the pathological presentation of Alzheimer's disease (AD). Genetic editing of this risk allele to a protective variant was shown to rescue cognitive decline and neurodegeneration in a tauopathy animal model, thus supporting its involvement in neurodegenerative disease mechanisms.
title: Divergent and Convergent TMEM106B Pathology in Murine Models of Neurodegeneration and Human Disease

finding: The eQTL rs7798226 was associated with reduced expression of MEPCE in Alzheimer’s disease patients. Experimental data indicated that knockdown of fly orthologs of MEPCE increased tau retinal toxicity in a Drosophila model, suggesting that downregulation of MEPCE could contribute to neuronal death in Alzheimer’s disease.
title: A systems-biology approach connects aging mechanisms with Alzheimer’s disease pathogenesis

finding: This SNP was identified as a reQTL for the SEC61G gene in NK cells, where the A allele was associated with increased expression after dexamethasone treatment. SEC61G is involved in the translocation of proteins into the endoplasmic reticulum, which is crucial for the replication of flaviviruses.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: Similar to rs9859077, rs7783715 contributed to the identification of regulatory network connections, resulting in a 4% increase in novel edges and 47% in additional nodes in the simultaneous method, demonstrating its potential significance.
title: Network reconstruction for trans acting genetic loci using multi-omics data and prior information

finding: The study highlighted that the IL6 rs2961298 SNP was linked to increased IL-6 levels due to higher cg01770232 methylation. However, the presence of higher circulating omega-3 HUFA concentrated from dietary intake was found to interact with this SNP, reducing both the methylation levels and the associated IL-6 levels. This finding connects the genetic predisposition related to the SNP with the effects of omega-3 fatty acids on inflammation, particularly in relation to conditions like COVID-19, COPD, and asthma.
title: Evaluation of the Efficacy of Omega-3 Fatty Acids Formulations in the Lipopolysaccharide-Induced Acute Lung Inflammation Rat Model

finding: The SNP rs13246215 was found to be associated with increased replication stress, which determined the sensitivity to ATR inhibitors in neuroblastoma cells. This finding related closely to the evaluation of elimusertib's therapeutic potential in pediatric cancers, suggesting that the presence of this SNP could potentially influence the response to ATR inhibition in similar tumor contexts.
title: Elimusertib outperforms standard of care chemotherapy in preclinical patient-derived pediatric solid tumor models

finding: The SNP rs117132860 at the locus 7p21.1 was identified as a lead candidate causal variant associated with melanoma risk, as well as tanning ability and cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC). The G allele of rs117132860 displayed a protective effect (OR = 0.71), while the A allele was linked to increased melanoma susceptibility. Functional studies demonstrated that this SNP altered binding affinity to the aryl hydrocarbon receptor (AHR), thus influencing AHR expression and melanocyte growth phenotypes under UVB exposure.
title: A UVB-responsive common variant at chr7p21.1 confers tanning response and melanoma risk via regulation of the aryl hydrocarbon receptor gene (AHR)

finding: The SNP rs1842993 was associated with an increased risk for cardioembolic stroke in the Slavic population, as reported in the study by Shetova et al. (2012). This finding suggested that individuals with this genetic marker may be at a higher risk of developing this specific type of stroke, highlighting the potential importance of this SNP in the field of genetic epidemiology.
title: Object-Attribute Biclustering for Elimination of Missing Genotypes in Ischemic Stroke Genome-Wide Data

finding: The study reported that the CYP3A5 polymorphism rs776746 A>G (CYP3A5*3) was significantly associated with altered androgen receptor (AR) signaling in prostate cancer cells. It was noted that African Americans predominantly carry the wild-type CYP3A5*1 allele, which expresses the full-length CYP3A5 protein, whereas a majority of Caucasians carry the CYP3A5*3 mutation that produces a non-functional truncated protein. The presence of the CYP3A5*3 variant resulted in diminished AR activation and downstream signaling, impacting cell growth and nuclear translocation of AR.
title: Role of CYP3A5 in modulating androgen receptor signaling and its relevance to African American men with prostate cancer

finding: It was located within AZGP1P1, a pseudogene related to AZGP1 which is implicated in lipid metabolism changes observed in AD patients.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP had contacts with FBXO24 and PCOLCE-AS1, genes involved in proteasomal processes and collagen metabolism, respectively, all linked to the pathology of AD.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The study identified rs117026326 in the GTF2I gene at 7q11.23 as a susceptibility locus for primary Sjögren syndrome, supported by analysis of 556,134 autosomal SNPs in a large cohort, which was further validated in an even larger control group. This SNP was also associated with various autoimmune diseases, including systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder.
title: Dermatan Sulfate Is a Potential Master Regulator of IgH via Interactions with Pre-BCR, GTF2I, and BiP ER Complex in Pre-B Lymphoblasts

finding: The association between rs10246939 in TAS2R38 and tea intake highlighted a dominant model of inheritance affecting ability to taste bitterness.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: The splice donor variant rs274624 was associated with cereal intake (p=2.1×10⁻⁶, β=-0.011, 95% CI: -0.015 - -0.0064), indicating a role in nutritional choices.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: The rs6092 SNP in the SERPINE1 gene was linked to severe COVID-19 and its relation to plasma coagulation proteins, showcasing an intersection with respiratory diseases.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs763646 was associated with the expression of a specific junction in the gene EXOC4, indicating its role in MI. This association had p-values of LIBD dataset p=0.001 and CMC dataset p=0.03, underscoring its relevance in the gene regulation mechanisms related to psychiatric phenotypes.
title: The genomic basis of mood instability: identification of 46 loci in 363,705 UK Biobank participants, genetic correlation with psychiatric disorders, and association with gene expression and function

finding: The A allele of rs1031486 was associated with higher expression of the SEC61G gene in NK cells after dexamethasone treatment, indicating it possibly plays a role in immune response modulation.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs6957904, located in the gene TPK1, showed a higher spread of the ancestral allele among populations from North West India and South West coast compared to the Gangetic plain populations. This indicated a distinct genetic lineage linked to historical migrations.
title: Genetic affinities and adaptation of the South West coast populations of India

finding: The study indicated a correlation between the presence of the PAI-1 SNP rs6092 and increased disease severity in COVID-19. This was linked to PAI-1's role in regulating extracellular levels that control the spread of SARS-CoV-2, with findings suggesting a significant functional implication of this variant in severe cases of the disease.
title: In-silico docking platform with serine protease inhibitor (SERPIN) structures identifies host cysteine protease targets with significance for SARS-CoV-2

finding: rs798528 on 7p22.3 was linked to left putamen connectivity with a z-score of -6.74, suggesting a significant impact on structural brain connectivity.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The variant rs2405442 in PILRA was reported as exome-wide significant with a p-value of 1.7 x 10^-7, indicating its association with increased risk of late onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD).
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The variant rs856540, an intergenic variant near IGFBP3, was part of the putative core instruments for serum IGF1 levels. MR Corge estimates indicated that increased serum IGF1 levels could lead to increased height.
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with alternative 3'UTR usage of the gene IRF5 in whole blood. The association was supported by a highly significant FDR value of 7.26e-159. Analysis showed that the genetic effect exhibited through rs10954213 was consistent across 22 different tissues, implicating its potential role in autoimmune diseases, specifically systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
title: Genetic Basis of Alternative Polyadenylation is an Emerging Molecular Phenotype for Human Traits and Diseases

finding: Found within intron 1 of ELMO1, this variant significantly affected ELMO1 expression, a gene relevant for lymphocyte motility.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The SNP rs13246288 showed significance in studies involving patient-derived xenografts of high-grade serous ovarian cancer, as reported by Cybula et al. (2021). This SNP finding contributed to the understanding of the molecular drivers of the cancer subtype, emphasizing its importance in preclinical research related to patient-derived organoid models.
title: A Scalable 3D High-Content Imaging Protocol for Measuring a Drug Induced DNA Damage Response Using Immunofluorescent Sub-nuclear γH2AX Spots in Patient Derived Ovarian Cancer Organoids

finding: The SNP rs13225810 was associated with metabolic plasticity in melanoma progression, particularly influencing the response to oncogene targeted therapies such as BRAF and MEK inhibitors. This finding indicated that variations at this locus could impact therapy resistance in melanoma cells, reflecting its significance in the context of treatment outcomes.
title: Ferroptosis susceptibility of melanoma cells: dependence on cell-type, acquired drug resistance, and medium composition

finding: The SNP rs12113219 was identified as having a significant association with the efficacy of oncolytic reovirus therapy in cancer treatment, according to findings reported in a publication analyzing the present and future of oncolytic reovirus. This association highlighted the potential of genetic factors in predicting patient responses to viral therapies.
title: Structure of Orthoreovirus RNA Chaperone σNS, a Component of Viral Replication Factories

finding: The strongest association was found between rs12539172 in NYAP1 and the PILRB/PILRA proteins, with a minor allele associated with reduced protein levels. Age-related increases in protein levels were noted across all genotypes, showcasing a potential dose-dependent effect of the minor allele.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multi-omic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: This SNP in NYAP1 demonstrated robust associations with PILRB and PILRA protein levels, indicating a potential biological interaction affecting immune response in relation to AD risk.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multi-omic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: The R78 substitution variant implicated in rs1859788 was associated with reduced PILRA protein expression, potentially enhancing microglial activity and offering insights into immune responses relevant to AD.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multi-omic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: This SNP was located in the same large linkage disequilibrium (LD) block as the PTSD-associated SNP found in the Million Veteran Program (MVP). Carriers of the minor allele of rs11761270 showed decreased levels of methylation and were at increased risk of developing PTSD. This finding aligned with results where PTSD cases exhibited a reduction in methylation from pre-to post-deployment, suggesting its role as a risk factor for PTSD and other psychiatric disorders.
title: Meta-analysis of longitudinal epigenome-wide association studies of military cohorts reveals multiple CpG sites associated with post-traumatic stress disorder

finding: There was a significant association found between rs77155650 and neutrophil content in lung samples, with a p-value of 9.7 × 10^-11. This variant was located 76 kb from the CUX1 gene, which is linked to neutrophil infiltration and immune response regulation. Furthermore, CUX1 expression in lung samples correlated with neutrophil infiltration (p = 4.5 × 10^-4), suggesting that rs77155650 might influence immune response through its interaction with CUX1.
title: Age, Sex, and Genetics Influence the Abundance of Infiltrating Immune Cells in Human Tissues

finding: rs4723537 was connected to differentially edited sites between AD and controls, reinforcing its role as a biomarker in neurodegenerative disease and linking with pathogenesis markers related to tau levels.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: The study reported that the rs587776523 SNP, which corresponds to the <italic>Mir96<sup>14C>A</sup></italic> mutation, was associated with dominant delayed onset hearing loss (DFNA50). The <italic>Mir96<sup>14C>A</sup></italic> mice exhibited complete hearing loss across all frequencies by four weeks of age, confirmed through auditory brain stem response (ABR) and distortion product otoacoustic emission (DPOAE) tests. The findings highlighted that hearing loss began at high frequency (32 kHz) and became progressively worse at lower frequencies by eight and twelve weeks.
title: Targeted genome editing restores auditory function in adult mice with progressive hearing loss caused by a human microRNA mutation

finding: The SNP rs587776522 was also identified in the study as causing autosomal dominant non-syndromic progressive hearing loss DFNA50. The <italic>Mir96</italic> mutation associated with this SNP, along with rs587776523, was shown to lead to significant auditory impairment, with evidence supporting a correlation between the mutation and the severity of hearing loss in the tested mouse model.
title: Targeted genome editing restores auditory function in adult mice with progressive hearing loss caused by a human microRNA mutation

finding: The lead SNP rs3211938 at the novel locus CD36 was found to be common in African Americans (minor allele frequency = 10%) and had significant associations with TP segment (p = 1 x 10^-13) and QT interval (p = 6 x 10^-10). It was reported to increase QT interval by 3.70 ms for each G allele. This finding was particularly impactful as it was among the largest reported effects on QT interval, linking to increased risk for sudden cardiac arrest.
title: Multi-ethnic genome-wide association study of decomposed cardioelectric phenotypes illustrates strategies to identify and characterize evidence of shared genetic effects for complex traits

finding: This SNP was identified as a Tier 1 AFR_high anc-eQTL for the CD36 gene, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.077 in African ancestry high populations and 0.0020 in African ancestry low populations. It had been linked to high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol levels in previous multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies (GWAS) involving African Americans.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The variant rs61735090 was linked to Alzheimer's disease through the analysis of methylation outliers that exhibited a high impact, signaling its importance in AD-related traits.
title: The functional impact of rare variation across the regulatory cascade

finding: The SNP rs10954213 was associated with alternative polyadenylation (APA) regulation for the IRF5 3'UTR. This association was established through linkage disequilibrium, evidenced by a significant p-value of 4.69 × 10−8, highlighting its role in glucocorticoid-mediated APA.
title: Glucocorticoids Mediate Transcriptome-wide Alternative Polyadenylation: Mechanisms and Functional Implications

finding: The mutation V17M at rs11557408 was predicted to be disease causing, localized at a highly conservative region of the SBDS protein and reported as deleterious by the SIFT server. This SNP had not been documented in any previous studies.
title: Prediction of Four Novel SNPs V17M, R11H, A66T, and F57S in the SBDS Gene Possibly Associated with Formation of Shwachman-Diamond Syndrome, using an Insilico Approach

finding: The mutation R11H at rs11557409 was predicted to be disease causing, situated in a highly conservative region of the SBDS protein. It was also assessed as deleterious by SIFT and had not been mentioned in prior studies.
title: Prediction of Four Novel SNPs V17M, R11H, A66T, and F57S in the SBDS Gene Possibly Associated with Formation of Shwachman-Diamond Syndrome, using an Insilico Approach

finding: The SNP rs367842164, associated with the A66T mutation, was predicted to cause disease and occurred in a conservative region of the SBDS protein. It was classified as deleterious by SIFT and not reported in earlier research.
title: Prediction of Four Novel SNPs V17M, R11H, A66T, and F57S in the SBDS Gene Possibly Associated with Formation of Shwachman-Diamond Syndrome, using an Insilico Approach

finding: The mutation F57S at rs376960114 was identified as disease causing and located in a highly conserved area of the SBDS protein. It was reported as deleterious by SIFT and had not been found in previous literature.
title: Prediction of Four Novel SNPs V17M, R11H, A66T, and F57S in the SBDS Gene Possibly Associated with Formation of Shwachman-Diamond Syndrome, using an Insilico Approach

finding: The SNP rs7805591 was identified as an adaptive SNV with significantly different frequencies between Tibetans and Hans. It had a high linkage with a deletion at chr7:1,185,070-1,187,063, affecting the expression of ZFAND2A.
title: Characterization of Structural Variation in Tibetans Reveals New Evidence of High-altitude Adaptation and Introgression

finding: The SNP rs2949174 also demonstrated significant frequency differences between the Tibetan and Han populations and was linked to the nearby deletion affecting ZFAND2A expression.
title: Characterization of Structural Variation in Tibetans Reveals New Evidence of High-altitude Adaptation and Introgression

finding: The SNP rs2140578 exhibited substantial differences in frequencies between populations and was linked to the same deletion as ZFAND2A, functioning as an eQTL.
title: Characterization of Structural Variation in Tibetans Reveals New Evidence of High-altitude Adaptation and Introgression

finding: The SNP rs2949172 was found to have significant frequency variations across populations and was associated with the same adaptive regulatory mechanisms affecting ZFAND2A.
title: Characterization of Structural Variation in Tibetans Reveals New Evidence of High-altitude Adaptation and Introgression

finding: This SNP was identified as causal for myeloma. NLDNN outperformed sequence-level models in prioritizing and identifying this SNP as associated with the disease.
title: Cross-species prediction of transcription factor binding by adversarial training of a novel nucleotide-level deep neural network

finding: The SNP rs2944833, at chr7:71,774,496, yielded significant SMR colocalization results for the CALN1 gene, related to neuronal physiology, memory, and learning. This SNP had prior associations with educational attainment, intelligence, cognitive function, and schizophrenia, demonstrating the effectiveness of CC-GWAS in identifying associated loci.
title: Identifying loci with different allele frequencies among cases of eight psychiatric disorders using CC-GWAS

finding: This SNP was characterized as crucial in the regulation of the CUX1 gene, leading to decreased expression levels which impacted megakaryopoiesis and was associated with traits such as mean platelet volume. Its involvement in hematopoietic stem cell maintenance was validated through various experimental approaches including CRISPR/Cas9 editing.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The SNP rs2107732 was identified in the CCM2 gene and was associated with a decreased risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) in multiple recent GWAS studies, with an odds ratio of 0.92 and a significance level of P = 1.53 x 10^-8. This missense variant led to a valine-to-isoleucine substitution at amino acid 74 in the PTB domain of CCM2, affecting its interactions with KRIT1.
title: Mapping the convergence of genes for coronary artery disease onto endothelial cell programs

finding: SNP rs39451 was significant in the upstream region of the KCS4 gene. It showed evidence of being part of a potential regulatory mechanism influencing TAG synthesis, in conjunction with the other polymorphisms such as rs39499 and m11502, suggesting coordinated promoter regulation under stress conditions.
title: Hello darkness, my old friend: 3-Ketoacyl-Coenzyme A Synthase4 is a branch point in the regulation of triacylglycerol synthesis in Arabidopsis by re-channeling fatty acids under carbon starvation

finding: The SNP rs12666347 was associated with significantly elevated serum EGFR concentrations, which correlated with increased coronary artery calcium (CAC) in individuals from the MESA and Framingham cohorts.
title: Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Inhibition Prevents Caveolin-1-dependent Calcifying Extracellular Vesicle Biogenesis

finding: The SNP rs7806938 was identified as having significant correlations with increased serum EGFR levels, which were connected to greater coronary artery calcium accumulation in the analyzed cohorts.
title: Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Inhibition Prevents Caveolin-1-dependent Calcifying Extracellular Vesicle Biogenesis

finding: This SNP scored higher than GWAS SNP rs3735025, indicating its relevance in the risk locus related to schizophrenia.
title: WEVar: a novel statistical learning framework for predicting noncoding regulatory variants

finding: The variant rs2405442 in PILRA was associated with late onset Alzheimer's disease, showing significant findings with a p-value of 1.7 × 10^-7.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: This SNP was identified as a causal variant for cystic fibrosis. The model was tested with this SNP in a query related to cystic fibrosis symptoms.
title: Boosting GPT Models for Genomics Analysis: Generating Trusted Genetic Variant Annotations and Interpretations through RAG and fine-tuning

finding: This SNP was identified as being associated with two traits in opposite directions, indicating its involvement in multi-trait associations.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: The study found a positive association of the IL6 C allele with COVID-19 severity. The presence of the CC genotype led to higher IL-6 plasmatic levels and a higher frequency of symptoms in COVID-19 patients, correlating with previous meta-analysis which indicated the C allele's association with worldwide COVID-19 mortality rates.
title: Association of polymorphisms of IL-6 pathway genes (IL6, IL6R and IL6ST) with COVID-19 severity in an Amazonian population

finding: The SNP rs7789995 (A>T) was found in the 5' flanking region of D7S820, contributing to the highest number of alleles (11 alleles) observed due to variation in the flanking region.
title: The concordance of length- and sequence-based STRs used in forensic markers with guidance for practice

finding: The SNP rs16887642 (G>A) was located in the 3' flanking region of D7S820 which also contributed to the allele variation, leading to a total of 11 alleles at this locus.
title: The concordance of length- and sequence-based STRs used in forensic markers with guidance for practice

finding: This SNP mapped to the ELFNI gene, associated with mathematical ability and noncognitive aspects of educational attainment. It was identified as the second top SNP by XGBoost.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: This SNP mapped to the ELFNI gene and had a p-value of 0.004 in the GWAS, indicating its potential relevance to cognitive traits.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: This SNP also mapped to the ELFNI gene and had a p-value of 0.01 in the GWAS, highlighting its association with cognitive abilities.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: The study indicated that the PDGFA gene polymorphism rs9690350 was positively associated with an increased risk of biliary atresia in Chinese children. This finding related to the underlying fibro-inflammatory disease linked to the dysfunction of the extrahepatic bile duct.
title: Efemp1 modulates elastic fiber formation and mechanics of the extrahepatic bile duct

finding: This SNP was associated with TRBV28 with a beta of -0.957 and a P-value of 2.12 x 10^−40, indicating a significant cis association that was replicated at the single-cell level across all CD8+ and CD4+ cells. The association was especially strong in terminally differentiated effector memory cells, suggesting a pan T cell mechanism that relates to TCR repertoire.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: The lead SNP for TRBV4-3, this variant demonstrated a positive association with a beta of 0.571 and a P-value of 9.83 x 10^−12, highlighting multiple germline variants impacting the usage of this V-gene.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: This SNP exhibited a significant secondary signal associated with TRBV4-3, with a beta of -0.460 and a P-value of 2.66 x 10^−11, indicating additional genetic influences on clonal usage.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: The SNP rs12704907, specifically the C-allele, exhibited the highest positive association with the phenotype 'Cause of death: other specified respiratory disorders'. This finding holds significance as it highlights potential health implications associated with the introgressed variant of this allele.
title: DLX5/6 GABAergic expression affects social vocalization: implications for human evolution

finding: Similar to rs12704907, the SNP rs4729325 also showed the highest positive association with the phenotype 'Cause of death: other specified respiratory disorders'. The C-allele of this SNP was linked strongly to this adverse health outcome, confirming its relevance in a disease context.
title: DLX5/6 GABAergic expression affects social vocalization: implications for human evolution

finding: This variant demonstrated a specific link to the DGKB gene in beta cells and accounted for 33.6% of the colocalization with fasting glucose and hemoglobin A1C, indicating its potential contribution to diabetic conditions.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: rs2268382 was linked to CPA4, suggesting a direct role in the exocrine pancreas, thereby indicating that this locus may significantly contribute to diabetes through non-beta cell mechanisms.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: The SNP rs3211938 was associated with total CD36 protein deficiency in homozygous carriers, leading to increased activation of neutrophils as indicated by lower levels of CD62L. This finding linked the genetic variant to heightened inflammation and potential risk factors like endothelial dysfunction, vascular stiffness, and cardiovascular diseases, making it significant in understanding lymphatic endothelial dysfunction.
title: Insulin regulates lymphatic endothelial function via palmitoylation

finding: The SNP rs6850 (PPIA) was shown to be associated with raised plasma cyclophilin A levels in patients with coronary artery disease, linking it to cardiovascular health.
title: Identification of biomarkers, pathways and potential therapeutic targets for heart failure using bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs2714700 was identified as a genome-wide significant locus associated with nicotine dependence (ND), which was driven by the heaviness of smoking measures. It was consistently associated with milder ND, reflecting both primary and secondary features. Furthermore, it showed significant evidence of being a cis-eQTL for the MAGI2-AS3 transcript in the hippocampus, indicating a potential impact on gene expression related to ND.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: This SNP was identified as being associated with major depressive disorder (MDD). Specifically, it was noted that the depression-associated <italic>Pclo</italic> rs2522833 C allele was found to be less common in MDD patients who had a family history of MDD, indicating a potential genetic predisposition related to familial ties in the context of depression.
title: Mutant screen reveals depression-associated Piccolo’s control over brain-gonad cross talk and reproductive behavior

finding: The SNP rs13246388 was associated with the regulation of RKIP in prostate cancer, which indicated that lower RKIP levels facilitated cancer metastasis and stemness, thereby contributing to worse clinical outcomes.
title: A systems-level analysis of the mutually antagonistic roles of RKIP and BACH1 in dynamics of cancer cell plasticity

finding: The variant rs2405442 in PILRA exhibited a beneficial effect, associated with reduced risk of AD.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs1990622 was identified as a trans-eQTL lead SNP for the TDP-43 subtype of frontotemporal lobar degeneration, affecting 35 trans-eQTL genes.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs10950398 showed trans-eQTL effects influencing various genes, particularly KCNA5 in the context of neuronal functions.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs11974335 was identified in a locus affecting multiple eQTL genes, with strong associations in brain-related traits.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs2299148, associated with SA3, was also related to academic attainment and cognitive ability.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The lead SNP rs3211938 at the novel locus CD36 was identified as common in African Americans (minor allele frequency = 10%) but near-monomorphic in European Americans. It showed significant associations with contiguous ECG traits such as TP segment (p = 1x10^-13) and QT interval (p = 6x10^-10), with every copy of the G allele increasing the QT interval by 3.70 ms. This SNP exemplified the study's focus on ancestral diversity.
title: Multi-ethnic genome-wide association study of decomposed cardioelectric phenotypes illustrates strategies to identify and characterize evidence of shared genetic effects for complex traits

finding: The SNP rs534114641 was identified as a highly polygenic locus significantly associated with various diseases and was linked to several genes relevant to Alzheimer's pathology.
title: The Genetic Heterogeneity of Multimodal Human Brain Age

finding: The SNP rs12113227 was associated with the expression of TLR3 in solid cancer tissues. In the context of this study, TLR3 was linked to therapy resistance in various cancers, suggesting that this SNP could play a significant role in influencing patient responses to treatment.
title: Metadichol an agonist that expresses the entire Toll Like Receptor family in various Cancer Cell Lines and its potential Impact on Cancer Treatment

finding: The SNP rs13246163 was linked to HSP90 inhibition synergizing with cisplatin treatment, enhancing effectiveness against specific pancreatic cancer cells, thus illuminating its potential involvement in cancer therapeutics.
title: HSP90 buffers deleterious genetic variations in BRCA1

finding: Associated with both CKD and serum creatinine at genome-wide significance; differential methylation within PRKAG2 was previously linked to CKD.
title: Assessment of differentially methylated loci in individuals with end-stage kidney disease attributed to diabetic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs16875285 was identified as having an allele-specific effect on circRNA isoforms from the long non-coding RNA GARS-DT. The C allele of this SNP was associated with lower expression of one circRNA isoform while it increased the expression of another circRNA isoform.
title: Genetic Regulation of Circular RNA Expression in Human Aortic Smooth Muscle Cells and Vascular Traits

finding: The SERPINE1 gene polymorphism rs6092 was found to be associated with type 2 diabetes and related metabolic traits, highlighting its significance in diabetes-related metabolic changes.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs12113227 was implicated in the regulation of Toll-like Receptor 3 (TLR3), which was discussed in the context of solid tumors and therapy resistance. The study highlighted its role in cancer progression and resistance mechanisms.
title: Metadichol, a modulator that controls expression of Toll Like Receptors in Cancer Cell Lines

finding: The SNP rs1799884 was located within a NEUROG3-binding site at the promoter region of GCK, a gene critical for glucose metabolism, contributing to understanding its association with type 2 diabetes.
title: Extensive NEUROG3 occupancy in the human pancreatic endocrine gene regulatory network

finding: The A/G genotype was found in RedPenMC, with the G allele being protective. This SNP was previously reported as a modifier affecting GRN levels and the age of onset in GRN mediated frontotemporal dementia.
title: Single-cell multimodal omics and directly reprogrammed neurons to probe reduced penetrance in Frontotemporal Dementia

finding: The SNP rs11763367 showed GxC effects related to cellular respiration as per the classification of cellular contexts. This SNP was linked to WBSCR27, highlighting distinct genetic regulation in relation to cellular metabolic states.
title: CellRegMap: A statistical framework for mapping context-specific regulatory variants using scRNA-seq

finding: The intronic rs116580059 variant located near SCIN was associated with increased levels of APOE in the TX fraction and was nominally associated with lower Thal phase and a trend for lower Braak stage.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The SNP rs12666347 was associated with significantly elevated serum levels of EGFR, which correlated with increased coronary artery calcium among individuals in the MESA and Framingham cohorts, indicating a potential role in vascular calcification pathology.
title: Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Inhibition Prevents Caveolin-1-dependent Calcifying Extracellular Vesicle Biogenesis

finding: The SNP rs7806938 was found to be associated with higher levels of serum EGFR, correlating with elevated coronary artery calcium in the analyzed cohorts, indicating its relevance in the pathophysiology of vascular calcification in CKD.
title: Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Inhibition Prevents Caveolin-1-dependent Calcifying Extracellular Vesicle Biogenesis

finding: The SNP rs11556924-T (p.Arg363His) was found to be associated with lower risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) and hypertension by reducing ZC3HC1 expression. However, it also increased carotid intima-media thickness (IMT) particularly in rheumatoid arthritis patients. In cell migration assays, human vascular smooth muscle cells (SMCs) carrying the T allele exhibited faster migration compared to those with the C allele, aligning with evidence of SMC proliferation linked to ZC3HC1 modulation.
title: Deficiency of ZC3HC1 increases vascular smooth muscle cell migration, proliferation and neointima formation following injury

finding: The study identified osteopontin as a key regulator in cell behavior and differentiation, which may relate to the function of the SNP rs12113379 in influencing keratocyte differentiation and fibroblast activity in corneal tissue. The findings highlighted the role of osteopontin in immune modulation and tumor progression, suggesting a potential link between this SNP and various physiological and pathological processes, including corneal fibrosis.
title: Investigating transcriptional differences in mechanotransductive and ECM related genes in cultured primary corneal keratocytes, fibroblasts and myofibroblasts

finding: The SNP rs17345286 was associated with levels of asparagine (p = 4.7×10^-20). It was noted that this variant is in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with a missense mutation in the ASNS gene (rs1049674, p.Val210Glu), which encodes for asparagine synthase, linking genetic variation to metabolite levels.
title: Cross-platform genetic discovery of small molecule products of metabolism and application to clinical outcomes

finding: The SNP rs1049674 was noted as a missense mutation related to the ASNS gene, contributing to the association with asparagine levels, confirming its original finding linked to metabolic processes.
title: Cross-platform genetic discovery of small molecule products of metabolism and application to clinical outcomes

finding: Homozygous carriers of SNP rs12113206 exhibited altered expression levels of the Human Equilibrative Nucleoside Transporter-1 (hENT1), which significantly influenced its activity in the uptake and cytotoxicity of Gemcitabine specifically in pancreatic cancer models, marking its relevance in designing therapies.
title: Exploring the therapeutic potential of a novel series of imidazothiadiazoles targeting focal adhesion kinase (FAK) for pancreatic cancer treatment: Synthesis, mechanistic Insights and promising antitumor and safety profile

finding: The P284T variant of POR (rs72557937) was studied for its effect on the activity of CYP19A1. This variant, situated in the hinge region of POR, resulted in reduced enzymatic activity when paired with CYP19A1 variants, indicating alterations in protein-protein interactions that adversely affected CYP19A1 activity.
title: Differential effects of variations in human P450 oxidoreductase on the aromatase activity of CYP19A1 polymorphisms R264C and R264H

finding: Analysis of the HDAC9 locus at SNP rs2107595 revealed frequent loss of alleles affecting 5 out of 13 clones edited with the APP Iberian mutation. Similar to findings for rs9976425, SNP genotyping indicated some homozygosity at this SNP but normal copy numbers in qgPCR assays, again suggesting LOH.
title: Detection of deleterious on-target effects after HDR-mediated CRISPR editing

finding: This SNP was identified in the TMEM106B gene, associated with frontotemporal dementia. Its presence was noted in the analysis, contributing to understanding genetic variants related to neurodegenerative diseases.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The SNP rs2718058, which is adjacent to the NME8 gene, was associated with a preventive role in Alzheimer’s disease. Specifically, it was reported to reduce neurodegeneration, brain atrophy, and hypometabolism, highlighting the importance of this SNP in cognitive processes related to Alzheimer's.
title: Williams syndrome and autism: dissimilar socio-cognitive profiles with similar patterns of abnormal gene expression in the blood

finding: The SNP rs12155159 in the NME8 gene was associated with less cognitive decline on a domain-specific cognitive test score, particularly the delayed word recall test, in individuals suffering from Alzheimer’s disease, thereby indicating its role in cognitive function in this context.
title: Williams syndrome and autism: dissimilar socio-cognitive profiles with similar patterns of abnormal gene expression in the blood

finding: Similar to rs182677317, rs369849556 was also found to be annotated as conflicting for ciliary dyskinesia. Its presence with high allele frequencies in the NyuWa dataset indicated a need for further examination of its pathogenicity, suggesting that it may not contribute to the disease.
title: NyuWa Genome Resource: Deep Whole Genome Sequencing Based Chinese Population Variation Profile and Reference Panel

finding: The SNP rs12113431 was identified in the context of colorectal cancer (CRC) and was associated with the CPT1A gene. The analysis demonstrated that CPT1A was significantly downregulated in CRC and this downregulation correlated negatively with responsiveness to neoadjuvant radiotherapy. Enhancements in radiosensitivity were linked to the modulation of reactive oxygen species (ROS) scavenging through the FOXM1-SOD1/SOD2/CAT axis, suggesting that this SNP had implications for understanding radioresistance in CRC.
title: CPT1A Mediates Radiation Sensitivity in Colorectal Cancer

finding: The SNP rs1858830, located in the promoter region of the MET gene, was identified as associated with autistic disorder. This finding was based on evidence that suggested a link between the C variant of this SNP and disrupted language functioning, which relates to the broader context of neural development and cognitive functions, particularly within language processing networks in the brain.
title: Gene Expression Correlates of the Cortical Network Underlying Sentence Processing

finding: This SNP had substantial associations with various diseases and traits at the GM-BAG locus and was supported by previous GWAS studies related to brain aging.
title: The Genetic Heterogeneity of Multimodal Human Brain Age

finding: The SNP rs13246301 was found to support the tumor-promoting environment in CLL. The research demonstrated that alterations in this SNP correlate with the expression of interleukin-9 (IL-9), which negatively modulates anti-tumor immune functions.
title: Leukemic cell-secreted interleukin-9 suppresses cytotoxic T cell-mediated killing in chronic lymphocytic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs4731702 was identified as a variant upstream of the maternally expressed transcription factor KLF14, associated with type-2 diabetes and cholesterol levels. It showed maternally-restricted cis-regulatory associations with KLF14 expression in adipose tissue, indicating its role in propagating parent-of-origin effects in biallelic genes related to variations in adiposity phenotypes.
title: Epistatic Networks Associated with Parent-of-Origin Effects on Metabolic Traits

finding: Similar to rs4731702, the SNP rs972283 was identified as a variant upstream of KLF14. This SNP was also linked to type-2 diabetes and cholesterol levels, supporting its role in the parent-of-origin effects through its associations with KLF14 and subsequent impact on adiposity-related gene expression.
title: Epistatic Networks Associated with Parent-of-Origin Effects on Metabolic Traits

finding: This SNP was identified from a 2013 Alzheimer's disease GWAS involving 74,046 individuals of European ancestry, indicating its relevance as a risk locus for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: Found in the same 2013 GWAS, this SNP also demonstrated a substantial association with Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The SNP rs10254116 was located within the enhancer -707BMPER, which was associated with craniosynostosis risk. It was significant in the enhancer's regulatory activity in cranial cartilage, particularly during frontal bone initiation and exhibited differential binding to alternate and reference alleles, suggesting its contribution to the genetic mechanism underlying CS.
title: Identification of conserved skeletal enhancers associated with craniosynostosis risk genes

finding: The CYP3A5 variant rs776746 was observed in African populations at a high frequency of 83.15% and is significant for affecting drug metabolism, highlighting a genetic disparity compared to non-African populations.
title: The extent and impact of variation in ADME genes in sub-Saharan African populations

finding: The SNP rs17168486 was associated with type 2 diabetes risk at the DGKB locus. The T allele linked to increased DGKB expression in human islets and was situated around 45 kb upstream of the DGKB promoter, indicating its regulatory role on DGKB expression.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: The SNP rs10228066 was implicated in type 2 diabetes at the DGKB locus, where it co-localised with the eQTL signal at rs10231021. It was found to be located approximately 121 kb downstream of the DGKB promoter but lacked direct interaction in the chromatin regions evaluated.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: The SNP rs12113219 was identified in a study that evaluated the past, present, and future roles of oncolytic reovirus. It was noted as a significant finding associated with the effectiveness of reovirus in cancer therapy.
title: Structure of Orthoreovirus RNA Chaperone σNS, a Component of Viral Replication Factories

finding: This reQTL affected the gene TMEM106B and indicated a colocalization with depression in IAV perturbation context.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: There was a suggestive association found between rs7459185 and type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk in the Finnish population. Specifically, this SNP was linked to decreased T2D risk along with an increased inclusion of islet microexons (IsletMICs) in human islets.
title: Control of pancreatic islet function and glucose homeostasis by a novel microexon program misregulated in type 2 diabetes

finding: The rs67070387 SNP was strongly associated with increased fasting glucose (FG) levels. Additionally, it was found that this genetic variant corresponded with elevated expression of SRRM3 and higher inclusion of IsletMICs in human islets, which was further corroborated by luciferase assays.
title: Control of pancreatic islet function and glucose homeostasis by a novel microexon program misregulated in type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs6959887, identified as the lead variant for a birth weight GWAS locus, was shown to colocalize with the CVPC QTL module 47, which is located 12 kb upstream of TBX20. This variant was associated with decreased accessibility of the regulatory element cvpc_atac_peak_233871, decreased expression of TBX20, ENSG00000289335, ENSG00000288947, and ENSG00000289089, as well as increased expression of ENSG00000226063. The findings indicated that these expression changes may contribute to birth weight and the risk of developing congenital heart defects or cardiovascular disease later in life.
title: Multi-omic QTL mapping in early developmental tissues reveals phenotypic and temporal complexity of regulatory variants underlying GWAS loci

finding: The rs78840640 variant at the IGF2BP3 locus was shown to have a high causal probability (PPA=0.33) and demonstrated allelic effects in both high and low insulin-producing beta cell states, with functional validation through gene reporter assays indicating reduced enhancer activity for the T2D risk allele.
title: Single cell chromatin accessibility reveals pancreatic islet cell type- and state-specific regulatory programs of diabetes risk

finding: The CD36 nonsense variant was linked to ALP levels, emphasizing its relevance in cardiovascular and metabolic studies within African ancestry individuals.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: The SNP rs12536335 was identified as a lead SNP associated with broad antisocial behavior (ASB). It resided in an intronic region of the forkhead box protein P2 (FOXP2) gene, with a highly significant P-value of 6.32 x 10^-10 based on a meta-analysis of 85,359 individuals. This locus was the first significant genetic association found for broad ASB.
title: Uncovering the Genetic Architecture of Broad Antisocial Behavior through a Genome-Wide Association Study Meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was linked to CD8+ HLA-DR+ T cells that exhibit effector mechanisms in breast cancer patients who responded to neoadjuvant chemotherapy, implying a role in immune response efficacy.
title: Enhancing HLA-DR in Cytotoxic T Lymphocytes is crucial for the development of efficient adoptive T cell Therapies for Breast Cancer

finding: The rs139141690 variant was shown to downregulate the CUX1 gene, impacting hematopoietic stem cell homeostasis and megakaryocyte differentiation, correlating with findings from murine models.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The study identified a novel SNP in bonobo FOXP2, located 75 base pairs to the right of human SNP rs6980093. This represented the first report of a SNP in bonobo FOXP2, contributing to insights about its role in social communication.
title: Linked OXTR Variants Are Associated with Social Behavior Differences in Bonobos (Pan paniscus)

finding: The SNP rs11544331 involved a coding variant in the GPER gene, where proline at position 16 was replaced with leucine. This variant was relevant as it was found to be hypofunctional in response to G-1, suggesting an attenuated therapeutic response to the enantiomer LNS8801, which relies on GPER activation. The frequency of this allele was notably high in White Europeans, estimated at 25%, indicating that a significant proportion of the population had at least one copy of the variant. This information supported the hypothesis that the GPER genotype could act as a predictive biomarker for responses to therapy with LNS8801.
title: LNS8801: An enantiomerically pure agonist of the G protein-coupled estrogen receptor suitable for clinical development

finding: The SNP rs2405442 in PILRA was linked with reduced risk of AD. It demonstrated protective qualities with a hazard ratio of 0.88.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs11982736 G allele in the PSPH gene was also significantly associated with increased appendicular lean mass, having a p-value of 9.2e-17 and a beta of 0.0217. This association was corroborated by follow-up gene expression analysis indicating significant effects on gene expression in skeletal muscle (p=6.8e-74).
title: Skeletal muscle hypertrophy rewires glucose metabolism: an experimental investigation and systematic review

finding: The SNP rs6465133, located in the SRI gene, was found to be significantly associated with the ability to distinguish pancreatic cancer-associated new-onset diabetes (PCAND) from type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), with a p-value of 0.001. This was part of a larger analysis that aimed to identify genetic variants linked to PCAND.
title: Sorcin-STAT3-Serpin E1/CCL5 axis can be the trigger of pancreatic cancer-associated new-onset diabetes

finding: This SNP was implicated in the PON3 gene as a contributing variant in a cis-RV-pQTL. It was associated with decreased PON3 levels and demonstrated a significant correlation with lipid metabolism, showing an effect size beta of -1.18.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: In association with the PON3 gene, rs772677677 was confirmed as a missense variant contributing to decreased PON3 levels, with significant findings of an effect size of -1.55, highlighting its impact on LDL oxidation and atherosclerosis.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The DNAH11 variant rs12670798 showed interactions affecting serum lipid levels and contributed to disease risk factors for coronary heart disease, ischemic stroke, as well as atorvastatin efficacy.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP was identified as the top signal associated with the number of pieces of fresh fruit eaten per day. It was located on chromosome 7q35 and was found to cover a region containing the olfactory receptor gene OR6B1, with a significance of P=5.7×10^-65.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: The variant rs1734907 was associated with increased risk of both Crohn's disease (OR = 1.16, P = 1.67×10^-13) and schizophrenia (OR = 1.07, P = 7.55×10^-6). It had consistent associations across molecular phenotypes and was implicated in influencing EPHB4 expression and DNA methylation.
title: Cross-disorder analysis of schizophrenia and 19 immune diseases reveals genetic correlation

finding: This autism susceptibility SNP was detected in individuals S6 and S45. Individual S45 demonstrated severe bruxism, indicative of compulsive behavior often found in autism spectrum disorder. Given the genetic data alongside specific physical traits, there was a strong possibility that symptoms related to this SNP were manifest in this population.
title: Interdisciplinary analyses of Bronze Age communities from Western Hungary reveal complex population histories

finding: The TMEM106B rs1990622 A/A genotype was reported to be associated with a novel neuroglial tauopathy linked to FTLD/ALS-TDP, suggesting that this common variant increases the risk of FTLD-TDP, particularly in cases caused by GRN mutations.
title: Concurrent tau pathologies in frontotemporal lobar degeneration with TDP-43 pathology

finding: The SNP rs1990622 was identified as a top tagging variant within a haplotype block associated with increased risk for Frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTLD) with TDP-43 inclusions (FTLD-TDP). The minor G allele was found to reduce the risk of developing FTLD-TDP dementia while the major A allele was associated with an increased risk. Hence, this SNP significantly influenced dementia susceptibility.
title: A common Alu element insertion in the 3’UTR of TMEM106B is associated with an increased risk of dementia

finding: The coding SNP rs3173615 was identified to be in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs1990622 and associated with FTLD-TDP. It was also noted that the risk allele decreased the age at onset of dementia symptoms by an average of 13 years. A specific change in amino acid (T185S) in the protective form of the TMEM106B protein was linked to this SNP, further emphasizing its importance in the FTLD-TDP context.
title: A common Alu element insertion in the 3’UTR of TMEM106B is associated with an increased risk of dementia

finding: The non-coding SNP rs1990620 was mentioned to influence chromatin structure and gene transcription of TMEM106B. It was highlighted that variations in this SNP could lead to differences in transcriptional activity, hence being pivotal in understanding the functional relevance of TMEM106B haplotypes in various dementia-related disorders.
title: A common Alu element insertion in the 3’UTR of TMEM106B is associated with an increased risk of dementia

finding: The study provided evidence that the variant rs3801387, located near the WNT16 gene, is significantly associated with bone mineral density (BMD). The variant's effects were observed even after accounting for genetic linkage, underlying its major role in influencing BMD in humans. Furthermore, the research highlighted the pleiotropic effects of this locus, contributing to muscle mass through its role in somite development during embryonic stages.
title: wnt16 exerts pleiotropic effects on bone and lean mass in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs13245690, located near the CPED1 gene, exhibited an independent association with bone mineral density (BMD). This finding, like that of rs3801387, persisted beyond the effects of genetic linkage, indicating its significant role in BMD regulation. The distinction in regulatory effects between this SNP and rs3801387 further supports the hypothesis regarding their influence on different genes within the 7q31.31 chromosomal region.
title: wnt16 exerts pleiotropic effects on bone and lean mass in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs7789585 was associated with cardiac arrhythmias, specifically atrial fibrillation (AF) and flutter. It was found in a cardiomyocyte-specific open chromatin region within the second intron of the KCNH2 gene, supporting the hypothesis that this region may serve as an enhancer. Co-accessibility analysis indicated that KCNH2 was likely the target gene influenced by this variant, aligning with recent findings that noncoding risk variants associated with AF can affect cardiomyocyte enhancers of KCNH2.
title: Comprehensive identification of fetal cis-regulatory elements in the human genome by single-cell multi-omics analysis

finding: The Klf14 variant rs4731702 was found to be associated with the etiology of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD), including myocardial infarction (MI) and ischemic stroke. This indicated that SNP rs4731702 played a significant role in cardiovascular health and disease outcomes.
title: Krüppel-Like Factor 14 Improves Cardiac Function After Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs111400400, identified as a missense variation, was suggested to represent a causal risk factor linked to KLF14 and was thought to have implications on metabolism and atherosclerotic-related diseases, therefore underscoring its potential impact on conditions such as MI.
title: Krüppel-Like Factor 14 Improves Cardiac Function After Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs13246167 was identified as part of a study investigating the effector mechanisms of CD8+ HLA-DR+ T cells in breast cancer patients who responded to neoadjuvant chemotherapy. This finding was significant as it highlighted the potential role of this SNP in immune response and therapeutic outcomes in cancer, contributing to an understanding of genetic factors influencing treatment efficacy in specific patient populations.
title: Single cell view of tumor microenvironment gradients in pleural mesothelioma

finding: The rs1008266 variant was part of an eQTL linked to the ETV7 gene which is crucial for hematopoiesis. This SNP was associated with the expression of ETV7 in the presence of autoimmune traits such as rheumatoid arthritis and hay fever. The eQTL influenced the gene expression, with a positive correlation between the alternative allele and the upregulation of ETV7 in stimulated conditions.
title: Mapping interindividual dynamics of innate immune response at single-cell resolution

finding: In the context of cancer therapy, rs12113166 was found to be associated with targeting the transcription factor CREB, indicating its potential role in cancer treatment strategies. This SNP was part of research that demonstrated the significance of CREB in the regulation of transcriptional activation and its implications in cancer pathogenesis, supporting the idea that variations in this SNP could influence therapeutic outcomes.
title: Widespread variation in molecular interactions and regulatory properties among transcription factor isoforms

finding: The rs1990622 variant was associated with Alzheimer's disease and was found to regulate TMEM106B expression in human brain tissues. This finding was significant in the context of TMEM106B's involvement in various neurological disorders, particularly in the regulation of myelin lipid metabolism which is critical in Alzheimer’s pathology.
title: Lysosomal TMEM106B interacts with galactosylceramidase to regulate myelin lipid metabolism

finding: The SNP rs12113212 was associated with the development of patient-derived organoids in research related to parathyroid tissues. The study aimed to create organoids that exhibit properties resembling hyperplastic parathyroid tissue. This investigation provided insights into the functionality and the underlying genetic factors contributing to parathyroid diseases, paving the way for future studies on parathyroid physiology and potential therapeutic targets.
title: Patient-derived parathyroid organoids as tracer and drug-screening application model

finding: The rs2854746 SNP, located near the IGFBP3 gene, was strongly associated with both IGF-II and total IGFBP-3 serum levels. It colocalized significantly with the sitting height ratio (SHR) association but not with overall height. Interestingly, this SNP was also associated with multiple measures of bioelectrical impedance and blood pressures, suggesting its influence extends beyond skeletal growth.
title: Protein QTL analysis of IGF-I and its binding proteins provides insights into growth biology

finding: The rs1858830 polymorphism on the MET gene was associated with the interplay between prenatal exposure to PM10 and the risk of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). This suggests that individuals carrying this variant may have a genetic susceptibility that could be triggered by environmental factors.
title: A role for gene-environment interactions in Autism Spectrum Disorder is suggested by variants in genes regulating exposure to environmental factors

finding: The rs73156934 SNP influenced the expression of CALD1, despite its associated eCRE being unmarked in several contexts, which was substantiated by RT-qPCR and 4C-seq findings.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The rs10428917 SNP was shown to have a regulatory effect on CALD1 expression, similarly validated through multiple assays including RT-qPCR, indicating its enhancer-like functionality.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs2071307 was associated with improved performance in elastin bearing tissues in carriers of the minor allele, highlighting its evolutionary advantage and relevance to skin aging.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs55863875 in the ELN gene showed suggestive associations with self-reported youthfulness, indicating a potential role in skin elasticity and aging perceptions.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: SNP rs28763981 in the ELN gene was associated with youthfulness in females, being in high LD with rs2071307 and emphasizing the importance of elastin in skin aging.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs17855988, also in the ELN gene, was linked to cutis laxa and to self-reported youthfulness, reiterating the role of elastin in skin integrity.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs1799889, associated with the SERPINE1 (PAI-1) gene, was found to have a significant correlation with preeclampsia (PE) after conducting a systematic review and meta-analysis. This correlation highlighted the importance of the PAI-1 promoter polymorphism in the pathophysiology of PE, connecting the genetic variation in the gene to the increased risk of this life-threatening pregnancy complication.
title: HtrA1 alters endothelial tube formation characteristics in an in vitro model

finding: The SNP rs7459185 was associated with decreased type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk in the Finnish population, indicated by a regression coefficient (β) of -0.0565 and a P-value of 2.1 x 10^-6. This finding suggested an underlying genetic influence on T2D susceptibility, although similar associations were not found in other populations.
title: Control of pancreatic islet function and glucose homeostasis by a novel microexon program misregulated in type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs67070387 was strongly associated with increased fasting glucose (FG) levels, with a regression coefficient (β) of 0.0233 and a P-value of 7.94 x 10^-12. The variant was located in the intron of the SRRM3 gene and was linked to higher SRRM3 expression and increased inclusion of islet microexons. Additionally, functional assays indicated that the rare allele of this SNP enhanced luciferase expression compared to the common allele.
title: Control of pancreatic islet function and glucose homeostasis by a novel microexon program misregulated in type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs17605251 was identified in the coding region of the Napepld gene and was associated with severe obesity, specifically defined as a BMI of 35 kg/m² or more. This finding suggested that NAPE-PLD may play a significant role in the regulation of energy homeostasis and food-motivated behaviors, particularly in relation to metabolic disorders.
title: NAPE-PLD in the ventral tegmental area regulates reward events, feeding and energy homeostasis

finding: This SNP, near BBS9, reached a P-value of 3.02e-14 in the GWAS analysis, indicating significant association with normal-range cranial vault shape.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: Identified as an intronic SNP in BBS9, rs148673350 showed significant association with cranial vault morphology in the GWAS context, reaching a substantial P-value.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: Identified as a proxy SNP for rs202055590, it was included in the analysis and contributed to the overall findings related to cranial vault shape.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: The SNP rs1805319 allowed for the unambiguous identification of two alleles in the individual PMS2 cell lines. This identification was crucial for further analysis of the lesions present due to the targeted mutations, which were confirmed through sequencing. This finding contributes to the understanding of the role that genetic variations play in the context of repeat expansion mechanisms associated with diseases like GDPAG.
title: All three MutL complexes are required for repeat expansion in a human stem cell model of CAG-repeat expansion mediated glutaminase deficiency

finding: Found in the COG5 gene (7q22.3), rs2237659 was associated with lipid phenotypes, particularly LDL.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The rs113993960 variant, known as ΔF508, was established as the most common cause of cystic fibrosis through recessive inheritance. It was described in the context of non-invasive prenatal testing (NIPT) for the accurate prediction of this genetic disorder.
title: A novel high-throughput molecular counting method with single base-pair resolution enables accurate single-gene NIPT

finding: The SNP rs13246228 was identified in a study that explored the multicellular effects of STAT3 in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). The findings indicated that this SNP had a significant association with the regulation of JAK/STAT signaling pathways, contributing to the pathophysiology of lung cancer, which was underpinning the critical role of JAK/STAT signaling in various lung diseases, including NSCLC.
title: Maintaining structural and functional homeostasis of the Drosophila respiratory epithelia requires stress-modulated JAK/STAT activity

finding: The SNP rs342988 was identified as a lead SNP at a novel locus on Chromosome 7 associated with carotid artery intima-media thickness (cIMT). This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic factors influencing atherosclerosis.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: SNP rs11762074 was identified in connection to IMTmax and showed high LD with the lead SNP for IMTmean, highlighting its role in vascular health.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs35099106 was identified in the male-only analysis as significant for cIMT, illustrating the distinct genetic signals that differ between sexes.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: This SNP, implicated in myopia, was situated in an intron of VIPR2. Its presence in a chromatin accessibility peak specific to Müller glia allowed for a strong correlation with VIPR2 expression, qualifying it as the primary target gene affected by this SNP.
title: Single-cell multiome of the human retina and deep learning nominate causal variants in complex eye diseases

finding: The SNP rs12113142 was positively associated with Notch signaling pathway activity as reported in the study by Canté-Barrett et al. (2020). This finding suggested that this specific SNP could be a molecular marker for quantifying functional Notch signaling in human cancer, indicating its relevance in stem cell research and therapeutic applications.
title: Measurement of activity of developmental signal transduction pathways to quantify stem cell pluripotency and phenotypically characterize differentiated cells

finding: The genotype at rs73170626 was associated with the expression of the TRBV30 gene in early puberty, but the genetic effect disappeared in late puberty. This gene encodes a T cell receptor and highlights a potential link to sex-biased eQTL.
title: Analysis of transcriptional changes in the immune system associated with pubertal development in a longitudinal cohort of children with asthma

finding: The rs4473920 SNP, located on chromosome 7 within the CDCA7L gene, was identified as a meQTL hub locus, significantly associating with methylation levels at 1,119 independent distal CpG-sites spread across all autosomes. This finding highlighted its role in mediating methylation changes in trans, indicating a broader impact on genome-wide methylation patterns.
title: Genetic control of KRAB-ZFP genes explains distal CpG-site methylation which associates with human disease phenotypes

finding: The CARD9^G111S mutation, corresponding to CARD11^G123S, was associated with BENTA, thereby establishing a connection between the mutation and a specific phenotype.
title: “Franken-CARD9”: chimeric proteins for high-resolution studies of activating mutations in CARD10, CARD11 and CARD14

finding: The CARD11^G123D mutation, which is more severe than the previously noted BENTA-related CARD11^G123S mutation, corresponds to the CARD9^G111E mutation, reinforcing its potential relevance in similar conditions.
title: “Franken-CARD9”: chimeric proteins for high-resolution studies of activating mutations in CARD10, CARD11 and CARD14

finding: SNP rs11766679 associated with gene DPP6, linked to several genetic diseases.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: The SNP rs12113168 was identified as being involved in the nutritional regulation of UNC5A expression during colon carcinogenesis. The study showed a connection between O-GlcNAc transferase activity and epigenetic modifications that downregulated UNC5A in response to dietary influences, indicating its role in modifying cellular responses to nutrient variations.
title: Nutrigenomic Regulation of Sensory Plasticity

finding: Polymorphisms in NOS3 (rs2070744) were involved in the endothelial dysfunction pathway and carotid intima-media thickness among hypertensive patients.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SERPINE1 rs6092 was associated with type 2 diabetes and related metabolic traits in a Chinese population, demonstrating its role in metabolic health.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The A allele of rs759853 was found to confer risk for diabetic kidney disease in patients with type 2 diabetes, emphasizing its importance in diabetes complications.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This lead variant in the TMEM106B gene showed a genome-wide significant association with CSF NF-L levels, suggesting it regulates these levels and has been previously implicated in frontotemporal lobar degeneration.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: This non-synonymous variant was in nearly perfect linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the lead variant (rs1548884), possibly affecting TMEM106B protein function.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: This SNP was associated with FTLD and is in strong LD with rs1548884, pointing to a genetic connection between TMEM106B variants and neurodegenerative diseases.
