finding: The analysis indicated that high PD-L1 expression, associated with the rs13246225 SNP, correlated with the expression of EMT/invasive genes, which was linked to reduced recurrence-free survival in blood-circulating tumor cells from patients with non-muscle-invasive bladder cancer.
title: PD-L1 activity is associated with partial EMT and metabolic reprogramming in carcinomas

finding: The presence of the rs13235989 SNP was associated with high PD-L1 levels, which correlated with EMT and invasive gene expressions that negatively impacted recurrence-free survival in patients diagnosed with blood-circulating tumor cells from non-muscle-invasive bladder cancer.
title: PD-L1 activity is associated with partial EMT and metabolic reprogramming in carcinomas

finding: The rs3800631 SNP was identified as risk-associated within the context of schizophrenia. It was specifically enriched in neuronal A compartment chromatin during the differentiation of human induced pluripotent stem cells (hiPSCs) into neurons. This finding indicated a significant association between the chromatin environment and the genetic risk loci for schizophrenia.
title: Schizophrenia Risk Mapping and Functional Engineering of the 3D Genome in Three Neuronal Subtypes

finding: The SNP rs782881 was identified as the most frequent mutant allele in Europe, Asia, and the Americas, with frequencies of 48%, 54%, and 42% respectively. This SNP was linked to increased AKR1B10 gene expression and positively correlated with the number of cigarettes consumed per day, which aligns with higher incidences of lung cancer in these regions. The analysis suggested that it could play a role in the association between smoking behavior and lung cancer risk.
title: Systems biology analysis of publicly available transcriptomic data reveals a critical link between AKR1B10 gene expression, smoking and occurrence of lung cancer

finding: The SNP rs782510 was the most common mutant allele in Africa, with a prevalence of 78% in that population. It was also indicated that rs782510, along with rs782881, likely affected gene expression linked to AKR1B10, showing its potential influence on binding capacity and e-QTL implications. The presence of this SNP coincided with lower incidences of lung cancer and cigarette consumption in Africa, suggesting a protective role against lung cancer.
title: Systems biology analysis of publicly available transcriptomic data reveals a critical link between AKR1B10 gene expression, smoking and occurrence of lung cancer

finding: A strong association was found between the missense variant rs713598 of the TAS2R38 gene and PROP bitterness ratings. The C:C, C:G, and G:G genotypes demonstrated significant differences in PROP bitterness intensity, with statistical significance established through Tukey post hoc testing (p-value ≤ 0.001).
title: Worldwide study of the taste of bitter medicines and their modifiers

finding: In relation to the metabolic gene CD36, rs3211938 was confirmed to have associations with known metabolites such as plasmalogen, and novel associations were discovered with sphingomyelins and ceramides.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: Found in the MLXIPL gene, rs3812316 was involved in the association with diacylglycerol (DAG) levels, which were linked to the pathway controlling vascular function.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: This SNP is located in the 3’-UTR of TBL2 and was associated with diacylglycerol (DAG) levels, further supporting the impact on vascular function.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The PTPRN2 gene variant rs73510583 was associated with propyl 4-hydroxybenzoate sulfate, with a significant male effect.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The SNP rs4729607 was associated with HGB/HCT traits. A ~13-kbp deletion on chromosome 7, which includes the EPO promoter, was shown to be in strong LD with this SNP. This deletion was identified to impact gene expression related to iron metabolism and erythropoiesis, underscoring the deletion's importance in these traits.
title: Structural variation across 138,134 samples in the TOPMed consortium

finding: The SNP rs3958046 was the index variant for a locus on chromosome 7 that showed a significant association with ADHD across the lifespan.
title: Shared genetic background between children and adults with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

finding: The SNP rs7789146 was linked to atrial fibrillation through its association with an enhancer regulating the KCNH2 promoter. This association was established in a prior human heart study that utilized snATAC-seq data and confirmed through CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing of a human pluripotent stem cell-derived cardiomyocyte cell line. The enhanced function of this SNP was validated, emphasizing its role in enhancer activity and its potential impact on arrhythmic phenotypes.
title: Enhlink infers distal and context-specific enhancer-promoter linkages

finding: In the same study, the IL-6 (rs1800795) polymorphism was also linked to cognitive impairment in Asian breast cancer patients, indicating that this SNP may play a role in cognitive function alterations related to cancer.
title: An Ensemble Learning Approach for Cancer Drug Prediction

finding: The SNP rs13246251 was found to be associated with diffuse midline gliomas (DMG) specifically related to the oncogenic MYC pathway. This association suggests a genetic predisposition that could influence the aggressiveness and treatment response in pediatric patients diagnosed with DMG.
title: Dual Targeting of Histone Deacetylases and MYC as Potential Treatment Strategy for H3-K27M Pediatric Gliomas

finding: SNP rs4917014, located near IKZF1, showed a significantly stronger effect on SLE in East Asians (Odds Ratio [OR] = 1.33, P = 5.18E-29) compared to Europeans (OR = 1.16, P = 1.34E-06), illustrating ancestry-heterogeneous associations.
title: Identification of 38 novel loci for systemic lupus erythematosus and genetic heterogeneity that may underly population disparities in this disease

finding: The SNP rs13236025 was associated with the molecular activation of the Kv11.1 channel, which reprogrammed epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) in colon cancer. This finding was relevant because Kv11.1 activation inhibited TGF-beta signaling, suggesting a role in neoplastic cell behavior.
title: Voltage-dependent volume regulation controls epithelial cell extrusion and morphology

finding: The SNP rs12113228 was associated with extended survival in patients with cutaneous melanoma who were treated with beta-adrenergic blocking agents. This finding was reported in a nationwide Swedish population-based retrospective study which suggested that the administration of beta-blockers correlates with improved outcomes in this cancer subtype.
title: Glioblastoma and other intracranial tumors elicit systemic sympathetic hyperactivity that limits immunotherapeutic responses

finding: The rs17853284 variant (P228L) of POR was linked to significantly lower testosterone levels. It negatively impacted the stability and catalytic function of POR, leading to a reduction in activities of several cytochrome P450 enzymes, including CYP3A4 (25% reduction), CYP3A5, and CYP2C9 (both over 40% reduction), as well as a severe reduction in 17,20 lyase activity of CYP17A1 to only 27% of wild type. This finding highlighted the importance of the P228L variant in metabolic disorders, particularly in affecting androgen precursor levels such as DHEA, thereby correlating with lower testosterone production.
title: Loss of protein stability and function caused by P228L variation in NADPH-cytochrome P450 reductase linked to lower testosterone levels

finding: The SNP rs3801387 was associated with bone mineral density (BMD) and was linked to the gene WNT16. Previous research had established that variants at the CPED1-WNT16 locus exhibited pleiotropic effects on both BMD and lean tissue mass. In the context of zebrafish studies, Wnt16 played a crucial role in early skeletal development, influencing axial bone formation and lean tissue accrual.
title: Wnt16 exerts pleiotropic effects on bone and lean mass in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs13245690 was located near the gene CPED1 and was independently associated with bone mineral density. This association remained significant even when genetic linkage was controlled for. The work suggested that variants at this locus could impact different regulatory elements and affect distinct genes, thereby influencing lean mass and skeletal morphology.
title: Wnt16 exerts pleiotropic effects on bone and lean mass in zebrafish

finding: The association of SNP rs11977526 with two traits in opposite directions confirmed its role in influencing distinct blood pressure traits.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: On chromosome 7, rs76350051 was associated with bipolar disorder (BIP) with a MAF of 0.0004, an Info score of 0.04, and a very low p-value of 2.47 × 10⁻³⁷, indicating a strong association.
title: Increasing the resolution and precision of psychiatric GWAS by re-imputing summary statistics using a large, diverse reference panel

finding: The rs12539172 SNP in the 3' region of NYAP1 showed the strongest associations with PILRB and PILRA protein levels, with homozygotes for the minor allele having significantly reduced levels compared to major allele carriers.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multiomic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: Evidence heightened associations at this locus were observed in relation to PILRA and PILRB proteins, strengthening the argument for genetic impacts on immune modulation in AD.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multiomic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: The missense SNP rs1859788 in PILRA was suggested to have stronger associations within the context of immune regulation and its influence on Alzheimer’s disease risk.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multiomic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: This variant in POT1 was identified in the context of its role in telomere length maintenance, with significant associations observed when conditioning on other sentinel variants.
title: Novel genetic determinants of telomere length from a trans-ethnic analysis of 109,122 whole genome sequences in TOPMed

finding: The rs17228616 SNP, located in the 3'-untranslated region (3'-UTR) of the acetylcholinesterase (AChE) gene, was found to interrupt miR-608's recognition of AChE. Carriers of the minor allele exhibited a reduced blockade of AChE by miR-608, leading to decreased cholinergic tone, elevated blood pressure, increased inflammatory biomarkers, and impaired stress reaction in the prefrontal cortex.
title: Ribosomal protein L24 modulates mammalian microRNA processing and transfer RNA fragment production

finding: The SNP rs58407391 was identified through a genome-wide association study (GWAS) for body mass index (BMI). This SNP resides in the gene NXPH1, which has a prior known association with obesity. While the standard GWAS identified 20 relevant SNPs, the new method (HC-GWAS) identified 45 SNPs in total, including 31 that were novel findings, highlighting the importance of the method in uncovering significant loci for traits like BMI.
title: Non-parametric GWAS: Another View on Genome-wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs13227429, related to the gene BRAF, had a significant association with forced vital capacity (FVC), with a p-value of 5.6×10^-9. This finding also implicated its role in lung cancer genetic variants.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The rs2227983 polymorphism in EGFR was studied and found to relate to breast cancer phenotype.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs1990622 acted as the lead GWAS SNP for frontotemporal lobar degeneration, impacting multiple trans-eQTL genes and showing enrichment for neuron-related processes.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: This SNP also affected KCNA5 in trans, contributing to its association with neuronal functions.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP was associated with trans-eQTLs affecting brain-related traits, especially within the 7p21.3 locus.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The novel SNP rs78821961 associated with the genes STEAP1B and AC002480.5 presented significant findings related to hsCRP levels.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The intergenic SNP rs74987345 was newly identified in the study related to hsCRP levels.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The novel SNP rs80348264 located in TOMM7 gene demonstrated associations with hsCRP levels.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The rs2188580 variant, located upstream of the IL6 gene, showed a strong association with platelet (PLT) count in East Asian (EAS) populations (P=2.8×10^-9), with evidence of positive selection between EAS and European-ancestry (EA) populations, indicating its relevance in hematological traits.
title: Trans-ethnic and ancestry-specific blood-cell genetics in 746,667 individuals from 5 global populations

finding: The SNP rs7794745, linked to autism, showed significant allele frequency differences when comparing Ukrainians to neighboring European populations.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: SNP rs12113269 was associated with TSPAN1, which was implicated in chemoresistance in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, highlighting its potential relevance in treatment responses related to HPV-related malignancies.
title: Spatial analysis of HPV associated cervical intraepithelial neoplastic tissues demonstrate distinct immune signatures associated with cervical cancer progression

finding: The SNP rs17451754 was found to disrupt a transcriptional activator binding site, which impacted the gene expression profile relevant to the Barrett's phenotype.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The risk allele of rs4487645 was positively associated with increased expression of CDCA7L, which in turn influenced DNA methylation levels at 47 CpG sites in a genome-wide context. This association provided insights into the potential role of CDCA7L in the pathogenesis of multiple myeloma.
title: Genome-wide identification of genes regulating DNA methylation using genetic anchors for causal inference

finding: The SNP rs17361667 was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium (r² = 0.7) with the risk variant rs4487645. The genetic instrument for CDCA7L, which included this SNP, was identified as a stronger predictor of CDCA7L expression compared to rs4487645, suggesting its relevance in studying the epigenetic mechanisms involved in multiple myeloma.
title: Genome-wide identification of genes regulating DNA methylation using genetic anchors for causal inference

finding: Similar to rs182677317, the variant rs369849556 was also indicated as conflicting for ciliary dyskinesia and had a high AF (> 1%) in the NyuWa resource, challenging its classification as pathogenic.
title: NyuWa Genome Resource: Deep Whole Genome Sequencing Based Chinese Population Variation Profile and Reference Panel

finding: The intronic polymorphism rs12540874 A>G of the GRB10 gene was associated with high birth weight, suggesting its role in influencing fetal growth through the regulation of signals that affect size at birth.
title: Imprinted Grb10, encoding growth factor receptor bound protein 10, regulates fetal growth independently of the insulin-like growth factor type 1 receptor (Igf1r) and insulin receptor (Insr) genes

finding: The SNP rs1800795 in IL6 was found to be in the top 25 SNPs across all three diseases: Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson disease, and multiple sclerosis, indicating its significant role in the genetic susceptibility to pesticide-induced nervous system diseases.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: The SNP rs1476679 was associated with increased disease risk in late onset Alzheimer's disease due to its impact on CTCF binding and chromatin topology. This finding related to the role of CTCF in regulating genetic elements within TADs, showcasing how alterations in CTCF binding could influence disease susceptibility.
title: Ctcf Haploinsufficiency Mediates Intron Retention in A Tissue-specific Manner

finding: The minority allele and genotype of rs6459797 was associated with lower MMSE scores, a measure of cognitive function, particularly in individuals with fewer years of formal education. This effect highlighted the interaction between genetic factors and educational background, showing that younger individuals with the minority genotype experienced significant reductions in MMSE scores.
title: Human microRNA-153-3p targets specific neuronal genes and is associated with the risk of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs736940 had notable effects on Aβ deposition influenced by age and sex. Specifically, it was found that increasing age led to increased Aβ deposition, and this effect was significantly modulated by the rs736940 genotype in male participants. Moreover, there was evidence suggesting that the 'A' allele might confer a protective effect against Aβ deposition, particularly enhanced by higher levels of formal education.
title: Human microRNA-153-3p targets specific neuronal genes and is associated with the risk of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs12113108 was associated with the regulation of cancer-associated fibroblast (CAF) characteristics, particularly influencing the expression of MCL-1, which relates to the myofibroblastic phenotype in breast cancers. This finding suggested a significant role in tumor microenvironment interactions.
title: Targeting of MCL-1 in breast cancer associated fibroblasts reverses their myofibroblastic phenotype and pro-invasive properties

finding: SNP rs13225710 was identified as promoting colorectal cancer migration and invasion by targeting CFTR and CGN, as shown in the work of Zhang et al. (2021). This result highlighted the role of specific genetic variations in cancer metastasis and provided insights into potential therapeutic targets.
title: Dual role of CASP8AP2/FLASH in regulating epithelial-to-mesenchymal (EMT) plasticity

finding: An association was identified between rs9648854 and CNTNAP2 expression specifically at the defendo stage of differentiation. This association was not observed at earlier stages, indicating stage-specific regulatory effects.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing of differentiating iPS cells reveals dynamic genetic effects on gene expression

finding: The SNP rs9690350 was identified as being mapped to the <italic>PDGFA</italic> gene region, which is associated with pubertal onset. This finding was particularly significant as it linked genetic variation to the timing of puberty, underscoring the genetic mechanisms influencing this developmental process. Furthermore, it was part of a broader analysis of methylation profiles associated with age at menarche and other puberty-related traits.
title: DNA methylation sites in early adulthood characterised by pubertal timing and development: A twin study

finding: The SNP rs11982272 was identified within the ADHD+DBD meta-analysis, achieving a genome-wide significant P-value of 4.38×10^-8 and an odds ratio of 0.83. However, its association suggests a protective effect in the context of the ADHD+DBD phenotype.
title: Identification of risk variants and characterization of the polygenic architecture of disruptive behavior disorders in the context of ADHD

finding: The missense variant rs1799805 in ACHE was associated with a lower number of CPD, with β = -0.76 (SD = 0.19, p = 9.9×10^-5), indicating a potential protective effect on smoking behavior.
title: Gene-Gene interactions and pleiotropy in the brain nicotinic pathway associated with the heaviness and precocity of tobacco smoking among outpatients with multiple substance use disorders

finding: The rs10228066 SNP was identified as a sentinel signal for T2D and co-localized significantly with fasting glucose and hemoglobin A1C. Its mapped connection to beta cell-specific gene DGKB provided insight into glucose metabolism within the context of diabetes.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: The rs10228796 SNP was implicated in the beta cell-specific chromatin connection to the DGKB gene. This interaction was highlighted as crucial for understanding the elevated fasting glucose and hemoglobin A1C levels in T2D.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: The rs2268382 SNP was found to connect to the CPA4 gene specifically in acinar cells, indicating that this T2D risk locus likely functions in the exocrine pancreas, adding a novel insight into T2D risk beyond the traditional insulin-producing beta cells.
title: The three-dimensional chromatin structure of the major human pancreatic cell types reveals lineage-specific regulatory architecture of T2D risk

finding: The SNP rs2107595 was associated with the regulation of HDAC9 transcription via E2F3 and Rb1, as identified in the study. This regulation was significant in the context of peripheral artery disease, suggesting that it may influence the molecular mechanisms contributing to PAD.
title: Paired transcriptomic analyses of atheromatous and control vessels reveal novel autophagy and immunoregulatory genes in peripheral artery disease

finding: The SNP rs1244070394 was characterized by a minor allele count (MAC) of 6 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 5.9e-4 in the CFGP reference panel, while it had a MAC of 3 and a MAF of 1.1e-5 in the TOPMed freeze 8 reference panel. This finding highlighted the SNP's greater rarity in the general population compared to CF patients, leading to improved imputation accuracy using the CFGP panel.
title: Leveraging TOPMed Imputation Server and Constructing a Cohort-Specific Imputation Reference Panel to Enhance Genotype Imputation among Cystic Fibrosis Patients

finding: The SNP rs77284892 had a MAC of 10 in the CFGP data with a MAF of 2.1e-3, while its MAC in the TOPMed was much lower at 3 and a MAF of 1.1e-5. Furthermore, it was noted to be a stop-gain variant with a CADD phred score of 38, classifying it among the most deleterious variants and a known CF-causing variant according to CFTR2.
title: Leveraging TOPMed Imputation Server and Constructing a Cohort-Specific Imputation Reference Panel to Enhance Genotype Imputation among Cystic Fibrosis Patients

finding: The SNP rs893051013 was found to have a Rsq value of 0.80 in the TOPMed reference panel but only 0.29 in the CFGP panel. However, the true imputation R2 for the CFGP panel was 0.94, indicating that despite the metric, the CFGP outperformed TOPMed for this variant in terms of true imputation quality.
title: Leveraging TOPMed Imputation Server and Constructing a Cohort-Specific Imputation Reference Panel to Enhance Genotype Imputation among Cystic Fibrosis Patients

finding: The SNP rs12113332 indicated a potential role in the effectiveness of combining lonidamine with chemotherapy and physical therapy in cancer treatment, as outlined in the 2020 article by Huang et al., which highlighted lonidamine's synergistic effects in cancer therapies.
title: Study on the mechanism of action of the Pt(IV) complex with lonidamine ligands by ultrafast chemical proteomics

finding: The study reported that rs713598, located in the TAS2R38 gene, was a significant marker associated with the supertaster phenotype. This finding was corroborated by a previous study focusing on Canadian young adults, which identified that the frequency of the 49A allele was approximately 55% among Caucasians; the current study found a higher frequency of 59% among individuals of European ancestry.
title: Bitter taste genetics and oral health in Canadian Longitudinal Study on Aging

finding: The variant rs606231231 was identified as deleterious, lying within the ZRS enhancer that regulates the expression of the SHH gene over a long range of 1 Mb. This variant was linked to polydactyly and was experimentally confirmed to alter gene expression in mouse limb.
title: GPN-MSA: an alignment-based DNA language model for genome-wide variant effect prediction

finding: The rs4730673 SNP, which is located near the MDFIC gene, had a significant relationship with the strongest GWAS signal for same-sex sexual behavior, affecting both NEB and childlessness.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies genetic effects on reproductive success and ongoing natural selection at the FADS locus

finding: The rs10261857 SNP was correlated with same-sex sexual behavior and was noted for having a more significant effect on decreasing the likelihood of childlessness.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies genetic effects on reproductive success and ongoing natural selection at the FADS locus

finding: The SNP rs10228407 demonstrated significant association with the down-regulation of TAS2R60 in addition to its role in upregulating EPHB6 and ADGRB3. This SNP was identified in multiple GWAS of Alzheimer's disease, indicating its potential significance in the context of neurodegenerative processes.
title: Genomic Study of Taste Perception Genes in African Americans Reveals SNPs Linked to Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Although originally identified with an incorrect notation, rs11771145 was consistent with associations made for rs117771145, indicating it also played a critical role in down-regulating TAS2R41 while influencing the expression of EPHB6 and ADGRB3 in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genomic Study of Taste Perception Genes in African Americans Reveals SNPs Linked to Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs764282 was previously associated with vocabulary development through meta-GWAS analyses. It was highlighted in this study as having a strong relationship with early-phase expressive vocabulary, being in high linkage disequilibrium with rs9854781, hence indicating its relevance in vocabulary size during infancy.
title: Genomic contributions to infant and toddler vocabulary scores: Implications for association with health-, cognition-, and behaviour-related outcomes

finding: The CARD9 G111S mutation corresponded to the activating CARD11 G123S mutation, which had been previously associated with BENTA disease, indicating a potential pathogenic role in immune regulation.
title: Chimeric and mutant CARD9 constructs enable analyses of conserved and diverged autoinhibition mechanisms in the CARD-CC protein family

finding: The CARD9 G111E variant could be associated with severe effects, being compared to the known pathogenic CARD11 G123D mutation, which resulted in BENTA disease.
title: Chimeric and mutant CARD9 constructs enable analyses of conserved and diverged autoinhibition mechanisms in the CARD-CC protein family

finding: The variant rs705379 was confirmed to have an effect on the expression of Paraoxonase 1 (PON1) in liver tissue, with evidence from luciferase reporter assays and statistical fine-mapping, consistent with predictions made by the BigRNA model.
title: An RNA foundation model enables discovery of disease mechanisms and candidate therapeutics

finding: The variant rs854571 was identified by BigRNA as having a strong expression-modulating effect on PON1, aligning with known expression effects and also demonstrating statistical significance.
title: An RNA foundation model enables discovery of disease mechanisms and candidate therapeutics

finding: The variant rs3735590 was confirmed by BigRNA to have a significant effect on the expression of PON1, supporting its role in expression modulation identified through empirical data.
title: An RNA foundation model enables discovery of disease mechanisms and candidate therapeutics

finding: The variant chr7:95324583:G:A corresponds to rs705379, which was confirmed to influence PON1 expression in liver tissue through experimental verification.
title: An RNA foundation model enables discovery of disease mechanisms and candidate therapeutics

finding: The variant chr7:95325307:T:C is associated with rs854571, which showed a strong modulation effect on PON1 expression, corroborated by BigRNA predictions.
title: An RNA foundation model enables discovery of disease mechanisms and candidate therapeutics

finding: The variant chr7:95298183:G:A is identified with rs3735590, confirming its significant role in modulating PON1 expression, as established by empirical data and BigRNA predictions.
title: An RNA foundation model enables discovery of disease mechanisms and candidate therapeutics

finding: The SNP rs4917014 within the IKZF1 gene was significantly associated with the risk of developing systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). This association highlighted the role of alleles at genetic variants in the IKZF1 gene as expression quantitative trait loci for both the IKZF1 gene and other autoimmunity-related genes.
title: Manipulation of alternative splicing of IKZF1 elicits distinct gene regulatory responses in T cells

finding: rs573901234 was associated with short sleep duration of less than 5 hours with a p-value of 1.4×10^-8. This SNP was located near the gene JHDM1D-AS1.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The SNP rs11760336 was identified within the promoter region of the DNAH11 gene, which is associated with ciliary dyskinesia. It was noted that this SNP likely changed gene expression directly. Furthermore, the SNP was categorized as an allele-specific (AS) single nucleotide variant (SNV) exhibiting consistent AS imbalances correlating with active epigenetic marks (H3K4me3 and H3K27ac). Notably, this SNV was also recognized as a known expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) in the GTEx database, reinforcing its relevance in gene regulation within the context of disease.
title: The EN-TEx resource of multi-tissue personal epigenomes & variant-impact models

finding: The SNP rs34291892, located in the FOXP2 gene on chromosome 7, was found to have a P value of 2.38 × 10^-10 in the UK Biobank cohort for its association with neck or shoulder pain. This SNP was also tested for replication but was not significantly replicated.
title: A genome-wide association study finds genetic variants associated with neck or shoulder pain in UK Biobank

finding: The study provided evidence that high TROP2 expression in colorectal cancer (CRC) correlated with lymph node metastases and poor tumor differentiation, indicating a significant association linked to the variant rs13246177.
title: TROP2 represents a negative prognostic factor in colorectal adenocarcinoma and its expression is associated with features of epithelial-mesenchymal transition and invasiveness

finding: In the context of gene expression regulation, variant rs143664050 had a negative effect on Testin (TES) expression specifically in CD14+ monocytes, while exhibiting a negligible effect in erythroblasts. The alternative allele was linked to a loss of chromatin accessibility in monocytes, which was attributed to the disruption of a binding site for the transcription factor SPI1, which is expressed only in myeloid cells including monocytes.
title: scooby: Modeling multi-modal genomic profiles from DNA sequence at single-cell resolution

finding: The study referenced a single nucleotide polymorphism in the promoter region of the Neuropeptide Y (NPY) gene, specifically rs16147, which was correlated with decreased NPY expression and enhanced anxiety traits in humans. This finding highlighted the importance of NPY in relation to anxiety disorders, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus could influence mental health outcomes.
title: Modulation of Temporoammonic-CA1 Synapses by Neuropeptide Y is Through Y1 Receptors

finding: The SNP rs36036340 was significantly associated between Nuclei_Granularity_9_AGP and the gene PRKAR1B on chromosome 7. It had a MAF of 0.08 and an effect size of 0.38 (SE 0.06) with a P-value of 6×10^-10. Variants in PRKAR1B have been linked to neurodevelopmental disorders and tumorigenesis, suggesting that this SNP could influence cellular morphology through the PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling pathway.
title: High-dimensional phenotyping to define the genetic basis of cellular morphology

finding: The missense variant rs1859788 (p.Arg78Gly) was identified as protective for Alzheimer's disease, indicating its potential role in mitigating this phenotype. The variant is located within the functional immunoglobulin-like domain of the paired immunoglobin-like type 2 receptor alpha (PILRa), which is crucial for immune response and possibly involved in neurodegenerative processes.
title: Pangenome reconstruction in rats enhances genotype-phenotype mapping and novel variant discovery

finding: The variant rs1635852 was identified as a T2D risk allele (T), which disrupts an HNF1 motif while the non-risk allele (C) strengthens it. The study found that deleting the HNF1 motif resulted in significantly decreased enhancer activity at this locus (Wilcoxon rank-sum test p = 0.016). This variant is located in the first intron of the JAZF1 gene, which is involved in the pancreatic beta cell response to metabolic stress.
title: Using a modular massively parallel reporter assay to discover context-specific regulatory grammars in type 2 diabetes

finding: The G894T (rs1799983) polymorphism of the nitric oxide synthase (NOS3) gene was considered a susceptibility biomarker for obesity among Tunisians, according to a study by Nasr et al. in 2016.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: CYP2R1 rs2070744 polymorphism was implicated in the risk for multiple sclerosis, as reported by Agundez et al. in 2020.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs1800795 polymorphism in the Interleukin 6 gene was found to be associated with cardiovascular diseases in a meta-analysis of 74 studies involving 86,229 subjects. This highlighted its potential relevance in the context of metabolic diseases like NAFLD.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs1799889 is associated with the serpine1 (pai-1) 4g/5g insertion/deletion promoter polymorphism, which was highlighted in a systematic review and meta-analysis. This study indicated a link between this genetic variant and pre-eclampsia, thus suggesting its potential role in the condition.
title: PLSKO: a robust knockoff generator to control false discovery rate in omics variable selection

finding: In girls, the genotype at rs73170626 was associated with the expression of the TRBV30 gene during early puberty, but this effect dissipated by late puberty, indicating how genetic influence on immune-related gene expression can diminish with sexual maturation.
title: Analysis of transcriptional changes associated with pubertal development

finding: The rs6842 SNP, which is a synonymous variation in the AGR2 gene, was identified with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.3355. This finding was significant as it represented one of the exceptions among many SNPs in the AGR2 gene that had very low MAFs, highlighting its potential relevance in adenocarcinoma due to its association with the gene's expression.
title: Integrative analysis of genomic and transcriptomic alterations of AGR2 and AGR3 in cancer

finding: The rs55900499 SNP, a synonymous variation in the AGR3 gene, was noted with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.0505, which was considerably higher compared to other SNPs in the AGR3 gene. This finding suggested that it might hold some relevance in the context of cancer features, although its functional implications were not specifically detailed.
title: Integrative analysis of genomic and transcriptomic alterations of AGR2 and AGR3 in cancer

finding: The missense variant rs1859788-A was identified in the PILRA locus, found to be in high linkage disequilibrium (R²=0.85) with the tagging variant and previously demonstrated to alter the ligand binding affinity of PILRA. Conditioning on this variant eliminated the AD GWAS signal at this locus, suggesting its crucial role in AD risk modification.
title: Integration of Alzheimer’s disease genetics and myeloid genomics reveals novel disease risk mechanisms

finding: The rs705866 SNP in PILRB was found to be associated with age-related macular degeneration, disrupting a miRNA binding site, indicating its role in regulating expression through an observed allelic effect.
title: Genome-wide functional screen of 3’UTR variants uncovers causal variants for human disease and evolution

finding: The SNP rs24650 was associated with the tfoY gene in V. natriegens, and it played a role in the modular antibacterial toxin delivery platform developed for studying antibacterial toxins.
title: Engineering a customizable antibacterial T6SS-based platform in Vibrio natriegens

finding: The SNP rs7680 showed a significant association with PTSD (p=4.17×10−8) and was nearest to the gene MAD1L1. It also demonstrated nominal replication with consistent effects in additional studies.
title: Genomic Characterization of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder in a Large US Military Veteran Sample

finding: The rs35364414 SNP corresponded to the R1537C variant of the GLI3 transcription factor, which was found to exhibit variable allele frequencies across modern human populations. It was highest in European populations (3.7%-7.7%) and lowest in African populations (0.8%-2.1%). Research suggested that this SNP was derived from archaic hominins such as Neanderthals and Denisovans, indicating that the variant has been maintained in the genetic background of both archaic and present-day humans.
title: A Neanderthal/Denisovan GLI3 variant contributes to anatomical variations in mice

finding: The SNP rs11771145 was identified from a 2013 GWAS that involved a two-stage meta-analysis of 74,046 individuals of European ancestry, linking it to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: Found in the 2013 GWAS, rs2718058 demonstrated a significant link to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: SNP rs10265001 located between MRPS33 and BRAF indicated associations with SCZ, BIP, ASD, and obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). The region showed interactions with developmental genes crucial for the nervous system.
title: Genome wide meta-analysis identifies genomic relationships, novel loci, and pleiotropic mechanisms across eight psychiatric disorders

finding: There was a significant association reported for this SNP in a study involving both African Americans and Japanese, although the effects were opposite in these populations.
title: How understudied populations have contributed to our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease genetics

finding: Reported significant association in a vascular dementia sub-cohort in a Spanish population raised questions about the variants' effect in AD contexts.
title: How understudied populations have contributed to our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease genetics

finding: The variant rs2405442 in PILRA was reported as exome-wide significant, with a p-value of 1.7 x 10^-7, suggesting a potential link to LOAD.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for involvement of PSEN1 and demonstrates protective role for variants in tyrosine phosphatase genes

finding: The SNP rs11533993 was significantly associated with white blood cell count, showing a p-value of 1.55e-84 and a beta value of -0.0799 in the analysis. This variant was part of the population-enriched associations identified.
title: Low generalizability of polygenic scores in African populations due to genetic and environmental diversity

finding: The SNP rs12113219 was linked to the function of the reovirus rhoNS RNA-binding protein, which is essential for viral genome replication. In vitro studies highlighted that variations at this SNP position correlated with altered oligomeric states of rhoNS, affecting its RNA chaperone activity and potentially influencing reovirus pathogenicity, as discussed in the context of modulating RNA stability during viral infection.
title: Structure of Orthoreovirus RNA Chaperone σNS, a Component of Viral Replication Factories

finding: The SNP rs79197902 was identified as a cis-meQTL that disrupted the binding of transcription factors to their respective binding sites (TFBS), specifically a CTCF binding site. This disruption led to decreased protein affinity and subsequently altered local methylation at nearby CpGs (cg03916490 and cg18402987).
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The SNP rs2013 was associated with variations in the ability to acquire Prefrontal Synthesis (PFS), which is critical for understanding complex language. This SNP was noted in the context of children who exhibited discrepancies in language comprehension, particularly highlighting its impact on neurotypical versus atypically developing children. Individuals with language impairments demonstrated significant deficits in PFS acquisition, with evidence suggesting that genetic variations such as rs2013 could be influential in such developmental outcomes.
title: Novel Linguistic Evaluation of Prefrontal Synthesis (LEPS) test measures prefrontal synthesis acquisition in neurotypical children and predicts high-functioning versus low-functioning class assignment in individuals with autism

finding: The SNP rs148754219 was identified as a functional variant in the Kozak sequence of the GRM3 gene, which was associated with an increased risk of developing schizophrenia, alcohol dependence, and bipolar disorder. This finding highlighted the role of genetic variation in the GRM3 gene as a contributor to cognitive dysfunction related to neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Activating mGlu3 metabotropic glutamate receptors rescues schizophrenia-like cognitive deficits through metaplastic adaptations within the hippocampus

finding: The non-synonymous SNP rs1128501 was classified as deleterious. It resulted in the mutation of Glycine into Valine at position 185, confirmed by multiple tools including PANTHER and PROVEAN.
title: In Silico Screening and Analysis of SNPs in Human ABCB1 (MDR1) Gene

finding: The non-synonymous SNP rs28381902 was classified as deleterious, changing Glutamic Acid into Lysine at position 566. The damaging effect was confirmed by multiple prediction tools.
title: In Silico Screening and Analysis of SNPs in Human ABCB1 (MDR1) Gene

finding: The non-synonymous SNP rs9282565 was found to be deleterious based on predictions from PhD-SNP and SNAP, altering Alanine into Glutamic Acid at position 80.
title: In Silico Screening and Analysis of SNPs in Human ABCB1 (MDR1) Gene

finding: The SNP rs10229703 was found to be associated with HFpEF, located 5 Kb from CALD1, which is important for muscle contraction and linked to pulmonary hypertension.
title: Biological Pathways and Gene Networks Link Inflammation and Vascular Remodeling to Both Heart Failure with Preserved and Reduced Ejection Fraction in Women across Ethnicities

finding: The SNP rs12719020 was associated with HFrEF, located upstream of COBL, a gene related to vasculitis and type 1 diabetes, highlighting its relevance in heart failure pathology.
title: Biological Pathways and Gene Networks Link Inflammation and Vascular Remodeling to Both Heart Failure with Preserved and Reduced Ejection Fraction in Women across Ethnicities

finding: The intergenic SNP rs7809615 was correlated with the levels of androsterone sulfate and 4-androsten-3beta,17beta-diol disulfate 2. It was linked to the eGenes CYP3A5 and CYP3A7, which are cytochrome P450 enzymes involved in the metabolism of steroids. Despite the absence of literature directly supporting this relationship, findings indicated regulatory links to steroid metabolism.
title: Reconstructing the blood metabolome and genotype using long-range chromatin interactions

finding: The SNP rs856554 was statistically significant (p-value 3.89e-8) and was associated with the total editing rate in human blood, specifically linked to the lincRNA gene LOC730338. This association persisted even after accounting for blood cell composition, albeit at a reduced level. While rs856554 significantly affected the overall editing level, it did not show a significant correlation with the expression of ADAR or ADARB1.
title: Genome-wide analysis of consistently RNA edited sites in human blood reveals interactions with mRNA processing genes and suggests correlations with cell types and biological variables

finding: The SNP rs6967330[A] was identified as a causal variant for early childhood asthma with severe exacerbations. It was associated with increased CDHR3 protein surface expression, which in turn heightened the risk of respiratory tract illness, specifically linked to RV-C infection, while no such association was found for other respiratory viruses.
title: Rhinovirus C replication is associated with the endoplasmic reticulum and triggers cytopathic effects in an in vitro model of human airway epithelium

finding: The GRB10 rs1800504 polymorphism was linked to an increased risk of coronary heart disease in type 2 diabetes patients, establishing it as a significant genetic factor in cardiovascular disease.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs4385425's CRISPR-Cas9 targeting resulted in the induced expression of the IKZF1 gene, suggesting its role as a regulatory element within the context of SLE.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: The polymorphism rs1800504 in the GRB10 gene was linked to an increased risk of coronary heart disease in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus, showcasing its importance in metabolic and cardiovascular disorders.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The SNP rs3735018 demonstrated increasing effect sizes towards urban residents and exhibited heterogeneity due to both urban status and ancestry.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs39451, located in the promoter region of KCS4, was shown to have significant LD with the non-synonymous SNP m11503 and other associated SNPs. This indicated a potential role in the transcriptional regulation of KCS4, influencing the expression of traits related to lipid metabolism under stress.
title: Hello darkness, my old friend: 3-Ketoacyl-Coenzyme A Synthase4 is a branch point in the regulation of triacylglycerol synthesis in Arabidopsis thaliana

finding: The rs6943555 SNP in the AUTS2 gene was associated with an increased risk of schizophrenia in a study of male patients from a Turkish population. This finding suggested a relationship between the AUTS2 gene and the phenotype of schizophrenia, confirming AUTS2's role in neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: AUTS2 expression within mammalian lineage: a predictor of neural networks involved in Autism Spectrum Disorders

finding: The SNP rs149867961 was found within the PON3 gene as a regulatory variant that contributed to a cis-RV-pQTL. It was associated with decreased PON3 protein levels, and had a significant p-value of 7.58x10^-23.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs772677677 was identified as a missense variant in PON3, contributing to decreased protein levels. Its frequency was significantly higher in the MANOLIS cohort compared to gnomAD and it had a strong association with PON3 levels (p=3.15x10^-24).
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs10275045 was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with a duplicated segment located on chromosome 7, adjacent to the MAD1L1 gene. This duplication was linked to one of the strongest GWAS signals associated with schizophrenia. Furthermore, rs10275045 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the FTSJ2 gene in GTEx v7, suggesting a regulatory role in gene expression.
title: Insights into dispersed duplications and complex structural mutations from whole genome sequencing 706 families

finding: The finding related to the SNP rs3173615 indicated that the parental WIBR3 cell line was heterozygous for the variant TMEM106B p.T185S. This variant was noted as a modifier for frontotemporal dementia, providing significant context in the study of neurodegenerative diseases, including its relevance to Alzheimer's disease.
title: iSCORE-PD: an isogenic stem cell collection to research Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The frontotemporal dementia variant TMEM106B (rs3173615) was screened for its role in relation to neurodegenerative diseases but did not present as causative in the assessed lines.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The SNP rs12113099 was found to be significantly associated with the regulation of cancer immunity through its involvement in the mechanisms influenced by Transforming Growth Factor-beta (TGF-β). The detailed findings indicated that this SNP may play a role in modifying the immune response in cancer, highlighting its potential as a target for therapeutic interventions.
title: Fluorescent Chiral Quantum Dots to Unveil Origin-Dependent Exosome Uptake and Cargo Release

finding: The lead SNP rs2944833 produced significant SMR colocalization for the CALN1 gene, which plays a crucial role in neuronal physiology, and was previously associated with educational attainment, intelligence, cognitive function, and schizophrenia, suggesting the ability of CC-GWAS to enhance detection of genetic associations.
title: Identifying loci with different allele frequencies among cases of eight psychiatric disorders using CC-GWAS

finding: This SNP showed differential parental effects on the lymphocyte-neutrophil ratio and was linked to HDL cholesterol and apolipoprotein A.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was associated with leg impedance, reflecting a maternal effect relevant to body fat and muscle mass, consistent with its known imprinting.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: Variant rs1990621 located in the TMEM106B gene region was significantly associated with increased neuronal proportion (p=6.40×10−07). This association was replicated in an independent dataset, showing even stronger significance in meta-analyses (p=9.42×10−09 and p=7.66×10−10). The minor allele G of rs1990621 was linked with increased neuronal proportion across neurodegenerative cohorts but not in younger schizophrenia cohorts.
title: The TMEM106B rs1990621 protective variant is also associated with increased neuronal proportion

finding: Variant rs1990622, also within the TMEM106B region and in high linkage disequilibrium with rs1990621 (r²=0.98), was previously identified as a protective variant in frontotemporal degeneration (FTD) cohorts. Its association with neuronal protection supported the findings observed for rs1990621 concerning neuronal proportion.
title: The TMEM106B rs1990621 protective variant is also associated with increased neuronal proportion

finding: The SNP rs62475261 was included in the FDA5 PRS, contributing to significant findings on weight gain. It was located upstream of HIP1 and downstream of RHBDD2, both connected to obesity-related traits.
title: Polygenic risk score based on weight gain trajectories is predictive of childhood obesity

finding: The polymorphism rs2268574 in the Glucokinase gene was associated with gestational diabetes mellitus, further linking this gene to the genetic predisposition for GDM.
title: Genome-Wide Polygenic Risk Scores and Prediction of Gestational Diabetes in South Asian Women

finding: The SNP rs12113385 was associated with the metastatic process, where evidence was found suggesting that it may play a role in how metastatic cells escape immune surveillance, correlating with the findings on cancer progression and immune interaction discussed in Schaller and Agudo's work.
title: Evidence that metastases arise de novo as new cancers from cells of target organs

finding: The SNP rs12707117 was identified as the most significantly associated variant with the Common EF (cEF) factor, showing a beta value of -0.012 and a p-value of 2.1e-26. It functioned as an expression Quantitative Trait Loci (eQTL) in cerebellar tissue, mapping to the gene EXOC4, indicating its relevance in cognitive processes related to EF.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Over 427,000 Individuals Establishes Executive Functioning as a Neurocognitive Basis of Psychiatric Disorders Influenced by GABAergic Processes

finding: Identified as a peak SNP for multiple myeloma, it disrupted PAX5 binding motifs, providing insights into B cell pathogenesis.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The variant rs17876162 was linked to PON2 and associated with cognitive functions while modulating HDL and glucose levels in analysis settings.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The synonymous variant in <italic>PTPN18</italic> was associated with episodic memory, demonstrating its regulatory role in multiple brain regions.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The study by Su et al. (2016) indicated that the MAD1L1 gene polymorphism rs12666575 was genetically associated with schizophrenia susceptibility in a Chinese population, suggesting its relevance to schizophrenia etiology.
title: DPYSL2/CRMP2 isoform B knockout in human iPSC-derived glutamatergic neurons confirms its role in mTOR signaling and neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The research conducted by Sun et al. (2020) found an association between MAD1L1 polymorphism rs871925 and prenatal famine exposure, alongside its correlation with schizophrenia, highlighting this SNP's involvement in schizophrenia risk.
title: DPYSL2/CRMP2 isoform B knockout in human iPSC-derived glutamatergic neurons confirms its role in mTOR signaling and neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: Located within AZGP1P1, this SNP showed interactions with ZCWPW1, a region containing important functional AD genes. AZGP1P1 is a pseudogene relevant to lipid metabolism, and altered levels of its functional counterpart AZGP1 have been found in Alzheimer's patient serum.
title: S-BEAM: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Showed interactions with FBXO24 and PCOLCE-AS1, both involved in protein regulation and implicated in Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: S-BEAM: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: SNP rs13225638 was implicated in the dysregulation of microtubule nucleating proteins in cancer cells according to Draber and Draberova (2021). This dysregulation contributed to errors of chromosome alignment and increased rates of CIN, further emphasizing the role of this SNP in breast cancer progression.
title: A characterization of mitotic and centrosomal defects in a continuum model of Breast Cancer

finding: The analysis for bipolar disorder (BIP) revealed that rs76350051, found on chromosome 7, had a MAF of 0.0004, an Info of 0.04, and a significant p-value of 2.47 * 10<sup>-37</sup>, reinforcing its association with bipolar disorder.
title: DISTMIX2: robust imputation of summary statistics for cosmopolitan cohorts using a large and diverse reference panel

finding: At <italic>MAD1L1</italic>, the missense variant rs1801368 was part of a cluster of five SNPs in near-perfect linkage disequilibrium. It associated with chromosome 15 gain events (OR=1.61, p=6.9 x10⁻²³) and was replicated in the UK population, suggesting its role in increasing the risk of abnormal chromosome segregation during mitosis.
title: The genomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in Japan

finding: The SNP rs713598 was identified as being associated with G or C alleles, or as G/C heterozygous variants in individuals. The study employed a single base pair mismatch strategy using the FELUDA diagnostic approach, which successfully differentiated individuals based on their genotypes for this SNP. Specifically, the findings showed negligible cleavage with the G variant, maximal cleavage with the C variant, and intermediate cleavage with the G/C variant, indicating the potential for precise zygosity inference related to sensory responsiveness and food preferences.
title: Rapid, field-deployable nucleobase detection and identification using FnCas9

finding: The SNP rs13235998 was originally associated with the involvement of stromal cells in promoting matrix deposition and remodeling, indicating its relevance in tissue regeneration and repair mechanisms, particularly in pathological contexts such as cancer and potentially in osteoarthritis. It highlighted the role of stromal interactions in modifying the tumor microenvironment, which could parallel mechanisms observed in MSC therapy and extracellular vesicle influence in joint homeostasis.
title: Temporal Extracellular Vesicle Protein Changes following Intraarticular Treatment with Integrin α10β1-selected Mesenchymal Stem Cells in Equine Osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs143118835 on chromosome 7 was identified as associated with the forceps major concerning white matter tract FA.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: The R38W variant of cytochrome c, originally reported as the low frequency SNP rs11548791 (p.Arg39Trp), was investigated for its effects on peroxidase activity. While hypothesized to decrease activity due to structural changes, the findings revealed an unexpected increase in peroxidase activity to approximately 60 M^-1s^-1, indicating that the Arg38 sidechain may not control substrate access as initially thought.
title: Altered structure and dynamics of pathogenic cytochrome c variants correlate with increased apoptotic activity

finding: The ABCB1 rs1045642 polymorphism influenced both efficacy and safety in the context of hypertension medication, linking pharmacogenomics to possible kidney outcomes.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The genetic variants CYP2J2 rs2280275 and EPHX2 rs751141 were assessed for their risk in diabetic nephropathy, implicating them in kidney disease susceptibility.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The variant rs2233580 was associated with T2D, specifically at the PAX4 locus. It had a risk allele frequency of 8.6% and a reported odds ratio of 1.31, indicating an increased risk for type 2 diabetes in East Asian populations.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: Similar to rs2233580, rs3824004 was also located at the PAX4 locus, where it was found to have a risk allele frequency of 3.4% and influenced T2D risk with an odds ratio of 1.23.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: Linked to Lactobacillus acidophilus, this SNP was also replicated at nominal significance, supporting earlier findings.
title: Inter-determination of blood metabolite levels and gut microbiome supported by Mendelian randomization

finding: The study by Medina-Gomez et al. identified rs7801723 as the most significantly associated SNP found in the intronic region of CPED1 that was strongly associated with skull bone mineral density (BMD), indicating its influence on this phenotype.
title: Loss of cped1 does not affect bone and lean mass in zebrafish

finding: Bonfante et al. discovered that rs6950680, a single nucleotide variant in the intronic region of CPED1, was associated with 'jaw protrusion' in a study focused on craniofacial morphology in a Latin American population, highlighting its relevance to this trait.
title: Loss of cped1 does not affect bone and lean mass in zebrafish

finding: This SNP was identified as a trans-eQTL associated with the gene RPL8, indicating its potential role in gene regulation associated with immune response.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SERPINE1 variant rs6092 was associated with T2DM susceptibility and metabolic traits, underscoring its role in the disease's pathophysiology.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs12705986 was located near the gene FOXP2 and satisfied criteria for linkage disequilibrium (LD), as well as belonging to the fine-mapping credible set. It fell within a peak specific to the inhibitory neuron subtype Inh-PDYN. Moreover, it was also located near another peak specific to Inh-MEF2C, suggesting potential relevance in chronic pain pathways.
title: Spatial, transcriptomic and epigenomic analyses link dorsal horn neurons to chronic pain genetic predisposition

finding: The SNP rs11760336 was associated with the DNAH11 gene, which is linked to ciliary dyskinesia. It was located within the promoter region of DNAH11 and was identified to have an effect on gene expression. The analysis noted allele-specific (AS) methylation patterns in the promoter that were inversely related to AS expression and chromatin states in the gene body, suggesting transcriptional downregulation. Furthermore, this SNP was also recognized as belonging to the category of expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs) within the GTEx database, indicating its significance in influencing gene expression in specific tissues.
title: Multi-tissue integrative analysis of personal epigenomes

finding: The IRF5 polymorphism (rs10488631) was also found to be associated with seropositivity in rheumatoid arthritis (RA). This indicates that this SNP might play a role in the pathogenesis of RA by influencing the immune response as reflected in seropositivity.
title: Utilizing a PTPN22 gene signature to predict response to targeted therapies in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The T allele of rs56980069 was associated with increased chromatin accessibility in progenitors and served as a neuroticism risk allele, disrupting ZNF713 binding, which suggested changes in chromatin accessibility.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The SNP rs4487645 was identified as a causal variant for myeloma risk using FCNsignal, demonstrating the framework's capability to pinpoint causal SNPs from LD groups.
title: Base-resolution prediction of transcription factor binding signals by a deep learning framework

finding: The variant rs143664050 was found to have a negative effect on Testin (TES) expression specifically in CD14+ monocytes, while exhibiting a negligible effect in erythroblasts. This eQTL was associated with a predicted loss of an accessible region in monocytes, which elucidated the reduction in TES expression. Additionally, it was revealed that this variant disrupted a predicted binding site for the transcription factor SPI1, which is only expressed in myeloid cells, thus explaining the cell-type specificity of this eQTL's effect.
title: scooby: Modeling multi-modal genomic profiles from DNA sequence at single-cell resolution

finding: The rs2366739 SNP was identified as a critical eQTL for CD36 expression, significantly associated with lower CD36 mRNA levels in the C allele. Deletion of the locus containing this variant led to approximately 14 times greater expression of CD36. Its clinical relevance was reinforced by associations with platelet volume and count identified through GWAS.
title: Identification of functional variants for platelet CD36 expression by Massively Parallel Reporter Assay

finding: Similar to rs2366739, rs1194196 was confirmed to alter transcriptional regulation of CD36. The presence of the alternate allele increased transcriptional activity in cells when tested alongside rs2366739, indicating that both SNPs closely regulate gene expression within the same locus.
title: Identification of functional variants for platelet CD36 expression by Massively Parallel Reporter Assay

finding: This SNP was associated with transcriptional regulation of CD36, confirmed through MPRA analysis, although specific details of its impacts were less emphasized compared to rs2366739 and rs1194196.
title: Identification of functional variants for platelet CD36 expression by Massively Parallel Reporter Assay

finding: This SNP was associated with CD36 transcriptional activity and showed clear functional implications when tested, being among the most significant identified variants.
title: Identification of functional variants for platelet CD36 expression by Massively Parallel Reporter Assay

finding: In the context of eQTL analysis, this SNP demonstrated significance in regulating CD36 levels and contributed to the findings related to platelet traits.
title: Identification of functional variants for platelet CD36 expression by Massively Parallel Reporter Assay

finding: Detected as a significant hit in the Bayesian analysis of MPRA, rs1093833 was associated with modulation of CD36 expression along with other variants.
title: Identification of functional variants for platelet CD36 expression by Massively Parallel Reporter Assay

finding: Confirmed to have effects on transcriptional activity in beta cells, building on prior associations with T2D through both MPRA and chromatin accessibility analyses.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: As a newly nominated putative causal variant based on significant effects observed on transcriptional activity in beta cells.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The rs38875 marker was associated with resistance to three Pt races (PFTTT, PDKTT, and PDTRR) and represents a common QTL controlling these resistances.
title: Identification of novel leaf rust seedling resistance loci in Iranian bread wheat germplasm using genome-wide association mapping

finding: The SNP rs111931861, an intronic variant in the KMT2E gene, was identified with a minor allele frequency of 0.034 and reached genome-wide significance in a recent GWAS for autism spectrum disorder (ASD). This established a significant link between this SNP and the risk of ASD.
title: Local genetic correlation analysis reveals heterogeneous etiologic sharing of complex traits

finding: The rs75039782 SNP in the 22nd intron of the CFTR gene caused the generation of a new donor GT site, which resulted in the inclusion of a pseudo-exon that contained a premature stop codon. This mutation produced a stronger hexamer than the canonical donor, which enabled the usage of an upstream acceptor site in conjunction with the canonical donor, thus contributing to CFTR deficiency and cystic fibrosis.
title: A basic framework governing splice-site choice in eukaryotes

finding: The polymorphism rs730437 of the EGFR gene was reported to be possibly associated with susceptibility to Parkinson's Disease (PD). This finding implied that genetic variants in the EGFR signaling pathway could play a significant role in the pathology related to dopamine neuron cell death, particularly in the context of neurodegenerative diseases.
title: UBL3 Interacts with Alpha-synuclein in Cells and the Interaction is Downregulated by the EGFR Pathway Inhibitor Osimertinib

finding: The polymorphism rs11506105 of the EGFR gene was indicated to be possibly associated with susceptibility to Parkinson's Disease (PD). This association suggested that variations in the EGFR gene might influence the pathway involved in dopamine neuronal survival and the progression of neurodegenerative disorders.
title: UBL3 Interacts with Alpha-synuclein in Cells and the Interaction is Downregulated by the EGFR Pathway Inhibitor Osimertinib

finding: SNP rs1392800372, likely linked to GNA12, was associated with mode 11_62, relating to ventricle volume. It was relevant to the migration of neurons in the developing brain.
title: Brain aging comprises many modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The lead SNP rs3801383 exhibited a strong genetic association with mode 1_62 and was linked to FAM3C, which has associations with bone density and Alzheimer’s disease impact on brain amyloid.
title: Brain aging comprises many modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The variant rs2971670 was confirmed as associated with HbA1c, primarily observed in both European and African-American populations, reaffirming its role as part of previously identified loci influencing HbA1c.
title: Impact of rare and common genetic variants on diabetes diagnosis by hemoglobin A1c in multi-ancestry cohorts: The Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine Program

finding: The SNP rs4607517 was confirmed as part of the GCK locus associated with HbA1c, highlighting its relevance across ethnic groups, particularly in individuals of European and African ancestry.
title: Impact of rare and common genetic variants on diabetes diagnosis by hemoglobin A1c in multi-ancestry cohorts: The Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine Program

finding: The variant rs6961094 was deemed one of the best candidates based on scoring approaches. It was shown to be part of a risk-haplotype involved in chromatin looping between several promoters.
title: DSNetwork: An integrative approach to visualize predictions of variants’ deleteriousness

finding: The variant rs71559437 was identified as a credible candidate among CRVs based on scoring results and was part of a risk-haplotype associated with chromatin looping.
title: DSNetwork: An integrative approach to visualize predictions of variants’ deleteriousness

finding: In a genome-wide association study (GWAS), the variant rs756747-T of the Reelin gene was associated with a higher likelihood of alcohol consumption, with a significance level of P = 4 x 10^-9. This finding supports the hypothesis that impairment in Reelin signaling may contribute to addiction traits by disrupting inhibitory control.
title: Reelin deficiency contributes to long-term behavioral abnormalities induced by chronic adolescent exposure to Δ9-tetrahydrocannabinol in mice

finding: The SNP rs13236036 was found to be associated with improved survival outcomes in prostate cancer patients as indicated by a proteomic analysis highlighting ndufs1 and atp5o as novel markers. This finding suggested that variations at this locus may influence the mRNA expression levels of GP130, which correlated with better recurrence-free survival.
title: Cell-autonomous GP130 activation suppresses prostate cancer development via STAT3/ARF/p53-driven senescence and confers an immune-active tumor microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs10486567 was previously found to significantly associate with HIBADH expression in prostate tumor tissue and with TAX1BP1 expression in normal prostate tissue. This association was explained by the observation that both genes, along with the SNP, were located within the same TAD, with Hi-C data showing considerable contact in this region.
title: epiTAD: a web application for visualizing high throughput chromosome conformation capture data in the context of genetic epidemiology

finding: The rs10486567 SNP was linked to prostate cancer susceptibility through long-range chromatin interactions with regulatory elements including the promoter region of a specific gene.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: This SNP was noted as Tier-1 for HOXA11, suggesting a potential regulatory role in post-transcriptional control mechanisms relevant to obesity.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: The SNP rs12113166 was positively associated with the functionality of the CREB transcription factor, which was highlighted in the context of cancer differentiation and therapy. The findings indicated that variants in this SNP could influence the expression and activity of CREB isoforms, thereby impacting gene regulatory networks involved in cancer progression. This relationship underscored the importance of understanding the role of specific SNPs within the framework of transcription factor isoforms in cancer therapies.
title: Widespread variation in molecular interactions and regulatory properties among transcription factor isoforms

finding: Located at the PSV site, this variant was homozygous in the variant calls aligned with DuploMap and was supported by 10X Genomics variant calls but was absent from the short-read variant calls. It illustrated the impact of PSVs on variant detection.
title: Sensitive alignment using paralogous sequence variants improves long read mapping and variant calling in segmental duplications

finding: This heterozygous variant was located near chr7:5972749 and identified in the calls based on PacBio CCS reads aligned with DuploMap, showcasing its presence where short-read data failed.
title: Sensitive alignment using paralogous sequence variants improves long read mapping and variant calling in segmental duplications

finding: The SNP rs80338720 in gene SLC25A13 was associated with citrin deficiency, showing 2.4 times higher allele frequencies in the Vietnamese cohort compared to East Asia, resulting in a carrier frequency of 3% (1 in 33).
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: SNP rs6945636 was associated with co-expression QTLs regulating the gene ZFAND2A, which were specific to pathogen stimulation after 24 hours, linking its function to the heat-shock protein response.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: Similar to rs715188378, this SNP was also identified as being in high linkage disequilibrium with known HSF1 binding sites, implying a role in the heat-shock protein response.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: This SNP was noted to be in nearly perfect linkage disequilibrium with binding sites for HSF1, indicating regulatory interactions with ZFAND2A in response to thermal stress.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: At the CFTR locus, the variant rs7795896 was linked to an enhancer specific to ductal cells and demonstrated reduced transcription factor binding and enhancer activity, leading to decreased CFTR expression, which increased risk for type 1 diabetes (T1D). This finding additionally correlated with increased susceptibility to pancreatic diseases like pancreatitis and pancreatic cancer.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs12113437 was associated with the response to nelfinavir treatment in high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC) cells. The study indicated that cells harboring this SNP showed varying degrees of sensitivity to nelfinavir, impacting cell viability and apoptotic responses.
title: Nelfinavir induces cytotoxicity towards high-grade serous ovarian cancer cells regardless of platinum sensitivity, involving induction of the unfolded protein response, modulation of protein synthesis, DNA damage, lysosomal impairment, and potentiation of toxicity caused by proteasome inhibition

finding: The SNP rs17855988 was identified as a missense variant in the elastin gene (ELN). It has been associated with facial aging and was suggested to have implications for retinal ganglion cell biology, potentially serving as a drug repositioning candidate. The expression of ELN in the sclera is notably dense around the optic nerve head, with high levels also observed in exfoliation glaucoma lenses. This finding connects rs17855988 to the broader context of VCDR, emphasizing its relevance to glaucoma and other optic nerve head parameters.
