title: Automated AI labelling of optic nerve head enables new insights into cross-ancestry glaucoma risk and genetic discovery in over 280,000 images from the UK Biobank and Canadian Longitudinal Study on Aging

finding: The A allele of the PGx variant (rs1045642) in the ATP Binding Cassette Subfamily B Member 1 (ABCB1) gene was associated with a decreased fentanyl opioid dose requirement. Patients with either the AA or GA genotype metabolized fentanyl slower than those with the GG genotype, leading to the need for a lower dosage. The variant was more common in White individuals, with an odds ratio of 3.3 indicating stronger association.
title: Population structure and pharmacogenomic risk stratification in the United States

finding: The PGx variant (rs6977820) in the Dipeptidyl Peptidase Like 6 (DPP) gene was linked to an adverse reaction to antipsychotic drugs, particularly tardive dyskinesia in schizophrenia patients. This T allele was positively correlated with African ancestry, and the majority of variation was found within the Black SIRE group. The odds ratio for the risk allele presence was high at 7.7, indicating a significantly elevated risk for Black individuals.
title: Population structure and pharmacogenomic risk stratification in the United States

finding: The missense variant rs1859788 (p.G78R) in PILRA was identified as the lead cis-pQTL for the Paired immunoglobulin-like type 2 receptor alpha for the Olink measure, showing a beta coefficient of -0.74 (p<3.48x10^-29). Positive associations were found with two SOMAmer reagents targeting soluble isoforms of the same protein, suggesting that the A-allele was protective for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The SNP rs12111903 had a positive and original finding related to the estimation of insect mass based on radar cross-section parameters, as described in the publication by Hu et al. (2020). This study employed a support vector regression algorithm for mass estimation, indicating the relevance of genetic loci like rs12111903 in understanding body size estimation in insects such as leaf-cutter ants.
title: WOLO : Wilson Only Looks Once – Estimating ant body mass from reference-free images using deep convolutional neural networks

finding: The original study reported SPDYE3 as the closest gene for rs7384878. The new analysis identified significant eQTLs in blood linked with the gene PILRB, indicating a divergence in gene annotation.
title: snpXplorer: a web application to explore human SNP-associations and annotate SNP-sets

finding: The study identified a significant association between the DNA marker rs1842993 and the risk of cardioembolic stroke specifically in the Slavic population. This finding was deemed original and implied the marker's relevance in understanding genetic predisposition to ischemic stroke.
title: Object-Attribute Biclustering for Elimination of Missing Genotypes in Ischemic Stroke Genome-Wide Data

finding: The rs2854746 SNP was strongly associated with total IGFBP-3 and IGF-II serum levels and was linked with sitting height ratio (SHR) with a p-value of 3.8x10^-69. Although it was also associated with height (p-value of 5.0x10^-12), the association with SHR was much stronger and distinct from height associations.
title: Protein QTL analysis of IGF-I and its binding proteins provides insights into growth biology

finding: The SNP rs80338720 in gene SLC25A13 was found to have allele frequencies 2.4 times higher in the Vietnamese compared to the East Asia population, contributing to a carrier frequency of 3% (1 in 33) for citrin deficiency.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs13225599 was related to oncogenic signaling and immune response pathways during the bladder pathology associated with <italic>S. haematobium</italic> infection. Its association with drug resistance mechanisms highlights its relevance to understanding treatment challenges in bladder cancer.
title: RNA-seq gene expression profiling of the bladder in a mouse model of urogenital schistosomiasis

finding: Research involving the SNP rs12113221 indicated its connection to the increased production of acute phase reactants by skeletal muscle during cancer cachexia, marking it as a relevant genetic variant in cachexia-related muscle wasting.
title: Haptoglobin and glutamine synthetase may biomark cachexia induced by anti-acute myeloid leukemia chemotherapy

finding: The SNP rs75401036 was identified as a genome-wide significant pQTL for MUC5AC protein concentration, suggesting a common genetic variant that influences mucin levels associated with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) phenotypes.
title: Genetic Regulators of Sputum Mucin Concentration and Their Associations with COPD Phenotypes

finding: The rs10954213 variant was associated with a higher prevalence of the short isoform of the IRF5 transcription factor, linked to an increased risk of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). The variant resulted in higher IRF5 expression, potentially due to the loss of AU-rich elements in the short transcript isoform. Furthermore, it was confirmed through RNA-Seq analysis that this variant affected IRF5 alternative polyadenylation regulation in SLE patients.
title: The genetic determinants of the relative expression of alternative 3’UTR isoforms in human

finding: Similar to rs13407913, this SNP was associated with more than 5 CpGs in the gene body of GNA12, further supporting its involvement in IBD-associated pathways.
title: Methylation Quantitative Trait Loci are Largely Consistent across Disease States in Crohn’s disease

finding: The SNP rs12113431 was found to be associated with the expression levels of CPT1A, which was significantly downregulated in colorectal cancer (CRC) tissues. The study indicated that higher expression of CPT1A correlated with enhanced radiosensitivity due to its role in managing reactive oxygen species (ROS) and influencing the FOXM1-mediated antioxidant response. Therefore, rs12113431 could serve as a potential marker for predicting radiosensitivity in CRC patients undergoing radiotherapy.
title: CPT1A Mediates Radiation Sensitivity in Colorectal Cancer

finding: The SNP rs1997243 was identified as the disease-causing variant in locus 7p22, strongly associated with hypercholesterolemia. The risk allele of rs1997243 was shown to increase the expression of the gene GPR146, which is crucial in regulating blood cholesterol levels in both humans and mice. This variant also increased promoter activity but did not change enhancer activity in transfected cells.
title: Hypercholesterolemia risk associated GPR146 is an orphan G-protein coupled receptor that regulates blood cholesterol level in human and mouse

finding: The rs75639044 SNP located near COG5 significantly influenced sleep duration and was associated with decreased COG5 expression in the spinal cord.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies common genetic variants for self-reported sleep duration and shared genetic effects

finding: The rs1978085, a SNP in strong LD with rs75639044 (COG5), was associated with more frequent napping and exhibited significant statistical relevance.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies common genetic variants for self-reported sleep duration and shared genetic effects

finding: The SNP rs1859788, which was identified as a missense variant (p.Arg78Gly) located in the immunoglobulin-like domain of the Pilrb1l1 gene, was reported to have a protective association with Alzheimer's disease. This finding highlighted the potential function of Pilrb1l1 in myeloid cell movement and its influence on TNF-α levels, which are implicated in insulin regulation and glucose metabolism. Additionally, this SNP was located near a mapped QTL (Iddm2) that was associated with hyperglycemia and increased susceptibility to autoimmune disorders.
title: Pangenome reconstruction in rats enhances genotype-phenotype mapping and novel variant discovery

finding: The SNP rs17605251 was found to be associated with severe obesity (defined as a BMI of 35 kg/m² or greater). This association suggested a significant role for NAPE-PLD in regulating energy homeostasis and food-motivated behaviors, particularly in the context of metabolic disorders.
title: NAPE-PLD in the ventral tegmental area regulates reward events, feeding and energy homeostasis

finding: The SNP rs3801387, located near the WNT16 gene, was associated with bone mineral density (BMD). This finding was highlighted in the context of it working independently in conjunction with other variants at the CPED1-WNT16 locus to exert its effects on bone and muscle traits. It was demonstrated that WNT16 plays a critical role in bone and muscle morphology by influencing their development.
title: wnt16 regulates spine and muscle morphogenesis through parallel signals from notochord and dermomyotome

finding: The SNP rs13245690, located near the CPED1 gene, was also found to be independently associated with bone mineral density (BMD). Similar to rs3801387, it was indicated that this SNP contributes to the dynamics of the CPED1-WNT16 locus, potentially influencing lean mass and morphology through its distinct regulatory elements.
title: wnt16 regulates spine and muscle morphogenesis through parallel signals from notochord and dermomyotome

finding: The SNP rs13225726 was associated with the progression of epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT) in cancer and demonstrated a correlation with the acquisition of cancer stem cell traits. Specifically, it was found to influence cell-cell signaling networks during EMT, facilitating changes in cell motility and invasiveness, similar to the observed effects in FAT1 KO cells promoting non-mutated cell migration.
title: Deletion of FAT1 in hybrid EMT cells stimulates the migration of neighboring non-mutant cells through secretion of extracellular vesicles

finding: The SNP rs13227429 in the BRAF gene exhibited a significant association with FVC (p=5.6×10^{-9}), highlighting its relevance to lung function and its mutation role in lung cancer.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs10254825 was found to interact with age regarding bone mineral density (BMD). The vQTL effect was exceptionally strong (p-value < 2.0×10−45), and there was also a significant GEI effect reported associated with age (p-value < 1.2×10−7), confirming its relevance in BMD variation across different age groups.
title: Genotype-by-environment interactions inferred from genetic effects on phenotypic variability in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2304376 was consistently associated with CHCHD2 expression, where the A allele was linked to lower expression compared to the G allele, supporting its role as an eQTL.
title: Village in a dish: a model system for population-scale hiPSC studies

finding: The SNP rs2108852 showed a strong association with higher expression of RARRES2 in the pluripotent quintile of hiPSCs, with the alternative C allele linked to this increased expression, consistent with previous reports.
title: Village in a dish: a model system for population-scale hiPSC studies

finding: The SNP rs2108851, being in high linkage disequilibrium with rs11766288, demonstrated the same allelic effect direction, further supporting the detection of inter-line expression variation using village culture systems.
title: Village in a dish: a model system for population-scale hiPSC studies

finding: The SNP rs11766288 was noted for its association in previous studies with eQTL effects in hiPSCs, corroborated by findings in rs2108851 which indicated similar patterns in expression effects.
title: Village in a dish: a model system for population-scale hiPSC studies

finding: At the SNRPC locus, a novel SNP (chr7:30719820:G:A) was identified with a P-value of 5.42 × 10^-8, exhibiting a tight linkage (r² = 0.99) to the originally reported most significant SNP, suggesting it as a potential causal variant associated with the backfat thickness phenotype.
title: PHARP: A pig haplotype reference panel for genotype imputation

finding: At the GRM4 locus, a novel missense variant (chr7:30191165:T:C) was found with a P-value of 1.19 × 10^-7 and a high linkage (r² = 0.98) to the most significant SNP linked to backfat thickness, indicating its potential as a causal variant.
title: PHARP: A pig haplotype reference panel for genotype imputation

finding: At the PACSIN1 locus, a novel missense variant (chr7:30509485:C:G) was identified with a P-value of 8.91 × 10^-8 and high linkage (r² = 0.98) to the most significant SNP for backfat thickness, suggesting it might be a causal variant.
title: PHARP: A pig haplotype reference panel for genotype imputation

finding: Also at the PACSIN1 locus, another novel missense variant (chr7:30509543:C:G) was found with a P-value of 8.91 × 10^-8 and a very strong linkage (r² = 0.98) to its corresponding significant SNP, indicating the possibility of it being a causal variant.
title: PHARP: A pig haplotype reference panel for genotype imputation

finding: At this location, a significant SNP (chr7:30250983:G:C) was recognized with a P-value of 6.08 × 10^-8, which was associated with backfat thickness and served as a significant anchor for the related causal variants at the PACSIN1 locus.
title: PHARP: A pig haplotype reference panel for genotype imputation

finding: For this locus, another SNP (chr7:30497108:T:C) was associated with backfat thickness, showing a P-value of 1.44 × 10^-8, indicating its potential importance as a causal variant in conjunction with other identified variants at the PACSIN1 locus.
title: PHARP: A pig haplotype reference panel for genotype imputation
